Description: Fragrant and refined, this stunning red opens with captivating aromas of woodland berry, rose, violet, ground spice and a whiff of new leather. On the firm, elegantly structured palate, taut refined tannins intertwine with succulent red cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and chopped herb while fresh acidity lends balance. It's already tempting but still young so give the tannins a few more years to unwind. Drink 2021–2034.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Asili Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, fragrant blue flower, baking spice and a balsamic note of menthol shape the nose. Structured and focused, the tense palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and cinnamon while taut, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide the backbone. It has a youthfully austere finish that promises great aging potential. Drink 2022–2036.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Montefico Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Forest floor, new leather, rose and red-berry aromas mingle with a whiff of camphor. Youthfully austere, the taut palate shows serious aging potential, presenting juicy cherry, cranberry, star anise and orange slice set against tightly knit, noble tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Rabajà Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Forest floor, red-skinned berry, leather and tobacco aromas mingle with a balsamic note. The focused, structured palate delivers juicy Morello cherry, raspberry compote and licorice while a graphite note backs up the finish. A backbone of fine-grained tannins and bright acidity gives it an age-worthy structure. Drink 2021–2034.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Montestefano Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: New leather, camphor, red-berry and rose aromas lead the way on this vibrant red. The medium-bodied palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate and white pepper accompanied by bright acidity and polished fine-grained tannins that lead to a firm finish.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Rio Sordo Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Lovely aromas of perfumed berry, rose petal, aromatic herb and baking spice set the tone on this fragrant red. The ethereally elegant, medium-bodied palate is all about finesse and balance, delivering succulent red cherry, juicy raspberry, cinnamon and a dash of white pepper. It's nicely balanced, with polished tannins and fresh acidity. It's already accessible but will also age well over the next several years or more. Drink through 2026.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Ovello Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Menthol, woodland-berry and crushed herb aromas slowly take shape on this fragrant red. The savory palate doles out juicy Morello cherry, cranberry and licorice while bright acidity and polished tannins provide seamless support. Drink through 2029.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Pora Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Violet, wild-berry and ground clove aromas take center stage while the medium-bodied palate shows juicy cherry, raspberry compote and star anise. Vibrant acidity and refined tannins provide an elegant framework. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Pajè Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Elegantly structured, this vibrant wine opens with aromas of underbrush, rose petal, red woodland berry and a whiff of new leather. The graceful palate boasts great energy and is delicately delicious, delivering juicy red cherry, pomegranate, star anise and white pepper. Polished tannins show some grip on the lingering finish. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014 Muncagota Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of truffle, smoke, leather and wild berry take center stage. Boasting an earthy elegance, the medium-bodied palate offers dried cherry, cranberry, star anise and a hint of game set against grainy tannins that leave a firm drying finish. It's still rather austere and needs a few more years to unwind. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Rivetto 2015 Marcarini  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas of steeped prune and baking spice that carry over to the full-bodied palate along with cherries marinated in spirits and star anise. Fine-grained tannins provide the framework and lend finesse.
Name: Scerscè 2013 Infinito  (Sforzato di Valtellina)

Description: Aromas of ripe red berry, baking spice and a whiff of pressed violet lift out of the glass. Ethereal and savory, the bright racy palate offers crushed strawberry, red cherry and white pepper alongside lithe silky tannins and vibrant acidity. It's rather light bodied but delicious. Drink through 2022.
Name: Scerscè 2014 Essenza  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Aromas of red cherry, crushed rock and a whiff of camphor shape the nose. It's bright and supple, offering juicy strawberry, alpine herb, star anise and a hint of graphite alongside lithe tannins. It's easygoing and savory and made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.
Name: Scerscè 2016 Nettare  (Valtellina)

Description: Made with Nebbiolo, this bright sparkler offers delicate aromas of wild berry, bread crust, crushed aromatic herb and a hint of acacia honey. The aromas carry over to the vibrant palate along with citrus zest and ginger set against a lively continuous perlage. It's balanced, with fresh acidity.
Name: Cascina Ballarin NV Punte dei Tre Ciabot Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: Toasted bread crust, orchard fruit, wild berry and crushed herb aromas carry over to the vibrant palate along with citrus zest and bitter walnut. A racy perlage and firm acidity provide lively support.
Name: Rivetto NV Metodo Classico Dosaggio Zero Kaskal Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas of bread crust, hazelnut, citrus and wild herb are front and center. On the racy linear palate, a lively perlage and vibrant acidity underscore white cherry, nectarine and tangerine.
Name: Travaglini 2013 Metodo Classico Nebolé Dosaggio Zero Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually yields suggestions of yellow stone fruit, bread crust and a whiff of grilled herb. The aromas carry over to the vibrant palate along with cedar and orange zest. A bitter almond note marks the close.
Name: Franco Conterno NV Metodo Classico Punta Extra Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: This lightly hued, onion-colored wine has aromas reminiscent of dried herb, bread crust and toasted nut. The firm racy palate offers acacia honey, candied citrus zest and dried exotic fruit alongside a bitter walnut note. It also has vibrant acidity and lively, steely bubbles.
Name: Enzo Boglietti NV Brut Rosé Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: Truffle, burnt match, toasted bread crust and grilled herb aromas lead the nose. On the racy palate, thyme and bitter walnut accent smoke and pomegranate alongside a lively perlage and bright acidity. It ends on a slightly candied note.
Name: La Kiuva NV Metodo Classico Traverse Extra Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from Luna Matta Vineyard was fermented in amphora and remains very young, with structure and acidity needing much more patience. Aromas of wet river stone, lilacs and bright red fruit lead into an herbal-laced palate of bright raspberry. Drink 2021–2036.
Name: Desparada 2016 Dione.8.Nh4 Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vino Rosso d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Young and juicy, this bright red opens with aromas of wild red berry, tilled soil and dark culinary spice. It's vibrant and savory, delivering mouthfuls of juicy black cherry, crushed strawberry, white pepper and clove framed in lithe tannins. Drink now to capture the succulent fruit.
Name: Villa Guelpa 2016 Longitudine 8.26 Nebbiolo (Vino Rosso d'Italia)

Description: Rose, violet, red-berry and baking-spice aromas mingle with a whiff of menthol on this compelling gorgeous red. The vibrant full-bodied palate is all about flair and finesse, delivering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of tobacco framed in taut fine-grained tannins. Young and intense, it will be ideal after a few more years of aging but will continue to develop for decades. Drink 2023–2040.
Name: Gaja 2015 Costa Russi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, pipe tobacco, a hint of menthol and a whiff of blue flower slowly take shape in the glass. Full bodied, with the firm's hallmark finesse, the smooth savory palate boasts succulent morello cherry, raspberry compote, star anise, clove and crushed mint. It has great length and is impeccably balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Gorgeous. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Gaja 2015 Sorì San Lorenzo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Woodland berry, blue flower, sunbaked soil and a whiff of dark spice shape the nose. Structured and extremely elegant, the focused, impeccable palate doles out juicy red cherry, strawberry, baking spice and star anise set against taut polished tannins that provide seamless support. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity. It's already tempting but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Gaja 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Enticing aromas of star anise, blue flower, wild berry, menthol and a whiff of new leather all come together on this gorgeous elegantly structured red. The full-bodied creamy palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, baking spice, licorice and tobacco framed in fine-grained tannins that offer seamless support. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Albino Rocca 2015 Ovello Vigna Loreto  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, leather, dark spice and menthol aromas shape the nose on this radiant red along with forest berry. The vibrant chiseled palate mirrors the nose, evoking wild strawberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and chopped mint. Firm polished tannins and bright acidity lend balance and tension. It's a stunning wine, loaded with class and finesse. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Antoniolo 2013 Osso San Grato  (Gattinara)

Description: Full-bodied and focused, this gorgeous wine opens with enticing scents of dark-skinned berry, pipe tobacco, truffle, new leather and a whiff of camphor. Savory and structured, the palate presents succulent red cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and baking spice accompanied by firm fine-grained tannins. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Rizzi 2013 Boito Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This offers aromas of exotic spice, fragrant blue flower, dark-skinned fruit and menthol. On the savory palate, taut fine-grained tannins support mature black cherry, blood orange, licorice, vanilla and hint of game while fresh acidity lends tension. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Faset  (Barbaresco)

Description: The nose is initially shy but slowly reveals wild berry, exotic incense, aromatic herb and a whiff of toast. The firm palate is more expressive and is all about elegance, delivering crushed red cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and star anise while taut, fine-grained tannins provide support. It's extremely young but already tempting so hold for even more complexity and to let the tannins unwind. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Sottimano 2015 Cottà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this radiant red has lovely aromas of woodland berry, violet, new leather, aromatic herb and a whiff of pipe tobacco. Firmly structured, the vibrant focused palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry, licorice and clove framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Sottimano 2015 Pajorè  (Barbaresco)

Description: Licorice, clove, new leather and tobacco aromas mingle with rose, chopped herb and woodland berry. Structured and savory, the vibrant, precise palate shows juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry, star anise and menthol alongside youthfully assertive but elegant tannins. An iron note lingers on the close. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Antoniolo 2013 San Francesco  (Gattinara)

Description: This opens with aromas of ripe berry, crushed herb, scorched soil and dark culinary spice. Mirroring the nose, the firm full-bodied palate evokes juicy Marasca cherry, black raspberry, star anise and clove. Taut, tightly knit and noble tannins provide the framework. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Giuseppe Cortese 2015 Rabajà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Enticing scents of dark spice, menthol, wild berry, new leather and a whiff of violet are front and center. It's structured, savory and shows real aging potential, delivering juicy raspberry, red cherry, licorice and tobacco. Taut noble tannins and fresh acidity provide support. It's still young and youthfully austere so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Poderi Colla 2015 Roncaglie  (Barbaresco)

Description: This fragrant red has classic varietal aromas of wild rose, red berry, dark spice and a whiff of camphor. It's full bodied and polished, delivering juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and white pepper alongside taut refined tannins. It's still young, with great tension so give it time to develop even more complexity. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Ugo Lequio 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of woodland berry, rose petal, iris, pipe tobacco and an earthy whiff of new leather make for a compelling fragrance. The polished structured palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and baking spice set against firm fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity gives it balance and tension. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Piero Busso 2014 Albesani Vigna Borgese  (Barbaresco)

Description: New leather, exotic spice, camphor and fragrant blue-flower aromas mingle with an earthy whiff of underbrush. On the savory palate, taut tightly knit fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide the backbone for juicy red cherry, cranberry, licorice and cinnamon. It's still young and primary so give it a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Piero Busso 2014 San Stunet  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, scorched earth, star anise, crushed herb and a whiff of toasted hazelnut pave the way on this poised full-bodied red. The structured palate boasts remarkable elegance, evoking juicy Marasca cherry, black raspberry, licorice and graphite alongside fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it well balanced and imparts youthful tension. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Gaja 2015 Sorì Tildin  (Barbaresco)

Description: Intense aromas of rose, woodland berry, dark spice and an earthy whiff of new leather are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant full-bodied red. Boasting ripe fruit and energy, the polished, structured palate doles out juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper. Firm refined tannins and fresh acidity provide an age-worthy structure. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Rizzi 2015 Nervo  (Barbaresco)

Description: This fragrant and structured red opens with alluring scents of crushed rose, baking spice, wild berry and a whiff of menthol. Full bodied and elegant, the focused palate delivers succulent red cherry, crushed strawberry, orange zest, licorice and white pepper framed in taut refined tannins. Fresh acidity lends tension and keeps it balanced. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Cascina delle Rose 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, dark berry, new leather and a whiff of camphor waft out of the glass. The tense chiseled palate evokes Marasca cherry, raspberry, star anise and a hint of cinnamon alongside polished fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Gaja 2014 Conteisa  (Barolo)

Description: Beautiful aromas of fragrant blue flower, rose, perfumed berry and dark spice form the nose. Juicy and elegantly structured, the savory focused palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, black raspberry, licorice and a hint of tobacco. Taut polished tannins provide the framework while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Rizzi 2015 Pajorè  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant and focused, this offers tantalizing aromas of rose, violet, woodland berry and Asian incense. Firm and linear, the chiseled palate evokes red cherry, cranberry, star anise and a hint of white pepper set against tightly wound fine-grained tannins. It's still young and austere but balanced, with vibrant acidity. Give it ample time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Sottimano 2015 Currà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Compelling aromas of fragrant blue flower, red berry, crushed herb, new leather and tilled earth shape the nose. On the savory, full-bodied palate, taut, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity frame flavors of ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. It's young but already boasts a fantastic combination of elegance and structure. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Elvio Cogno 2015 Bordini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Chopped mint, fragrant blue-flower and woodland berry aromas form an alluring potpourri. Firmly structured but exceedingly elegant, the chiseled palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and cake spice. Taut refined tannins and fresh acidity provide the framework. It's already almost accessible but will age well for years. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Pertinace 2015 Nervo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Forest floor, woodland berry, crushed herb and dark culinary-spice aromas set the tone. The tight focused palate offers crushed strawberry, red cherry, licorice and a hint of exotic spice while firm fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Albino Rocca 2015 Angelo  (Barbaresco)

Description: This stunning, structured red has lovely floral and spice aromas of iris, violet and cinnamon that take center stage while red berry and menthol float in the background. Full bodied and extremely elegant, the tight polished palate delivers ripe morello cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and nutmeg framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Albino Rocca 2015 Cottà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Delicate tantalizing scents of woodland berry, rose petal, iris and exotic spice mingle with new leather and a balsamic whiff of cedar. The palate is ethereal, delivering cranberry, red cherry, star anise, brown pepper and crushed herb alongside tight fine-grained tannins. It's still youthfully austere and needs time to come around and develop even more complexity. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Cascina delle Rose 2015 Tre Stelle  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of iris, rose red berry and baking spice lead the way. On the full-bodied but seemingly weightless palate, firm close-grained tannins support dried morello cherry, licorice and clove alongside a savory, almost salty note. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Albino Rocca 2015 Ronchi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant blue flower, dark spice, perfumed berry and cedar are just some of the aromas you'll find on this elegant red. The structured savory palate delivers crushed raspberry, black cherry, blood orange, white pepper and licorice framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of rose, violet and red berry mingle with scents of dark culinary spice. The juicy savory palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, cake spice and licorice. It has great tension and elegance thanks to fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Cigliuti 2014 Serraboella  (Barbaresco)

Description: Rose, violet, ripe berry, truffle, menthol and exotic spice aromas form and enticing fragrance. The delicious structured palate doles out succulent black cherry, wild raspberry, licorice and cinnamon while tightly knit fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. Fresh acidity gives it balance and tension. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Fontanafredda 2015 Coste Rubin  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, baking spice, tilled soil, red berry and new leather shape the nose. It's taut, tense and loaded with finesse, evoking juicy red berry, licorice, blood orange and clove framed in bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. An iron note marks the close. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Ioppa 2013 Balsina  (Ghemme)

Description: Mature black-skinned fruit, baking spice, leather, violet and an earthy whiff of game take center stage. The firm savory palate mirrors the nose, doling out ripe Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, licorice and the same gamy note as the nose. A backbone of bright acidity and youthfully assertive fine-grained tannins provides the framework. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Piero Busso 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This boasts an intense fragrance composed of graphite, pressed rose, star anise, new leather, crushed herb and dark spice aromas. The enveloping palate doles out juicy cherry, cranberry, licorice and white pepper framed in tight fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2014 Albesani  (Barbaresco)

Description: Crushed mint, wild berry and pressed rose aromas mingle with a whiff of pipe tobacco. On the juicy, savory palate, lithe, polished tannins and bright acidity seamlessly support succulent Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, orange zest, star anise and baking spice. Delicious and already almost accessible, it also offers good mid-term aging potential.
Name: Cigliuti 2014 Vie Erte  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, woodland berry, camphor and wild herb lift out of the glass. Vibrant and focused, the linear elegant palate delivers crushed strawberry, red cherry, white pepper and star anise set against taut refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and tension. It's still youthfully tense and needs a few more years to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2020–2033.
Name: Antoniolo 2013  Gattinara

Description: Dark spice, red fruit, tobacco and menthol aromas lead the way. Firmly structured and linear, the elegant palate delivers pomegranate, cranberry, licorice and a hint of espresso set against bright acidity and tightly wound fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with a potpourri of red berry, rose, menthol and exotic spice aromas. Juicy and elegantly structured, the smooth palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, ripe strawberry, white pepper and star anise. Taut but polished tannins provide the framework. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Musso 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has classic Nebbiolo aromas of dark-skinned berry, fragrant blue flower, baking spice, new leather and menthol. The firm focused palate delivers dried black cherry, cranberry, licorice and white pepper set against a backbone of youthfully austere fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Sottimano 2015 Fausoni  (Barbaresco)

Description: This fragrant red has classic varietal aromas of red berry, cake spice, new leather and a whiff of rose. The firmly structured, youthfully austere palate offers sour cherry, crushed strawberry and star anise. Tight knit fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity give it balance and an age-worthy structure. Drink after 2025.
Name: Castello di Verduno 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Violet, pipe tobacco, woodland berry and sandalwood aromas form an enticing bouquet. It's linear and radiant, delivering cranberry, red cherry, cake spice, star anise and chopped herb. Firm, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Sottimano 2015 Basarin  (Barbaresco)

Description: Exotic spice, crushed violet, wild berry and camphor aromas set the tone on this savory red. It's both elegant and firmly structured, offering ripe Marasca cherry, black raspberry and licorice framed in close-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Castello di Neive 2015  Barbaresco

Description: This opens with enticing scents of fragrant blue flower, chopped mint, woodland berry and a whiff of exotic spice. Linear and elegantly structured, the vibrant, focused palate delivers crushed raspberry, juicy red cherry, licorice and baking spice. Taut fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide seamless support and balance. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Ceretto 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, cedar, menthol and crushed herb aromas take center stage in this full-bodied red. It's savory and enveloping, with firm polished tannins that support succulent flavors of black cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Demarie 2015  Barbaresco

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rose petals, crushed rocks, rounded red plum and nutmeg show strongly on the compelling nose of this bottling. It's very level on the palate, with tight tannins carrying bright fruit, rosewater and purple-flower flavors. With time, there will be smoother texture and more baking-spice flavors. Drink 2021–2035.
Name: Giornata 2015 Luna Matta Vineyard Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)

Description: Rose, woodland berry, chopped herb and a whiff of smoke lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the smooth full-bodied palate delivers crushed morello cherry, orange zest, star anise and a hint of game while fine-grained tannins lend polished support. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Nada Giuseppe 2015 Casot  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, fragrant blue flower, tilled soil and ground spice aromas propel out of the glass. Structured but understated and elegant, the focused palate delivers mature cherry, star anise and a tobacco note alongside taut, refined tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Rizzi 2015 Rizzi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Menthol, rose, wild berry, aromatic herb and new leather aromas form the nose on this fragrant red. Juicy and linear, the palate doles out black raspberry, cherry compote, licorice and baking spice. It's structured and balanced, with taut polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2013 Basarin  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas of wild rose, perfumed berry, exotic spice, leather and a whiff of vanilla. It's taut and medium bodied, offering sour cherry, pomegranate, star anise and mint framed in tight fine-grained tannins that leave a firm, slightly drying finish. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Antoniolo 2013 La Castelle  (Gattinara)

Description: Rose petal, dark spice and camphor aromas slowly take shape in the glass along with a whiff of tar. Juicy and delicious, the smooth full-bodied palate has a weightless elegance, delivering succulent Marasca cherry, ripe raspberry, licorice and tobacco while fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of dark spice, menthol and ripe black-skinned fruit lead the nose. The firm powerful palate is still young and austere, offering morello cherry, cranberry and tobacco set against tightly knit close-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2032.
Name: Barale Fratelli 2015 Serraboella  (Barbaresco)

Description: Menthol, woodland berry, blue flower and a whiff of ground pepper lead the nose. Vibrant and linear, the savory elegant palate has good intensity, offering juicy red cherry, pomegranate, star anise and a hint of tobacco. Taut fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide structure and balance. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Baking-spice, prune and wild herb aromas lead the nose on this brawny red. Concentrated but elegant, the structured full-bodied palate doles out raspberry compote, cherry marinated in spirits and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Travaglini 2012 Il Sogno  (Gattinara)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of forest floor, woodland berry, blue flower and a whiff of game. Reflecting the nose, the taut chewy palate offers juicy black cherry, truffle and dark culinary spice alongside firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Reyna  (Barbaresco)

Description: Iris, woodland berry and a whiff of new leather are just some of the intense, enticing aromas that you'll find on this elegant red. Smooth and structured, the focused palate offers red cherry, cranberry, licorice and a note of white pepper framed in taut tannins.
Name: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2015 Sanadaive  (Barbaresco)

Description: Racy and focused, this has aromas of exotic spice, coconut and star anise. The aromas carry over to the elegantly structured linear palate along with sour cherry and cranberry set against fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2014 Ovello  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, fragrant blue flower, cake spice and a whiff of camphor pave the way. Linear, structured and elegant, the palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and a hint of tobacco. It's still young but already well balanced, with fresh acidity and youthfully austere but refined tannins. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2015 Rambone  (Barbaresco)

Description: Menthol, dark-skinned berry, violet and dark culinary spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this elegantly structured red. The savory polished palate delivers juicy black cherry, licorice, tobacco and a hint of espresso set against fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2015 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)

Description: Toast, pressed rose, dark spice and wild berry aromas form the nose. Polished and structured, the elegant palate delivers raspberry compote, sour cherry, licorice and a hint of tobacco framed in taut fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Pio Cesare 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Invigorating aromas of red berry, wild mint, camphor and a whiff of rose lead the nose on this radiant red. Focused and elegant, the savory palate doles out juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, orange zest and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. It's ethereal and ready to enjoy now, but will also offer several years of drinking pleasure. Drink now–2025.
Name: Prunotto 2015  Barbaresco

Description: This taut structured red has aromas of woodland berry, baking spice, forest floor and crushed stone. The medium-bodied, focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, strawberry, white pepper and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. A mineral note of crushed oyster shell lingers on the close. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Ca' Nova 2010  Ghemme

Description: Fragrant blue flower, wild berry and crushed herb mingle with exotic spice aromas. Firmly structured and tense, the full-bodied palate evokes red cherry, cranberry, star anise and blood orange set against youthfully assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Castello di Neive 2015 Albesani Santo Stefano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant blue flower, aromatic herb and a whiff of camphor come together in the glass. The focused, elegant palate delivers juicy red cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise alongside polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Ioppa 2013 Santa Fè  (Ghemme)

Description: Intense and alluring aromas of iris, violet and strawberry take center stage. It's juicy and elegant, doling out Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, baking spice and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2015 Tradizione  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, underbrush, tilled earth and leather aromas mingle with balsamic whiffs of eucalyptus. The savory full-bodied palate is also earthy, offering ripe black cherry, raspberry, tobacco and a hint of game set against rather lively acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Albino Rocca 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, camphor, star anise and forest floor aromas lead the way. Smooth and elegant, the taut polished palate doles out dried cherry, blood orange, licorice and tobacco while fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Cascina Luisin 2015 Rabajà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Made entirely with Nebbiolo, this offers aromas of underbrush, new leather, scorched earth and camphor. On the firm, linear palate, taut fine-grained tannins support dried Marasca cherry, star anise, white pepper and tobacco. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2032.
Name: Centovigne 2012 Castellengo Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Aromas of exotic spice, menthol, blue flower and a whiff of woodland berry come together on the fragrant, elegantly structured wine. The tight focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, pomegranate, licorice, clove and a hint of espresso alongside firm close-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Oddero 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, menthol, new leather and a whiff of pipe tobacco lead the nose. Elegantly structured, the tight linear palate offers crushed raspberry, red cherry and star anise framed in firm fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. It's still youthfully austere and will be even better in a few more years. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Antica Casa Vinicola Scarpa 2013 Tettineive  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of French oak, underbrush, dried herb and a whiff of woodland berry lead the nose. The taut linear palate is still youthfully austere, offering sour cherry, cranberry and star anise alongside tightly knit, close-grained tannins that leave a firm dry finish. Give this plenty of time to come around. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Castello di Neive 2013 Albesani Santo Stefano Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Scorched earth, leather, underbrush and a balsamic note of camphor slowly take shape on this. The palate is lean-bodied and focused, offering sour cherry, cranberry and a hint of baking spice alongside fine-grained tannins and surprisingly bright acidity given the hot vintage. Give it time to fully come around. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Prunotto 2015 Bric Turot  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, violet, clove and aromatic herb aromas lead the way on this fragrant red. It's polished and delicious, doling out juicy raspberry, Marasca cherry and star anise alongside lithe tannins and bright acidity. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon to capture the succulent fruit.
Name: Antoniolo 2016 Juvenia Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Aromas of exotic spice, crushed mint and iris lead the nose. It's firmly structured, delivering dried cherry, cranberry, licorice and espresso alongside tight fine-grained tannins. You'll also find a note of powdered sage on the firm close. It's still youthfully austere and needs time to unwind. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Cascina Luisin 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)

Description: Pressed rose, wild berry, new leather and camphor aromas slowly appear on this polished, structured red. The taut palate delivers black cherry, crushed raspberry and star anise set against tightly knit, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Cascina Luisin 2015 Paolin  (Barbaresco)

Description: Baking-spice, violet, wild berry and grilled herb aromas form the nose. The polished linear palate evokes dried cherry, blood orange, licorice and vanilla alongside dusty tannins that leave a rather drying finish.
Name: Ca' Nova 2009 Riserva  (Ghemme)

Description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, fragrant blue flower, camphor and exotic spice aromas leap out of the glass. The palate is full bodied but also shows restraint, offering dried black cherry, truffle and licorice alongside taut close-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Socré 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Crushed herb, camphor, new leather and woodland berry aromas lead the nose. The linear vibrant palate shows sour cherry, cranberry and star anise in youthfully assertive close-grained tannins that leave a rather drying finish.
Name: Bersano 2015 Mantico  (Barbaresco)

Description: Woodland berry, iris, violet, game and a whiff of tilled earth form the nose. The taut light-bodied palate offers juicy red cherry, star anise and a hint of rusted iron alongside tight polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: Fontanafredda 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Made with 85% Nebbiolo and 15% Vespolina, this has aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, pressed rose, chopped herb and balsamic notes. The linear medium-bodied palate offers Marasca cherry, pomegranate, blood orange and white pepper alongside taut fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Ioppa 2013  Ghemme

Description: Pipe-tobacco, blue-flower and menthol aromas escape the glass along with an earthy hint of cured meats. It's linearly structured and racy, offering crushed raspberry, strawberry compote and licorice along with an earthy hint of game on the salty finish. Fine-grained tannins provide support.
Name: Socré 2014 Roncaglie  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of toast, underbrush, roasted coffee bean and a whiff of camphor lead the nose. It's taut and rather light bodied, showing sour cherry, cranberry, espresso and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Ceretto 2015 Bernadot  (Barbaresco)

Description: Perfumed berry, menthol, pipe tobacco and blue flower are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant red. It's ethereal and racy, offering cranberry, sour cherry and baking spice set against an acidic backbone and taut fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to fully come together. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: La Spinona 2014 Bricco Faset  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, pressed rose-petal, grilled porcini and red-berry aromas take shape in the glass. The taut tense palate delivers dried cherry, licorice, clove and tobacco set against clenching, close-grained tannins that dry out the finish. Give it time to fully unwind and develop. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Orlando Abrigo 2013 Rongalio Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of French oak, blue flower, camphor and dark spice lead the nose. On the palate, close-grained tannins provide the backbone for dried cherry, orange rind, grilled herb, game and clove. It has a firm, extremely drying finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Orlando Abrigo 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

Description: Blue-flower, clove, licorice and wild berry aromas mingle with a whiff of menthol. Linear and full bodied, the palate offers dried black cherry, cranberry, star anise and tobacco framed in taut close-grained tannins that leave a firm, drying finish. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Bel Colle 2015 Pajorè  (Barbaresco)

Description: Exotic spice, coconut, dark-skinned berry and camphor aromas come together in the glass. It's still young and primary, offering black cherry, plum, vanilla and licorice alongside tight-knit fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2025.
Name: Musso 2015 Pora  (Barbaresco)

Description: Grilled herb, forest floor, dark spice and menthol aromas come together on this. Oak-driven spice powers the austere tightly knit palate, while dried cherry, orange zest and powdered sage stay in the background. Extremely firm close-grained tannins clench the finish.
Name: La Spinetta 2015 Starderi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Blue- flower, red woodland berry, wild herb and dark culinary-spice aromas lead the nose. The solid palate delivers ripe black cherry, star anise and clove hint of carob alongside tightly knit close-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Pertinace 2015 Marcarini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Opening with aromas of wild red berry, tilled earth and blue flower, this fresh, young Nebbiolo demonstrates the grape's more easygoing side. It's bright and silky, with juicy red-cherry, raspberry and star anise flavors accompanied by lithe tannins and tangy acidity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Travaglini 2016 Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Wild berry, baking spice and blue-flower aromas come together on this linear red. The rather lean-bodied palate evokes sour cherry, blood orange and espresso alongside taut, close-grained tannins.
Name: Ceretto 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Dark baking spice, forest floor, camphor and dark berry aromas lead the nose. On the full-bodied palate, you'll find dried black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Grainy tannins give it a somewhat drying finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink.
Name: Francone 2015 I Patiarchi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Charred earth, grilled herb, espresso and French oak aromas mingle with whiffs of violet and menthol. The tight austere palate offers dried cherry, star anise, blood orange and roasted coffee bean alongside astringent tannins that leave an extremely firm, mouth drying finish.
Name: La Spinetta 2015 Valeirano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Chopped herb, red-berry and blue-flower aromas lift out of the glass along with a funky whiff of farmyard. The lean-bodied linear palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate, clove and a hint of iron alongside racy acidity and pliant tannins.
Name: Anzivino 2013  Gattinara

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, dark spice, coconut and a whiff of French oak shape the nose. The polished, straightforward palate offers dried cherry, licorice and a hint of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Francone 2013 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subtle aromas suggesting dark spice, wild berry and Alpine herb waft out of the glass. The palate is smooth and bright, offering dried cherry, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside buffed, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Pietro Cassina 2011 Ciuèt Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Aromas reminiscent of underbrush, tilled earth, red berry and crushed herb lead the way. The straightforward palate suggests dried cherry and fennel alongside solid but not extremely persistent tannins. It has a tight, mouth drying finish.
Name: Pertinace 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of stewed prune, underbrush and charred earth lead the nose. The palate is rather evolved, offering dried cherry, clove and grilled herb alongside solid, drying tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Pier 2011 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, scorched earth and dark culinary spice lead the nose. The polished taut palate offers dried Marasca cherry, clove and a hint of rusty iron alongside lithe tannins. Drink now to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Ioppa 2015 Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, toasted oak, scorched earth and a whiff of game. The tight palate evokes dried cherry, orange zest and oak-driven spice alongside firm grainy tannins that dry out the finish.
Name: Orlando Abrigo 2015 Meruzzano  (Barbaresco)

Description: You'll find fruity and floral aromas of wild red berry, violet and a whiff of clove on this medium-bodied red. The bright straightforward palate offers red cherry, orange zest and a hint of star anise alongside dusty, rather grainy tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Vite Colte 2015 La Casa in Collina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Weedy underbrush, crushed herb and camphor aromas take center stage. The bright straightforward palate evokes sour cherry, game and clove alongside smooth, pliant if not very persistent tannins and vibrant acidity. A note of powdered sage marks the close.
Name: Cantina Terre del Barolo 2014 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting scorched earth, camphor, pressed rose and an unusual whiff of chopped celery. The aromas follow over to the extremely firm, austere palate along with a notes of dried cherry, ground clove and toast. It's lean in terms of fruit richness and has assertive, grainy tannins that dry out the finish.
Name: La Spinetta 2015 Vigneto Bordini  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting scorched earth, camphor, pressed rose and an unusual whiff of chopped celery. The aromas follow over to the extremely firm, austere palate along with a notes of dried cherry, ground clove and toast. It's lean in terms of fruit richness and has assertive grainy tannins that dry out the finish.
Name: La Spinetta 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of scorched soil, chopped herb, menthol, overripe plum and a funky whiff evoking barnyard lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the rustic palate along with dried black cherry and a bitter note. Tight close-grained tannins leave a drying finish.
Name: Il Chiosso 2011  Gattinara

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The leather, sour cherry, spice, gummy bear, cedar and pencil eraser aromas don't seem entirely settled. Tart cherry flavors follow, with firm tannins backing them up.
Name: Wilridge 2014 Estate Wilridge Vineyard Nebbiolo (Naches Heights)

Description: Delicately scented, this has aromas evoking spring field flower, red berry, orchard fruit and a whiff of bread dough. On the racy palate, lively acidity and vivacious perlage underscore cranberry, pomegranate, and a hint of white pepper.
Name: Josetta Saffirio 2016 Brut Rosé  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: This lively sparkler opens with understated aromas suggesting chopped dill, wild berry and a whiff of toast. The vibrant palate delivers juicy red cherry, blood orange, nutmeg and a hazelnut note alongside a rather vigorous perlage and firm acidity.
Name: Parusso 2013 Metodo Classico Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: Rose, wild berry, crushed herb and hazelnut aromas take center stage. Vibrant and linear, the palate offers wild strawberry, pomegranate and clove alongside vibrant acidity and a lively perlage. It finishes on an almond note.
Designation: 460 n.8 Brut Rosé Pret-a-porter Metodo Classico
Name: Cascina Bric NV 460 n.8 Brut Rosé Pret-a-porter Metodo Classico  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: Made with native grape Nebbiolo, this racy, copper-colored sparkler has shy aromas suggesting rose, cranberry and citrus that mingle with a whiff of pastry dough. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity and a lively perlage provide the setting for sour cherry, lemon zest and medicinal herb.
Name: Cascina Bric 2014 460 Brut Nature Metodo Classico Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Description: Pressed rose, iris, new leather, exotic spice, menthol and a whiff of wild berry come to the forefront on this gorgeous wine. The full-bodied polished palate has a weightless elegance, delivering raspberry compote, crushed cherry, licorice, aromatic herb and a floral note alongside taut velvety tannins. It's already beautiful but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2011 Novantesimo Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This stunning Barolo from one of the most famed vineyards in the denomination opens with aromas of wild berry, new leather, pipe tobacco and a balsamic note of menthol. Succulent, full-bodied and smooth, the structured palate seamlessly combines elegance and power, delivering juicy morello cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and chopped mint. Firm polished tannins provide the impressive framework. Drink 2020–2032.
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2012 Vigna Rionda Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this gorgeous wine opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of woodland berry, wild rose, forest floor, pipe tobacco, dark spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol. Reflecting the nose, the delicious, structured palate delivers dried cherry, raspberry compote, truffle, star anise and a note of crushed mint. Firm but noble tannins provide the framework and bestow impressive aging potential. Drink 2022–2037.
Designation: Bricco Boschis Vigna San Giuseppe Riserva
Name: Cavallotto 2012 Bricco Boschis Vigna San Giuseppe Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Wild strawberry, pressed rose, dried aromatic herb and a potpourri of dark culinary spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this well-structured wine. On the tightly knit palate, taut yet polished tannins frame flavors of raspberry compote, black cherry, licorice, graphite and a hint of orange rind. It's balanced but still young, so give it a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Prunotto 2012 Riserva Bussia Vigna Colonnello  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, iris, baking spice, menthol, new leather and a whiff of truffle are just some of the enticing scents you'll find in this fragrant red. The palate is all about finesse and tension, offering wild strawberry, crushed raspberry, star anise and chopped mint framed by taut, refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: La Spinona 2013 Bergera  (Barolo)

Description: Pressed rose, sunbaked earth, aromatic herb, new leather, balsamic notes and a whiff of game are just some of the aromas you'll find on this multifaceted red. The full-bodied palate boasts structure and personality, delivering dried Marasca cherry, blood orange, star anise and tobacco set against a backbone of firm noble tannins. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Cavallotto 2012 Vignolo Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Intense aromas of rose petal, red berry, forest floor and mint emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and white pepper. It's well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Boffa 2015 Ovello  (Barbaresco)

Description: Enticing aromas of wild berry, white pepper, blue flower and menthol mingle together on this linear fragrant red. Reflecting the nose, the precise vibrant palate offers strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, aromatic herb and baking spice framed in taut, elegant tannins and bright acidity. It's all about finesse and balance, and will age and continue to develop for years. Drink 2020–2033.
Name: La Badina 2013  Lessona

Description: Alluring scents of dried rose, forest floor, crushed herb, woodland berry and dark spice come together on this fragrant red. The elegantly structured, focused palate delivers red cherry, crushed strawberry and star anise while a savory, almost salty mineral note lingers on the close. It's balanced, and still young, with youthfully taut, polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Villa Guelpa 2015  Lessona

Description: Aromas of menthol, balsamic herb, exotic spice and a floral note lead the nose. On the full-bodied palate, assertive close-grained tannins provide the backbone for dried black cherry, licorice and espresso. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Grimaldi Bruna 2012 Badarina Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Dark spice, crushed rose, Alpine herb and mature berry aromas appear in the glass. The structured, elegant palate delivers dried Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and tobacco set against firm noble tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance.
Name: Travaglini 2012 Riserva  (Gattinara)

Description: Iris, new leather, aromatic herb and dark spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant, focused red. The chiseled, elegantly structured palate is all about firm finesse, offering red cherry, cranberry, star anise, chopped mint and white pepper framed in taut refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Still youthfully austere, it's a classic Barolo reminiscent of times gone by, and will be even better in a few more years. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Brovia 2014 Unio  (Barolo)

Description: Forest floor, rose petal, wild herb and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus lead the nose. The palate is elegant and structured, offering strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise alongside polished tannins. A hint of crushed mint lingers on the finish while bright acidity lends balance. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Germano Ettore 2014 Prapò  (Barolo)

Description: New leather, menthol, woodland berry and tobacco aromas all come together on this focused red along with a floral note. The medium-bodied, firmly structured palate offers red cherry, cranberry and dark culinary spice set against tightly knit fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2034.
Name: Luigi Baudana 2014 Baudana  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, iris, red woodland berry and cake spice are just some of the alluring aromas you'll find on this radiant red. The vibrant elegant palate delivers succulent strawberry, red cherry, licorice and cinnamon alongside silky tannins. Bright acidity gives it impeccable balance. Drink through 2023.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013  Barbaresco

Description: Enticing scents of star anise, perfumed berry, blue flower and a whiff of menthol take center stage on this fragrant Barolo. The tense medium-bodied palate offers red cherry, strawberry, licorice, iron and a hint of balsamic herb framed in polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Giacomo Fenocchio 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, dark spice, new leather, forest floor and balsamic notes. On the firm palate, assertive, close-grained tannins support dried Marasca cherry, licorice, chopped aromatic herb and a hint of espresso before a rather drying finish. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Rivetto 2012 Leon Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing scents of violet, rose and wild berry mingle with aromatic herb and menthol notes. On the polished, elegantly structured palate, refined tannins and vibrant acidity support sour cherry, strawberry, mint and star anise. It's still youthfully austere and needs a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Borgogno 2013 Fossati  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, mint and tobacco emerge from the glass. The savory, balanced palate offers red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2015 Froi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Rose petal, iris, forest-floor and wild-berry aromas take shape in the glass. On the tense, vibrant palate, taut, polished tannins and racy acidity provide the backdrop for wild strawberry, red cherry, star anise and chopped mint. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Bava 2014 Scarrone  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, leather, red berry and a balsamic note lead the nose. The savory vibrant palate doles out crushed raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside close-grained, refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Fontanabianca 2015 Bordini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of carob, leather, dark spice, forest floor and balsamic notes slowly take shape in the glass. On the firmly structured palate, firm, noble tannins carry dried morello cherry, star anise, aromatic herb and tobacco. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Giacomo Fenocchio 2012 90 Dì  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, wild berry, a whiff of dried aromatic herb and dark-spice aromas delicately float from the glass. Elegantly structured, the tense, focused palate offers crushed raspberry, strawberry, white pepper and an almost salty note. Polished tannins and bright acidity give linear support. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: La Prevostura 2014  Lessona

Description: Enticing aromas of woodland berry, rose petal, underbrush and a balsamic note lead the nose. On the juicy, savory palate, notes of star anise, white pepper and mint accent a red-cherry core. It's well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Fontanabianca 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of red berry, violet, leather and a whiff of cake spice emerge from the glass. The savory balanced palate offers cranberry, star anise and cinnamon alongside fine-grained, youthful tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Boffa 2015 Paiè  (Barbaresco)

Description: Captivatingly fragrant, this offers scents of rose petal, iris, menthol, star anise and an earthy whiff of forest floor. It's vibrant and ethereally elegant, delivering red cherry, licorice and a hint of white pepper set against refined tannins and firm acidity. A salty mineral note closes the finish. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Brandini 2014 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, red berry and underbrush lead the nose. The juicy balanced palate evokes raspberry jam, red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Cascina Alberta 2015 Giacone  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of underbrush, red berry and new leather. The savory palate delivers red cherry, licorice and baking spice alongside firm tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Pietro Rinaldi 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: This fragrant red opens with aromas of wild berry, blue flower, menthol, and a whiff of exotic spice. The structured elegant palate offers raw strawberry, pomegranate, star anise and crushed mint alongside tense polished tannins and nervous acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Attilio Ghisolfi 2014 Bricco Visette  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of pressed rose, smoky flint, wild red berry and crushed aromatic herb slowly take shape on this polished, fragrant Nebbiolo. It's all about finesse, offering pomegranate, crunchy strawberry, white pepper and Lessona's hallmark salty finish. It's almost ethereal, with lithe tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2019–2029.
Name: Colombera & Garella 2014 Pizzaguerra  (Lessona)

Description: Woodland berry, blue flower, underbrush, tobacco and crushed herb aromas lead the way on this fragrant wine. It's ethereally elegant, delivering succulent red berry, star anise and tobacco alongside polished tannins and vibrant acidity. It's already almost accessible but also shows good mid-term aging potential. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: G D Vajra 2014 Bricco delle Viole  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing aromas of rose petal, red berry and cedar lead the nose. The juicy full-bodied palate doles out red cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Nada Giuseppe 2013 Casot Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of woodland berry, rose petal and mint slowly take shape on this. The juicy palate offers crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Pietro Rinaldi 2014  Barolo

Description: This fragrant red opens with aromas of rose petal, new leather, wild berry and menthol. The racy ethereal palate offers wild strawberry, sour cherry, star anise and thyme framed in polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Barale Fratelli 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and tobacco lift out of the glass. On the structured palate, firm acidity balances red cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and a sprinkling of nutmeg while fine-grained tannins leave a polished mouthfeel. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Cascina Bruciata 2013 Rio Sordo Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, red berry and tobacco lead the way. The juicy palate offers raspberry, white pepper and star anise set against firm tannins. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: La Ganghija 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Red berry, underbrush and tobacco aromas lead the nose. The savory palate offers red cherry, cinnamon and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Elio Filippino 2013 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has aromas suggesting dark-skinned berry, leather, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol. The solid palate shows morello cherry, cinnamon and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Antichi Poderi dei Gallina 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with varietal aromas of strawberry, new leather and tobacco. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside solid, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Boffa 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Made wholly with Nebbiolo, this opens with earthy aromas of crushed herb, star anise, menthol and woodland berry. Reflecting the nose, the linear palate delivers dried Marasca cherry, cranberry and clove framed in taut refined tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance while it closes on an iron note.
Name: Anzivino 2012  Gattinara

Description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, tilled soil, game and eucalyptus. The concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside austere tannins and solid acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Elio Filippino 2012 San Cristoforo Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, camphor, dried rose petal and a whiff of wild herb slowly take shape in the glass. On the elegantly structured, slender palate, lithe tannins and vibrant acidity offset strawberry compote, cranberry, clove and cinnamon. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Batasiolo 2014 Bussia Vigneto Bofani  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of tobacco, cedar and red berry emerge from the glass. The structured palate delivers red cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside youthfully vibrant, elegant tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Subtle aromas of violet, baking spice and red berry form the nose while the polished palate delivers dried black cherry, star anise and white pepper. Smooth tannins provide support. Drink through 2024.
Name: Demarie 2006 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of leather, dark berry, baking spice and a balsamic note lead the nose. The full-bodied palate doles out ripe black cherry, clove and sage alongside firm, ripe tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Elio Filippino 2008 San Cristoforo 10 Anni Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of red berry, leather and tobacco lead the nose. The savory palate offers raspberry, clove and star anise framed by polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Luca Bosio 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of dark berry, underbrush and cooking spice appear in the glass. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Ada Nada 2015 Rombone Elisa  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of leather, tilled soil and dark berry emerge from the glass. The savory medium-bodied palate delivers ripe red plum, clove and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Cascina Bruciata 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Wild berry, dark spice, new leather and truffle aromas take center stage along with a whiff of violet. The linear medium-bodied palate is on the racy side, offering cranberry, star anise and crushed herb alongside tight, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Viberti 2014 Buon Padre  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, red berry and underbrush emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, crushed raspberry and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Ada Nada 2015 Valeirano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild rose, red berry, new leather and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the way. On the taut palate, firm acidity provides the backbone for sour cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Attilio Ghisolfi 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, cooking spice, leather and a balsamic note come together on this full-bodied red. The concentrated palate offers dried Marasca cherry, clove and licorice alongside youthfully firm tannins and rather fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Ca' del Baio 2015 Vallegrande  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, chopped aromatic herb, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol lead the nose. The tight structured palate shows dried morello cherry, star anise, leather and clove set against firm, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins time to unwind then drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit. Drink after 2022.
Name: Castello di Verduno 2012 Monvigliero Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Leather, cedar and dark berry aromas lead the nose. The taut palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Col dei Venti 2015 Tufoblu  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of woodland berry, new leather and forest floor lead the nose. The savory palate offers red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Piazzo 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Woodland berry, tilled soil, dried rose, new leather and aromatic herb aromas come together in this fragrant, racy red. It's rather light in body and ethereal for Barolo, already accessible, offering flavors of tart sour cherry, clove and chopped dill. Firm acidity and polished tannins provide lithe support. Drink through 2025.
Name: Prunotto 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of eucalyptus, exotic spice, underbrush and aromatic herb lead the nose. The tightly knit palate offers cranberry, dried cherry, star anise and clove set against taut, close-grained tannins.
Name: Travaglini 2012 Tre Vigne  (Gattinara)

Description: Underbrush, crushed mint and dark-spice aromas lead the way. It's juicy and savory, doling out dried red cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside bright acidity and firm, refined tannins. A salty note marks the close.
Name: Boniperti 2016 Carlin Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)

Description: Underbrush, red berry and leather aromas unfold in the glass. The taut palate shows cranberry, clove, star anise and a crushed sage note alongside firm tannins that grip the finish. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Marrone 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of iris, leather, dark spice and a balsamic note lead the nose. The juicy slender palate offers cherry, pomegranate and white pepper alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Pietro Rinaldi 2014 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, scorched soil and leather emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers morello cherry, tobacco and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Cascina Saria 2015 Colle del Gelso  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas evoking baking spice, cedar and dark fruit slowly take shape on this full-bodied red. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Elio Filippino 2013 Serra Capelli Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Prune, leather and balsamic aromas appear in the glass. The aromas carry over to the rather tired palate along with dried cherry and a hint of baking spice. Dusty, grainy tannins give it a firm but not very persistent finish. Give the tannins a few more years to soften then drink to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Gigi Rosso 2014 Arione  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of violet, leather and truffle lead the nose. On the chewy palate, firm tannins accompany ripe Marasca cherry, clove and licorice. Drink after 2021.
Name: Pasquale Pelissero 2015 Cascina Crosa  (Barbaresco)

Description: Pressed violet, herb and camphor aromas shape the nose. The chewy palate delivers raspberry, black cherry and a hint of star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Prinsi 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of eucalyptus, underbrush and dark berry emerge from the glass. The solid palate evokes dark cherry, licorice and a hint of white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: San Biagio 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subtle, earthy aromas evoking underbrush, baking spice and dark berry set the tone. The linear palate shows dried black cherry, clove and ground pepper alongside firm, rather evolved tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Ada Nada 2013 Chicin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit, eucalyptus and espresso. The concentrated palate delivers raspberry jam, Marasca cherry, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside youthfully assertive tannins. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Collina Serragrilli 2015 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of cedar, menthol and dark berry emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers ripe black plum, mocha and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Elio Filippino 2013 Serra Capelli  (Barbaresco)

Description: Tense and linear, this offers pomegranate, clove, menthol and licorice flavors. Taut close-grained tannins provide the tight framework while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink after 2020.
Name: Fabio Zambolin 2015 Vallelonga Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

Description: Aromas of truffle, dark spice, chopped mint and whiffs of oak lead the nose. It's austere and rather lean, showing dried cherry, clove and a hint of rust alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish. Give the tannins several more years to unwind then drink sooner rather the later to capture the remaining fruit. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Vietti 2014 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Scorched earth, underbrush, grilled porcini, chopped herb and leather aromas take center stage. The earthy full-bodied palate evokes dried black cherry, prune, star anise and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside drying, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Batasiolo 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and a balsamic note emerge from the glass. The solid palate shows black cherry, star anise and clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Cascina Chicco 2014 Rocche di Castelletto  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, truffle, leather and game follow over to the firm palate along with dried cherry, prune, crushed herb and clove. Close-grained, drying tannins provide astringent support while it finishes on a rather salty note. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Batasiolo 2014 Boscareto  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, dark spice and black-skinned berry lead the nose. The dense palate evokes vanilla, black cherry jam and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ca' del Baio 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)

Description: Delicate aromas of rose petal, tilled soil and leather emerge from the glass. The round palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and vanilla alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: CarlindePaolo 2015  Barbaresco

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark berry, underbrush and botanical herb. The taut palate offers red cherry, white pepper and clove alongside firm acidity and assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Cascina Rabaglio 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, exotic spice and dark-skinned fruit mingle with a whiff of camphor. The assertive palate offers dried morello cherry, clove and star anise alongside firm acidity while tightly knit, close-grained tannins leave a somewhat astringent finish. It's still austere and needs time to fully develop. Drink after 2022.
Name: Damilano 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, pressed rose, truffle and leather are some of the aromas you'll find on this medium-bodied red. The already rather approachable palate offers dried cherry, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside fine-grained but rather drying tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Scarpa 2012 Tettimora  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of coconut, dark-skinned berry and exotic spice come together on this. The taut linear palate offers dried cherry, star anise, sage and a hint of espresso alongside brisk acidity and tight close-grained tannins that grip the close.
Name: Travaglini 2014  Gattinara

Description: Subtle aromas of leather, dark berry and underbrush lead the nose. The juicy palate offers black cherry, star anise and clove alongside firm tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Achille Viglione 2013 Jacco Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Red berry, cooking spice and leather aromas emerge from the glass. The solid palate offers crushed raspberry, blood orange and clove alongside austere, youthful tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Batasiolo 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of cedar, dark berry and eucalyptus shape the nose. The solid full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Battaglio 2015 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)

Description: Sawdust, oak-driven spice, dark-fruit and tobacco aromas slowly emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers espresso, licorice and cherry steeped in spirits alongside tightly packed tannins. Drink 2021–2026.
Name: Ca'Romè 2013 Maria di Brun Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of baking spice, dark berry and tilled earth lead the nose. The forward palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and green peppercorn alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Giacosa Fratelli 2015 Basarin Vigna Gianmatè  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with tobacco, dark berry and grilled herb aromas. The bracing palate offers dried black cherry, clove and licorice alongside tightly knit tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2021.
Name: Piazzo 2012 Nervo Vigna Giaia  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas of red berry, underbrush and tobacco. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, clove and a hint of black pepper alongside firm tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Piazzo 2014 Fratin  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose eventually gives up baking spice and dark-skinned fruit aromas. The solid palate offers clove, mature black plum and a hint of star anise alongside chewy tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Ca' del Baio 2015 Autinbej  (Barbaresco)

Description: Chamomile, thyme and bread aromas lift out of the glass. On the lean, vibrant palate, you'll find sour cherry, nectarine and bitter almond alongside firm acidity and a lively perlage.
Name: Cuvage NV Metodo Classico Brut Rosé  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: This has subtle aromas of pressed blue flower, baking spice and toasted oak. The dense but rather evolved palate evokes prune, clove and mocha alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Elio Filippino 2008 Serra Capelli 10 Anni Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of camphor, leather, forest floor, coconut and tobacco leaf take shape on this brawny red. The full-bodied, assertive palate evokes prune, sage, star anise and a salty note set against a backbone of drying close-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the firm, astringent close.
Name: Oddero 2012 Bussia Vigna Mondoca  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting ripe black plum, vanilla and coconut. The dense palate offers prune, mocha and star anise alongside forward tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Roberto Sarotto 2013 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Cedar, espresso and grilled herb aromas lead the nose. The assertive palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and toasted oak alongside raspy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ca'Romè 2013 Chiramanti Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of coconut, leather and camphor slowly take shape. The austere palate offers raw sour cherry, vanilla, espresso and nutmeg alongside tight, grainy tannins that leave a somewhat raspy finish.
Name: Negro Giuseppe 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and a whiff of dark berry lead the nose. The straightforward palate presents raspberry jam, clove and white pepper alongside taut tannins that lead to a grippy finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Salvano 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of dark berry, leather and underbrush emerge from the glass. The savory medium-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and black pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2014 Garassino  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting porcini mushroom, tilled soil, new leather and star anise that carry over to the austere palate along with clove, dried cherry and powdered sage. Tight close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide support. Drink 2019–2024.
Name: Batasiolo 2014 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with underbrush, mocha and dark-fruit aromas. The assertive palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and clove alongside bracing tannins that lead to a clenching finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Battaglio 2015  Barbaresco

Description: This opens with toasted oak, tobacco and dark-skinned fruit aromas. The taut palate offers sour cherry, mocha and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ca' del Baio 2013 Asili Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of pressed rose petal, tilled soil and cedar. The firm palate offers dried cherry, clove and a rather green note of powdered sage. Grippy tannins leave a firm, astringent finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ca'Romè 2015 Chiramanti  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of baking spice, tilled soil and ripe dark-skinned fruit lead the nose. The taut palate offers sour cherry, clove and tobacco alongside chewy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ceste 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Subdued aromas of dark fruit, coconut and baking spice slowly emerge from the glass. The firm palate delivers black plum, mocha and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Enrico Serafino 2015  Barbaresco

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, dark-skinned berry and cooking spice lead the nose. The solid straightforward palate offers black cherry and white pepper alongside rounded tannins. It's already accessible so drink through 2021.
Name: Rocca Felice 2015 Famiglia Lanzavecchia  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subtle aromas of underbrush and camphor emerge from the glass. The firm palate delivers licorice, roasted coffee bean and cranberry alongside bracing, somewhat astringent tannins.
Name: Ca'Romè 2013 Rio Sordo Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This offers subtle aromas of cedar, tobacco and dark-skinned fruit. The solid palate evokes dried cherry, licorice and clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: La Ganghija 2015 Giacosa  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of red berry, forest floor and baking spice take shape in the glass. The firm palate offers sour cherry, clove and white pepper alongside solid, youthfully assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: San Silvestro 2015 Magno  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals baking spice and dark-skinned-fruit aromas. The straightforward palate delivers dried black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside round tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2012 Bordino  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of dark fruit, baking spice and underbrush emerge from the glass. The linear palate offers sour cherry, clove and nutmeg alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Cantine Povero 2015 Batù  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of cedar, mocha and a whiff of dark fruit emerge from the glass. The tight palate offers sour cherry, vanilla and toast alongside raspy, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Pelissero 2015 Nubiola  (Barbaresco)

Description: Pressed violet, crushed herb and camphor aromas shape the nose. The chewy palate delivers crushed raspberry, black cherry and a hint of star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Araldica 2014 Corsini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Toasted oak, espresso and dark cooking spice lead the nose. The taut palate delivers raspberry jam, clove, vanilla and coffee alongside astringent tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Pelissero 2015 Tulin  (Barbaresco)
