Description: This opens with aromas suggesting hay, black plum and cooking spice. The taut palate offers sour cherry, clove and vanilla alongside close-grained, somewhat astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Prinsi 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals baking spice and dark-skinned fruit. On the linear palate, close-grained astringent tannins accompany sour cherry and clove. Drink after 2022.
Name: Rivata 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Racy and linear, this has aromas suggesting underbrush, tobacco leaf, moist soil, camphor and a whisper of rose. On the vibrant, ethereal palate, firm acidity and dusty tannins provide the backbone for tart cranberry, sour cherry and clove before a drying finish.
Name: Batasiolo 2014  Barolo

Description: Rose petal, camphor and moist soil aromas meld together with a whiff of star anise on this racy red. It's austere and lean, offering tart sour cherry, cranberry and clove alongside taut tannins and firm acidity.
Name: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting cedar and green peppercorn. The dense palate offers vanilla, espresso and mature plum alongside close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent finish.
Name: Icardi 2015 Starderi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, toasted oak and menthol lead the nose. The dense palate offers prune, mocha and coconut alongside grainy, assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Poderi Elia 2011 Serracapelli Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas of toasted oak, espresso and sage emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers hazelnut, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside assertive astringent tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Collina Serragrilli 2015 Starderi  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, weedy underbrush, crushed dill and a whiff of camphor. The firm palate is on the lean side, evoking tobacco leaf, star anise, powdered sage, oak and roasted coffee bean but it lacks fruit. Drying astringent tannins grip the close.
Name: La Spinetta 2014 Campè Vursù  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, toasted oak, crushed dill and balsamic aromas lead the nose. The assertive palate evokes dried sour cherry, clove and a bitter hint of powdered sage before grainy tannins leave a drying astringent finish. It doesn't have the fruit richness to stand up to the aggressive, drying wood tannins.
Name: La Spinetta 2014 Vigneto Garretti  (Barolo)

Description: Forest-floor, dark spice, toasted oak and menthol aromas lead the nose. The taut linear palate offers raw sour cherry, powdered sage and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside firm acidity and dusty, close-grained tannins that leave an abrupt drying finish. It's on the lean side in terms of fruit richness so let the tannins unwind for another few years then drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Batasiolo 2014 Briccolina  (Barolo)

Description: This has delicate scents of wild rose, underbrush and crushed mint while the taut, rather light-bodied palate offers cranberry, pomegranate and a hint of white pepper. Dusty tannins and racy acidity provide the setting.
Name: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2014  Barolo

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals toasted oak, scorched earth and a hint of spearmint. The assertive palate delivers coconut, sour cherry and espresso alongside grainy, astringent tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ca'Romè 2015 Maria di Brun  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas evoking toasted oak and mocha slowly appear in the glass. The tight assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, clove and licorice alongside raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Ca'Romè 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of coconut, toasted oak and menthol. The tightly wound palate offers raspberry jam, mocha and star anise alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins.
Name: Negro Giuseppe 2015 Pian Cavallo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas of dark fruit and baking spice slowly emerge from the glass. The taut palate delivers sour cherry, clove and espresso alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins.
Name: Pasquale Pelissero 2015 San Giuliano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Whiffs of exotic incense and white pepper accent berry and pastry dough aromas. On the bright, vigorously sparkling palate, vibrant acidity lifts raspberry compote, sour red cherry, candied citrus and a hint of ginger.
Name: San Silvestro 2014 Neboise Rosé Brut Metodo Classico  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, scorched earth and dark berry lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, clove and vanilla alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Torlasco 2015  Barbaresco

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals camphor, toasted oak and mocha aromas. The linear palate delivers raw cranberry, espresso and clove alongside taut rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Icardi 2015 Montubert  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals moist underbrush and camphor aromas. The simple palate offers raw sour cherry and a hint of licorice framed in tight, somewhat astringent tannins.
Name: Alasia 2014  Barbaresco

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee beans and coconut. The dense palate offers dried sage, prune, clove and espresso alongside grainy, astringent tannins.
Name: Pelissero 2015 Vanotu  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas of espresso, coconut and vanilla. The assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, clove and chewing tobacco set against grainy, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Poderi Elia 2014 Serracapelli  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of ripe dark fruit, coconut and baking spice. The dense palate offers prune, espresso and star anise alongside close-grained, rather evolved tannins. You can feel the heat of evident alcohol on the finish.
Name: Roberto Sarotto 2015 Currà  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals camphor, raisin and cooking spice. The tight palate offers prune, dark spice and mocha alongside firm drying tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Taliano 2011 Montersino Tera Mia Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Subdued aromas of chocolate-covered raisin, withered violet and camphor emerge from the glass. The raw palate offers espresso, coconut and prune while grainy, astringent tannins clench the finish.
Name: Taliano 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals raisin and candied-orange aromas. The extracted palate offers marinated prune, espresso and vanilla alongside grainy, astringent tannins.
Name: Roberto Sarotto 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this stunning red showcases Barolo's elegant side. It opens with enticing scents of rose, violet, perfumed berry and menthol while the radiant palate delivers cherry, cranberry, star anise and baking spice. It's impeccably balanced, with taut silky tannins and bright acidity that lend compelling tension. Absolutely gorgeous! Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Cantina Bartolo Mascarello 2013  Barolo

Description: From the stellar 2010 vintage, this gorgeous wine lives up to the year's lofty reputation. It opens with enticing scents of dried rose petal, truffle, crushed aromatic herb, woodland berry and a whiff of tar. On the full-bodied elegantly structured palate, star anise, mint, tobacco and a hint of mineral add depth to a juicy red-berry core. It's beautifully balanced, with bright acidity and taut silky tannins. Drink 2020–2040.
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2010 Cerequio Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, new leather, forest berry, dark spice and a whiff of fragrant blue flower are just some of the aromas you'll encounter on this gorgeous, multifaceted red. Structured but exceedingly elegant, the delicious palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. It's impeccably balanced, with noble tannins that lend tension and a velvety texture. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Massolino 2012 Vigna Rionda  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, camphor, new leather and forest berry form the nose. It's full bodied and firmly structured, offering Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and a hint of exotic incense. Youthfully assertive but noble tannins and vibrant acidity provide the ageworthy backbone. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2013 Perno Vigna Santo Stefano  (Barolo)

Description: Forest floor, dried rose petal, new leather, star anise and menthol aromas align with a potpourri of dark cooking spice. The full-bodied yet linear palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry, licorice and aromatic herb set against taut, elegant tannins. Vibrant acidity lends balance, tension and an ageworthy structure. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Elvio Cogno 2013 Ravera Bricco Pernice  (Barolo)

Description: Elegant and fragrant, this radiant wine opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of forest floor, crushed herb, dried rose, wild berry and a whiff of new leather. The focused, ethereal palate sneaks up on you, offering red cherry, spiced cranberry, wild strawberry and licorice alongside firm, refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance, energy and tension. It's still youthfully austere so give it time to develop even more complexity. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2013 Monprivato  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of camphor, crushed berry, dried rose, new leather and red berry form the quintessential Nebbiolo nose on this stunning ethereal wine. Elegantly structured and loaded with tension, the radiant palate delivers juicy red cherry, cranberry, star anise and tobacco framed in firm polished tannins. It's beautifully balanced, with bright acidity. It's already drinking beautifully but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2020–2040.
Name: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2010 Cà d'Morissio  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, truffle, exotic spice, camphor and new leather are just some of the aromas you'll encounter on this drop-dead gorgeous wine. It's round, full-bodied and juicy, offering delicious flavors of Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. Polished tannins provide support while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Borgogno 2013 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with an enticing intense bouquet of crushed mint, rose petal, violet, perfumed berry and a whiff of dark spice. Elegantly structured, the vibrant, savory palate delivers strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, licorice and cinnamon framed in taut polished tannins. It's nicely balanced, with bright acidity. It's already tempting, but give it time to develop even more complexity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Borgogno 2013 Liste  (Barolo)

Description: New leather, truffle, camphor and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the nose. On the smooth, generous palate, velvety fine-grained tannins uphold crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and cinnamon. A hint of tangerine zest lingers on the long, smooth finish. Delicious! Drink 2020–2032.
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2012 Rocche Rivera  (Barolo)

Description: Truffle, forest floor, wild berry, chopped herb and new leather aromas create an enticing fragrance on this structured, elegant red. Full bodied and loaded with tension, the savory palate delivers succulent morello cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and baking spice set against a backbone of noble tannins. Drink 2020–2032.
Name: Germano Ettore 2012 Lazzarito Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This gorgeous red opens with classic aromas of forest floor, wild berry, crushed herb, blue flower and a whiff of menthol. It's all about structure and finesse, delivering succulent Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice, baking spice and crushed mint flavors. Bright acidity and firm, polished tannins give it wonderful balance and a smooth texture. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Massolino 2014 Parafada  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this focused red boasts enticing scents of crushed herb, rose petal, forest floor, woodland berry and a whiff of menthol. It's savory and incredibly elegant, delivering juicy raspberry, strawberry compote and star anise alongside a savory, almost salty note. Lithe polished tannins and bright acidity provide support and impeccable balance. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2014 Rocche Rivera  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, dried rose petal, exotic spice, menthol and a whiff of underbrush take shape in the glass. On the youthfully tense but focused palate, taut refined tannins and vibrant acidity frame raspberry, strawberry, star anise and a hint of espresso. It's already delicious but this shows wonderful aging potential, so hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Sandrone 2014 Le Vigne  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this focused red boasts enticing scents of crushed herb, rose petal, forest floor, woodland berry and a whiff of menthol. It's savory and incredibly elegant, delivering juicy raspberry, strawberry compote and star anise alongside a savory, almost salty note. Lithe polished tannins and bright acidity provide support and impeccable balance. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2014 Rocche Rivera  (Barolo)

Description: Intoxicatingly fragrant, this offers heady scents of perfumed berry, pine forest, wild rose, aromatic herb and a balsamic note of eucalyptus. The structured, focused palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, pomegranate, licorice and white pepper set against polished tannins and bright acidity. It's delicious and loaded with energy. Drink 2024–2030.
Name: Giacomo Fenocchio 2014 Castellero  (Barolo)

Description: Floral and fragrant, this boasts enticing scents of blue flower, wild berry, dark spice and crushed herb. The polished vibrant palate delivers red cherry compote, cranberry, star anise and a hint of orange zest offset by elegant fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it balanced, while an almost salty mineral note lingers on the close. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, new leather, rose, balsamic aromas of menthol and dark cooking spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this gorgeous red. Balanced and structured, the elegant palate shows succulent Marasca cherry, strawberry, licorice and tobacco framed in firm refined tannins and vibrant acidity. A salty mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink 2021–2038.
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2013 Rocche Rivera  (Barolo)

Description: Dried rose, blue flower, aromatic herb, wild berry and a whiff of pipe tobacco are just some of the aromas you'll find on this stunning red. It's elegant and structured, delivering raspberry compote, crushed strawberry, cinnamon and star anise framed in bright acidity and firm fine-grained tannins. It has fantastic tension and energy, and promises to age well for years. Drink 2024–2039.
Name: Sandrone 2014 Aleste  (Barolo)

Description: This lovely radiant Barolo is another showstopper despite the difficulties of the cool wet vintage. It's incredibly elegant, with alluring scents of perfumed blue flower, rose petal, woodland berry and a whiff of menthol. The focused graceful palate boasts fantastic tension, showing wild strawberry, crushed raspberry, star anise and cinnamon framed in taut polished tannins and vibrant acidity. It's already enjoyable but will also offer good mid-term aging. Drink through 2034.
Name: Cantina Bartolo Mascarello 2014  Barolo

Description: Underbrush, tobacco, toasted hazelnut, menthol and grilled herb aromas slowly take shape on this focused red. On the structured elegant palate, taut refined tannins and fresh acidity provide an ageworthy framework for raspberry compote, juicy Marasca cherry, orange zest, white pepper and star anise. It already has layers of depth and loads of finesse, but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Gaja 2014 Sperss  (Barolo)

Description: Violet, rose petal, dried hay, grilled herb and balsamic aromas all merge together on this delicious red. Full bodied and elegantly structured, the tight savory palate delivers wild strawberry, crushed raspberry, tobacco and star anise alongside firm refined tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance and tension. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Rivetto 2013 Briccolina  (Barolo)

Description: This boasts tantalizing aromas of violet, iris, perfumed berry and aromatic herb. On the radiant, elegantly structured palate, tight refined tannins support juicy red cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise. It's balanced, with vibrant acidity. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Borgogno 2013  Barolo

Description: Compelling scents of rose, iris, wild berry, aromatic herb and a whiff of menthol practically leap out of the glass in this fragrant red. Supremely elegant, the savory, focused palate delivers red cherry, pomegranate, licorice and a burst of orange zest alongside taut, polished tannins. It's wonderfully balanced by bright acidity. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Fontanafredda 2014 Vigna La Rosa  (Barolo)

Description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of red berry, rose, forest floor, camphor and wild mint shape the nose on this radiant wine. On the linear, elegantly structured palate, youthful but refined tannins frame lip-smacking flavors of juicy red cherry, strawberry, star anise and a hint of cinnamon. Thanks to bright acidity it boasts both tension and balance. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Giacomo Fenocchio 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Truffle, new leather, wild berry, cooking spice and balsamic aromas lead the way on this full-bodied enticing red. On the smooth delicious palate, velvety tannins frame dried black cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and grilled herb. Best 2020–2028.
Name: Elvio Cogno 2012 Ravera Vigna Elena  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant and refined, this precise elegant red presents alluring aromas of forest berry, dried rose petal, menthol and a whiff of wild herb. On the focused savory palate, bright acidity provides balance and tension for juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry, licorice and baking spice. Firm refined tannins provide polished support. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Figli Luigi Oddero 2014  Barolo

Description: New leather, menthol, tobacco and forest floor aromas are front and center on this fragrant alluring Barolo. Juicy and boasting extreme elegance, the savory palate delivers raspberry compote, strawberry, crushed mint and star anise. It's well balanced and focused, with bright acidity and taut refined tannins. Drink 2020–2032.
Name: Luigi Baudana 2014 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: Made with grapes hailing from the firm's celebrated Cerequio and Cannubi vineyards, this exceptional Barolo opens with enticing scents of rose, violet and woodland berry. The elegant palate shows great tension and energy, delivering cranberry, pomegranate, aromatic herb and baking spice framed in taut, silky tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2014 Tortoniano  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, chopped herb, camphor, wild berry and blue-flower aromas meld together with a whiff of new leather. It has compelling tension and focus, offering red cherry, cranberry, star anise and clove set against tight refined tannins and bright acidity. Give this young beauty time to fully develop. Drink 2022–2033.
Name: Mirafiore 2014 Lazzarito  (Barolo)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this focused red has alluring scents of rose petal, menthol, woodland berry and a whiff of new leather. The savory linear palate delivers juicy red cherry, crushed strawberry, star anise and cinnamon set against a backbone of vibrant acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Giacomo Fenocchio 2014 Villero  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, new leather, crushed herb and eucalyptus take center stage while a floral note arrives later. On the structured polished palate, you'll find strawberry compote, dried Marasca cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Mirafiore 2010 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Camphor, forest floor, new leather and rose aromas make their way to the forefront on this fragrant red. On the linear, ethereally elegant palate, lithe tannins give polished support to red cherry, pomegranate, crushed mint and star anise while bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2024.
Name: Brandini 2014 Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: Graphite, crushed herb, pipe tobacco, new leather and dried rose are some of the aromas you'll discover on this fragrant radiant wine. It has focus, structure and elegance, delivering red cherry, strawberry, licorice and orange zest set against a backbone of firm acidity and tightly-knit, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Brandini 2014 R56  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing aromas of rose petal, woodland berry and dark spice are front and center. The energetic palate doles out red cherry, juicy cranberry, cinnamon and tobacco alongside youthfully austere refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2022–2033.
Name: Giulia Negri 2013 Serradenari  (Barolo)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, rose, dark spice and menthol aromas mingle together in the glass. On the full-bodied palate, youthfully austere fine-grained tannins give taut polished support to juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and a sprinkling of cinnamon. It's still young and needs a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Grimaldi Bruna 2014 Badarina  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of camphor, dried rose, aromatic herb and a whiff of new leather come together on this fragrant red. Elegantly structured, the focused palate delivers red cherry, cranberry, star anise and rosemary alongside firm refined tannins and vibrant acidity. It's still youthfully austere so give it a few more years to unwind. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Brezza 2014 Sarmassa  (Barolo)

Description: This vibrant, almost ethereal Barolo opens with aromas of wild rose, woodland berry, crushed mint and camphor. On the exquisitely elegant, impeccably balanced palate, taut refined tannins and vibrant acidity support crushed red cherry, pomegranate, star anise and a hint of aromatic herb. Although some may find it almost too delicate, others will be enchanted. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Brezza 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Elegantly structured, this focused red opens with delicate enticing scents of rose, woodland berry and star anise. The lithe polished palate delivers strawberry compote, red cherry, licorice and white pepper alongside taut smooth tannins. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: G D Vajra 2014 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: French oak, blue flower, underbrush and wild berry aromas escape the glass. On the smooth, full-bodied palate, firm fine-grained tannins frame juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, espresso and star anise. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2014 Castelletto  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, crushed herb, balsamic notes and exotic spice aromas float above the glass. The smooth savory palate offers juicy raspberry, wild strawberry, cinnamon and star anise alongside supple tannins and fresh acidity. It's already delicious but will age well for several years or more. Drink through 2024.
Name: Prunotto 2014  Barolo

Description: Woodland berry, blue flower, forest floor, truffle and menthol aromas take center stage on this polished red. It's full bodied and inviting, offering Marasca cherry, pomegranate, white pepper and star anise set against fresh acidity and refined tannins. It's already almost approachable but will also offer years of pleasure. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Elvio Cogno 2014 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Pressed rose, wild berry, underbrush and new leather aromas shape the delicate, enticing bouquet. On the ethereal palate, taut refined tannins support cranberry, sour cherry, white pepper, sage and a hint of tobacco alongside rather firm acidity. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2013 Villero  (Barolo)

Description: Alluring aromas of rose petal, leather and woodland berry meld together in the glass. The juicy, already accessible palate offers red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and a hint of tobacco. It's balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Sobrero 2014 Parussi  (Barolo)

Description: This elegant fragrant red opens with inviting scents of crushed rose, wild herb, red berry and a slight whiff of smoke. It's bright and focused, delivering Marasca cherry, strawberry, star anise and tobacco set against taut polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2026.
Name: Comm. G. B. Burlotto 2014  Barolo

Description: Made in the estate's eponymously named vineyard site, this fragrant Barolo boasts alluring aromas of iris, violet and woodland berry. Supple and savory, the graceful, inviting palate doles out raspberry compote, Marasca cherry, star anise and cinnamon alongside lithe tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. It's already almost accessible but also offers good mid-term aging. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Fontanafredda 2014 Proprietà in Fontanafredda  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and new leather form the nose on this full-bodied red. The firm palate delivers crushed raspberry, licorice and clove alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2031.
Name: Giulia Negri 2013 La Tartufaia  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, leather, menthol and crushed herb aromas waft out of the glass. It's full bodied and structured, offering dried cherry, cranberry, star anise and clove set against assertive fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. It's still youthfully austere and will benefit with more bottle age. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Brandini 2014 Meriame  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, perfumed berry, exotic spice and new leather aromas are at the forefront on this elegantly structured red. On the palate, polished fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity offset juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and baking spice. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Fratelli Alessandria 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with enticing aromas of red berry, baking spice and leather. The savory palate delivers red cherry, tobacco and clove alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Bel Colle 2014 Simposio  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, crushed mint, new leather and underbrush aromas are front and center. Savory and juicy, the taut vibrant palate doles out succulent raspberry, tart red cherry and star anise alongside youthfully tense, polished tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Giacomo Fenocchio 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of forest floor, red berry and Alpine herb lead the way on this 100% Nebbiolo. The elegantly structured palate offers red cherry, crushed strawberry and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Les Crêtes 2016 Sommet Nebbiolo (Valle d'Aosta)

Description: Rose, iris and menthol aromas take center stage. On the bright elegant palate, supple tannins give polished support to juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry and a hint of baking spice. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2014 Coste di Rose  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, rose, forest floor and menthol aromas come to the forefront on this fragrant red. On the taut linear palate, bright acidity and refined tannins balance juicy sour cherry, red raspberry and star anise. Drink through 2024.
Name: Fontanafredda 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, leather and rose petal take shape in the glass. The structured juicy palate offers red cherry, clove, tobacco and a touch of cinnamon alongside youthfully austere tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Palladino 2014 Ornato  (Barolo)

Description: Blue-flower, plum and baking-spice aromas curl out of the glass along with a whiff of forest floor. On the smooth concentrated palate, polished tannins support dried black cherry, mature raspberry, star anise and dried mint. It has already hit its ideal drinking window but will also maintain well for another few years or more. Drink through 2023.
Name: Borgogno 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas evoking pressed rose petal, red berry and baking spice set the tone. The juicy palate doles out red cherry, licorice and white pepper while fresh acidity and firm polished tannins provide balance. It's already approachable but hold for more complexity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Diego Pressenda La Torricella 2014 Bricco San Pietro  (Barolo)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rosewater, sweet tar, tea and cedar aromas provide the hallmark aromas of Nebbiolo in this bottling. Strong tannins and acid frame the sip, allowing flavors of red cherry, leather, rust and potpourri flavors to emerge. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Martin Ranch 2012 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Nebbiolo (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Racy and savory, this opens with classic varietal aromas of rose, new leather, red berry and a whiff of aromatic herb. The linear, almost ethereal palate offers raspberry compote, licorice and thyme set against taut refined tannins and an acidic backbone. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Castello di Verduno 2014  Barolo

Description: Espresso, grilled herb, underbrush and wild berry aromas lead the nose. The linear medium-bodied palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry jam, vanilla and mocha alongside fine-grained tannins that leave a firm, mouth-puckering finish. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2014 Sarmassa  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, underbrush, pipe tobacco and leather all come together in the glass. The juicy palate delivers black cherry, licorice and clove alongside firm, polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Monchiero 2012 Rocche di Castiglione Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, underbrush, red berry and new leather emerge from the glass. The full-bodied firm palate offers cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside taut fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Palladino 2014 Parafada  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, incense and underbrush lead the nose. The savory palate offers sour cherry, clove and tobacco alongside firm fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Ca' Viola 2013 Sottocastello di Novello  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, forest floor and baking spice lead the nose. The chewy palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco, clove and anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Palladino 2012 S. Bernardo Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of forest floor, leather, dark berry and incense lead the nose. The chewy palate offers crushed raspberry, tobacco and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Sobrero 2012 Pernanno Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, baking spice and leather aromas unfold in the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers red berry, cinnamon and crushed herb flavors framed by fresh acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Demarie 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of red berry, cooking spice and underbrush lead the nose. The savory palate delivers crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper alongside firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Diego Pressenda La Torricella 2014 Barbadelchi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, dark berry and moist earth lead the nose. On the full-bodied palate, fine-grained assertive tannins frame raspberry jam, licorice, espresso and black pepper. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Domenico Clerico 2013 Ciabot Mentin  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of ripe red berry, forest floor and leather emerge in the glass. The medium-bodied juicy palate offers fleshy red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Paola Lanzavecchia 2012 Calice  (Barolo)

Description: Pretty aromas of red berry, rose, thyme and star anise take shape in the glass. The tight racy palate evokes sour cherry and licorice, while taut fine-grained tannins and firm acidity provide the framework. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Sordo 2014 Parussi  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant blue-flower, perfumed berry and cake-spice aromas mingle with an earthy whiff of game on this medium-bodied red. On the rounded approachable palate, supple tannins give polished support to juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of clove. It's fresh, with bright acidity. Drink 2019–2024.
Name: Ascheri 2014  Barolo

Description: Camphor, dried rose petal and underbrush aromas lift out of the glass. This wine is linear and still rather austere, offering sour cherry, cranberry and clove set against taut tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Comm. G. B. Burlotto 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: This taut vibrant red offers aromas of eucalyptus, red berry, tilled soil and a whiff of new leather. On the elegant ethereal palate, lithe tannins support sour cherry, cranberry and star anise while bright acidity lends balance. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Brezza 2014  Barolo

Description: Star anise, clove and menthol aromas come to the forefront on this vibrant red. It's taut and linear, offering sour cherry, pomegranate and licorice alongside firm acidity and tight, polished tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Marcarini 2014 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: Lovely scents of perfumed berry, blue flower, underbrush and wild mint take center stage while the ethereal graceful palate offers crushed strawberry, sour cherry, star anise and a hint of white pepper alongside lithe tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and energy. Drink through 2024.
Name: Mirafiore 2014  Barolo

Description: Toasted hazelnut, grilled herb, underbrush and camphor aromas align with a whiff of iris. The firm medium-bodied palate offers dried cherry, clove, sage and hint of oak alongside close-grained tannins that leave an assertive finish.
Name: Poderi Luigi Einaudi 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals whiffs of dark-skinned fruit, underbrush, coconut, and a hint of camphor. It's medium bodied but firm, offering mature black cherry, licorice and a hint of espresso set against grainy tannins that grip the somewhat dusty, drying finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Vietti 2014 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, forest floor and leather lead the nose. The firm palate delivers crushed raspberry, licorice and clove alongside youthfully assertive, refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Anna Maria Abbona 2014 Bricco San Pietro  (Barolo)

Description: Delicate aromas of tobacco, cedar and dark berry emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, clove and sage alongside close-grained tannins that leave a grippy finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Bel Colle 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant blue-flower, rose and chopped mint aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of eucalyptus. The taut medium-bodied palate offers sour cherry, cranberry, dried sage and a white-pepper note alongside youthfully austere fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2021–2026.
Name: Damilano 2014 Lecinquevigne  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, red berry and a whiff of new leather come together on this. It's bright and elegant, offering juicy red cherry, cranberry and baking spice set against refined tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2012.
Name: Gigi Rosso 2014 Tre Comuni  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and new leather follow over to the youthfully austere palate along with crushed raspberry, clove and star anise. Taut tannins and fresh acidity provide the backbone. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Marrone 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of camphor, exotic spice, wild rose and a whiff of new leather shape the nose. The taut, somewhat austere palate evokes cranberry, sour cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside nervous acidity and tense, fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2024.
Name: Oddero 2014 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with red berry, new leather and eucalyptus aromas. The firmly structured palate offers red cherry, star anise and a hint of white pepper alongside close-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Rocche Costamagna 2014 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, leather and underbrush form the nose. The savory palate offers black cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside firm refined tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas evoking cooking spice, dark-skinned berry and tilled soil. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, clove and black pepper alongside grainy tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Paola Lanzavecchia 2010 Calice Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, violet and a whiff of coconut lead the nose. The medium-bodied palate offers sour cherry, cranberry, sage and star anise set against close-grained tannins that leave a drying, assertive finish.
Name: Poderi Luigi Einaudi 2014 Terlo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, tilled soil and a whiff of new leather lead the nose. The forward palate is already rather accessible, offering dried black cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Achille Viglione 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark berry, leather and underbrush. The savory palate delivers cinnamon, black cherry and clove alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Agostino Bosco 2014 La Serra  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, forest floor and star anise. The juicy straightforward palate delivers black cherry, clove and a hint of licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Amalia 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of wild berry, tilled earth and a balsamic note mingle together on this. The austere palate offers sour cherry, clove and black pepper alongside firm but polished tannins. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of truffle, red berry and cedar lead the nose. The linear palate is on the lean side, offering tart red cherry, clove and star anise alongside youthfully austere tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ca' Viola 2014 Caviot  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, cooking spice and dark berry. The savory palate delivers raspberry jam, tobacco and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2014 Perno  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and tobacco emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, star anise and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Agostino Bosco 2014 Neirane  (Barolo)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, tilled earth and mocha aromas shape the nose. The dense palate delivers black cherry, cocoa, star anise and oak-driven spice alongside bracing, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Domenico Clerico 2013 Pajana  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, woodland berry and leather lead the nose. The austere palate offers tart red cherry, clove and star anise alongside close-grained tannins and racy acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Giovanni Abrigo 2013 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of tilled soil, dark berry and cedar emerge from the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers black-cherry jam and tobacco alongside grainy tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Monchiero 2014 Montanello  (Barolo)

Description: Red-berry, underbrush and leather aromas lead the nose. The youthfully austere palate offers cranberry, star anise and clove alongside tight tannins and racy acidity. Drink after 2022.
Name: Palladino 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of coconut, espresso, French oak and balsamic notes lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the firm palate along with dried cherry, vanilla, licorice and a note of powdered sage while close-grained tannins grip the finish.
Name: Bersano 2012 Badarina Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Scorched earth, cooking-spice and prune aromas come together on this. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, clove and a hint of star anise alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2026
Name: Rocca Felice 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Leather, clove and dark-skinned fruit aromas come together on this. The linear palate offers ripe black plum, black pepper and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Cantina Massara Burlotto 2013 Massara  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, cooking spice and espresso. The racy palate offers tart cherry, toast, mocha and tobacco alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Domenico Clerico 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of cedar, tobacco and dark berry emerge from the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers raspberry, mocha and star anise alongside austere tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Dosio 2014 Serradenari  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of French oak, espresso, coconut, sage and balsamic notes take shape in the glass. The taut ethereal palate offers raw berry, star anise, rosemary and coffee bean alongside bright acidity. Close-grained tannins leave a somewhat drying dusty finish.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, red berry and forest floor take shape in the glass. The solid palate delivers raspberry jam, clove and dried sage alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Marrone 2014 Pichemej  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of woodland berry, tobacco and forest floor emerge from the glass. The medium-bodied, firm palate offers sour cherry, clove and black pepper alongside young taut tannins. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Réva 2014  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, rose petal and a whiff of nutmeg. The savory solid palate delivers juicy raspberry, clove and star anise alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Sordo 2014 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Red-berry, tilled soil and leather aromas shape the nose. The linear palate offers red cherry, cinnamon and a licorice note alongside firm, polished tannins. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2014 Undicicomuni  (Barolo)

Description: Lightly scented, this opens with aromas suggesting coconut, black-skinned berry, eucalyptus and French oak. The taut palate is initially shy but eventually reveals dried sour cherry, pomegranate, espresso and dried sage alongside close-grained tannins that leave a rather drying finish. Drink after 2024.
Name: Barale Fratelli 2014 Castellero  (Barolo)

Description: Vinous aromas of crushed red berry mingle with whiffs of camphor and rose. Taut and linear, the nervous palate offers raw sour cherry and licorice set against tight dusty tannins and lively acidity. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Bersano 2014 Nirvasco  (Barolo)

Description: Eucalyptus, dark-berry and cedar aromas shape the nose. The firm palate delivers raspberry jam, licorice and clove alongside grainy tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Brangero 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, baking spice and leather emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2014  Barolo

Description: Rose-petal, cedar and underbrush aromas emerge in the glass. The solid palate evokes red cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Cascina Fontana 2014  Barolo

Description: This bright, fragrant red opens with aromas of perfumed blue flower, forest floor, aromatic herb and wild berry. On the tense linear palate, taut refined tannins and vibrant acidity lend focus and lithe support to sour cherry, crushed strawberry and clove. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Fontanafredda 2014  Barolo

Description: Coconut, French oak and balsamic aromas lead the way on this austere red. The taut assertive palate offers licorice, espresso, toasted nut, sage and a hint of dried cherry alongside tight close-grained tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Oddero 2014 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, leather and underbrush lead the nose. The medium-bodied, savory palate delivers cherry, clove and white pepper alongside fresh acidity and firm tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Piazzo 2014  Barolo

Description: Dark berry, baking spice and underbrush lead the nose. The juicy accessible palate delivers black cherry, clove and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2026.
Name: Rivata 2013  Barolo

Description: Red berry, leather and underbrush aromas appear in the glass. The linear medium-bodied palate offers dried cranberry, sage and clove alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Rocche Costamagna 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of black plum, cooking spice and tobacco come together on this. The solid palate offers blackberry jam, clove and star anise alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Salvano 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, cooking spice and tobacco emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers black cherry, clove and dried sage alongside austere tannins and fresh acidity. Drink after 2022.
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2014  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas of rose petal, red berry and cooking spice. The juicy palate offers crushed raspberry, red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside youthfully taut but refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Marcarini 2014 La Serra  (Barolo)

Description: Delicate aromas of red berry, dried rose, aromatic herb and menthol lift out of the glass. It's ethereal, offering strawberry, cranberry and baking spice alongside polished tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Oddero 2014  Barolo

Description: This has subdued aromas of grilled herb, toast, camphor and peppercorn. On the linear, rather lean palate, tightly knit astringent tannins offset sour cherry, pomegranate and dried sage.
Name: Poderi Luigi Einaudi 2014 Ludo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of baking spice, underbrush and a whiff of dark berry lead the nose. The solid straightforward palate offers sour cherry, clove and baking spice alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Salvano 2014  Barolo

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas suggesting espresso, toasted oak and tobacco. The tightly knit palate offers dried blackberry, licorice and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins. Give it another couple of years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Ca'Romè 2012 Rapet Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Mocha, toast and coconut aromas lead the nose. The aromas carry through to the linear palate together with sour cherry, black cherry jam and sage alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ca'Romè 2014 Rapet  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red fruit, toasted oak and graphite emerge from the glass. The linear palate delivers sour cherry, tobacco and orange peel alongside assertive tannins and fresh acidity. Drink after 2022.
Name: Gomba Boschetti 2014 del Comune di Barolo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas evoking camphor, crushed herb and cooking spice appear in the glass. The tight linear palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate and star anise set against bright acidity and rather grainy tannins that dry out the finish.
Name: L'Astemia Pentita 2014 Terlo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, dark-skinned berry and a hint of coconut form the nose. The tightly knit palate offers raw cherry, espresso and toast alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2014 Boiolo  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas that evoke cedar, dark-skinned berry and a whiff of mocha. The dense palate shows clove, espresso, toasted oak and a hint of dried cherry set against close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of baking spice, leather and underbrush slowly unfold in the glass. The full-bodied palate delivers espresso, licorice and suggestions of dried cherry alongside assertive tannins. Give it another couple of years to let the tannins unfurl then drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Ca'Romè 2012 Cerretta Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, mocha and dark berry emerge from the glass. The taut palate shows sour cherry, espresso and oak-driven spice alongside raspy tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Dosio 2012 Fossati Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of tilled soil, dark berry and leather take shape in the glass. The structured palate offers dried black cherry, clove and licorice alongside bracing tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Gomba Boschetti 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, forest floor and baking spice emerge from the glass. The solid palate offers sour cherry, clove and black pepper alongside young taut tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Luca Bosio 2014  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, tobacco and dark berry. The round palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Pelassa 2013 San Lorenzo  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas evoking sawdust, tobacco leaf and underbrush come together on this. The dense palate offers licorice, ripe dark-skinned fruit and roasted coffee beans alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Piazzo 2012 Sottocastello di Novello Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas suggesting dark berry, tobacco and mocha unfold in the glass. The bracing palate evokes dried black cherry and espresso set against assertive mouth-drying tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2014 Vignarionda  (Barolo)

Description: Initially shy, the nose eventually gives up aromas evoking French oak, camphor, coconut and a whiff of crushed herb. Reflecting the nose, the assertive palate offers toasted oak, menthol, espresso, powdered sage and a hint of raw sour cherry set against firm grainy tannins that leave a rather raspy finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Ca'Romè 2014 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: This presents aromas of vanilla, truffle and ripe dark berry. The rather evolved palate delivers prune, cedar and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Demarie 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of iris, baking spice and underbrush emerge from the glass. The taut palate offers sour cherry, clove and licorice alongside bracing tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink after 2022.
Name: Dosio 2014  Barolo

Description: Subtle aromas of camphor, tobacco and dark fruit lead the nose. The tight palate offers clove, orange peel and cranberry alongside taut, a bit astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Giovanni Abrigo 2014 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of crushed herb, espresso, dried rose and a whiff of camphor. On the rather lean linear, palate, coconut, toast and powdered sage notes accent sour cherry alongside assertive close-grained tannins that leave a somewhat astringent finish.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2014 del Comune di Barolo  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting tilled soil, baking spice and dark-skinned fruit. The solid straightforward palate offers black plum, clove and cooking spice alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Rocca Felice 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of dried rose petal, wild berry, eucalyptus and a whiff of tar lead the nose. It's linear and already surprisingly approachable, offering sour cherry, cranberry and baking spice alongside lithe, slightly dusty tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Sordo 2014 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, leather and dark berry. The linear palate offers blackberry jam, cinnamon and clove alongside young austere tannins. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: San Silvestro 2014 Patres  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of menthol, red berry and a whiff of clove lift out of the glass. It's rather straightforward for Barolo but linear, offering raw cherry, strawberry and a note of star anise alongside taut close-grained tannins that leave a dusty finish.
Name: L'Astemia Pentita 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, star anise and dark berry lead the nose. The firm palate delivers licorice, prune and mocha alongside tightly knit tannins that give a grippy finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Monchiero 2014 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas evoking tilled soil, leather and a whiff of dark-skinned fruit slowly emerge in the glass. The linear straightforward palate offers sour cherry, clove and star anise alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Sordo 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, mocha and a whiff of dark fruit. The taut palate offers prune, espresso and licorice alongside assertive, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of coconut, espresso and dark fruit lead the nose. The full-bodied palate doesn't possess a lot of fruit richness, evoking raw sour cherry, licorice and toasted oak while astringent tannins grip the finish.
Name: Marrone 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of game, toasted oak and powdered sage lift out of the glass. The firm palate offers black-currant jam, licorice and mocha alongside assertive, tightly knit tannins that give it a grippy finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Silvio Grasso 2014  Barolo

Description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and leather emerge from the glass on this no-frills Barolo. It's already accessible and light on its feet, offering clove, cranberry and orange peel alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. Drink after 2020.
Name: Sordo 2014  Barolo

Description: This opens with toasted oak, mocha and dark-skinned berry aromas. The tight linear palate offers sour cherry, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Francone 2014  Barolo

Description: Earthy aromas of dark fruit, tilled soil and a whiff of game lead the nose. The linear palate offers sour cherry, sage and clove alongside grainy, rather astringent tannins that clench the finish.
Name: San Silvestro 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, dark-skinned fruit and baking spice. The linear palate offers clove, raw Marasca cherry and black pepper alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Broccardo 2014 I Tre Pais  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of tilled soil, mocha and baking spice. The firm palate offers espresso, tobacco and a hint of raw berry alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Col dei Venti 2014 Debutto  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of game, scorched earth and dark fruit lead the nose. The tight palate offers clove, tobacco and prune alongside close-grained, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2013 Cascina Ferrero  (Barolo)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals suggestions of dark-skinned fruit, mocha and tobacco. The assertive palate offers sour cherry, espresso and vanilla while close-grained tannins give it an astringent finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2014 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of weedy underbrush, hazelnut, game and a whiff of barnyard slowly unfold in the glass. The aromas carry over to the light-bodied palate together with crushed mint, stewed berry and white pepper. Dusty drying tannins and lively acidity give it a firm finish.
Name: Batasiolo 2014 Cerequio  (Barolo)

Description: Dark berry, vanilla and toasted oak sensations lead the nose. The linear palate delivers black plum, mocha and clove alongside grainy tannins that lead to a mouth-puckering the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Giribaldi 2014  Barolo

Description: Subdued aromas of toasted oak, baking spice and graphite guide the nose. The dense palate delivers raw sour cherry, clove and vanilla while assertive tannins give it an astringent finish.
Name: Gomba Boschetti 2014 Boschetti Semie  (Barolo)

Description: Mocha, dark fruit and coconut lead the nose. The extracted palate offers prune, roasted coffee bean and star anise alongside evolved, but rather astringent tannins. You can feel the evident alcohol as it lacks fruit richness.
Name: Roberto Sarotto 2013 Audace  (Barolo)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals suggestions of red berry, blue flower and a whiff of dark spice. On the taut, no-frills palate, racy acidity accompanies sour cherry, raw cranberry and powdered sage alongside grainy tannins that leave a dusty, drying finish.
Name: L'Astemia Pentita 2014  Barolo

Description: Woodland berry, fragrant blue flower, tilled earth and balsamic whiffs of camphor slowly take shape in the glass. Boasting elegance and intense energy, the radiant palate delivers crushed red raspberry, sour cherry, star anise and crushed aromatic herb alongside a backbone of firm refined tannins and vibrant acidity. It's still young, so give it time to fully come together and develop even more complexity. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Eucalyptus, woodland berry, rose and baking spice aromas take shape in the glass. This is all about finesse and energy, doling out flavors of juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and licorice alongside a backbone of fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Still young and tightly wound, it will benefit from more time in the cellar. Drink 2024–2039.
Name: Renato Ratti 2014 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: Wild berry, pipe tobacco, violet and dried aromatic herb aromas mingle with whiffs of camphor on this precise elegant wine. It's focused and full bodied, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and crushed mint set against firm, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2014 Gattera  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, rose, menthol and woodland berry aromas come to the forefront. On the succulent vital palate, taut, refined tannins and vibrant acidity provide seamless support for juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and white pepper. It's loaded with finesse, and will develop even more complexity with more bottle age. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2014 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, red berry, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of camphor all come together on this fragrant red. On the precise linear palate, you'll find juicy Marasca cherry, pomegranate, licorice and crushed aromatic herb alongside a framework of polished, fine-grained tannins. Vibrant acidity provides balance and energy. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Renato Ratti 2014 Conca  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant and refined, this opens with alluring scents of iris, woodland berry, clove and balsamic whiffs of eucalyptus. On the focused, racy palate, youthfully austere but extremely elegant tannins and vibrant acidity provide the backbone for crunchy cherry, crushed strawberry, licorice and white pepper. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Francesco Rinaldi 2014 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with fresh enticing scents of fragrant blue flower, wild berry, dark spice and aromatic herb. It's full bodied but bright and loaded with finesse, doling out ripe morello cherry, raspberry, star anise and a dollop of vanilla. Taut close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity lend balance and support. It's still tightly wound so give it a few more years to unwind. Drink 2023–2034.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2014 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, rose, new leather, crushed mint and balsamic aromas take center stage on this fragrant, structured red. The firm elegantly structured palate shows succulent raspberry, Marasca cherry and licorice alongside a backbone of fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. It has great energy and wonderfully juicy fruit—uncommon for the cool wet vintage. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Germano Ettore 2014 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, French oak and a balsamic note emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers vanilla, roasted coffee bean, dried black cherry and oak-driven spice alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2014  Barolo

Description: Intense aromas of iris, violet and woodland berry lead the nose along with a whiff of camphor. Vibrant and precise, the taut, full-bodied palate offers Marasca cherry marinated in spirits, raspberry, baking spice and licorice framed in tightly knit, fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2024.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2014 Arborina  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, rose and woodland berry take center stage on this full-bodied red. It's elegant and structured, doling out strawberry compote, raspberry, licorice and a hint of coffee. Fine-grained tannins provide polished support. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Grimaldi Bruna 2014 Camilla  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing scents of camphor, red berry, rose and new leather lift out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the linear, structured palate delivers raspberry, sour cherry, star anise and menthol alongside tightly knit, fine-grained tannins. Firm acidity provides balance. Give it a few more years to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2021–2026.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2014  Barolo

Description: This fragrant, refined red opens with alluring scents of blue flower, wild berry, dark spice and a whiff of vineyard dust. The racy, almost ethereal palate offers crushed strawberry, sour cherry, licorice and crushed mint set against vibrant acidity and taut elegant tannins. It's still youthfully austere so don't even attempt it before 2024.
Name: Mirafiore 2014 Paiagallo  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, tilled soil and crushed herb aromas meld together with a balsamic note of camphor. The vibrant linear palate delivers sour cherry, cranberry and suggestions of clove and licorice. It's elegant but youthfully austere, with tightly knit, taut tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Poderi Colla 2014 Bussia Dardi Le Rose  (Barolo)

Description: Intense aromas of raspberry compote, forest floor, eucalyptus and oak-driven spice drive the nose on this fragrant red. On the firm, youthfully austere palate, assertive, fine-grained tannins provide support for Marasca cherry, licorice, mint and a note of French oak. Drink 2021–2026.
Name: Cordero di Montezemolo 2014 Monfalletto  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, pressed rose, ground clove and a balsamic note of menthol lead the way. Elegantly structured, the youthfully austere, precise palate delivers cherry, cranberry, star anise and crushed mint while bright acidity and tightly wound tannins provide the taut framework. Give it time to fully unwind and develop. Drink 2024–2029.
Name: Renato Ratti 2014 Marcenasco  (Barolo)

Description: Captivating scents of rose petal, woodland berry and underbrush lead the nose. The firm balanced palate offers juicy red cherry, clove, star anise and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2027.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2013 1961  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with enticing aromas of rose petal, underbrush, red berry and a whiff of carob. The savory palate offers red cherry, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Elio Filippino 2013 Castiglione Falletto  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of fragrant purple flower, wild berry and a whiff of exotic spice lead the nose. On the taut structured palate, tight fine-grained tannins offset cherry, pomegranate, star anise and a hint of espresso while bright acidity lends energy and balance. It's still youthfully austere and needs a few years to unwind. Drink after 2023.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2014 Carobric  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose, crushed mint, red berry and dark spice mingle together with an earthy whiff of leather on this fragrant Barolo. The vibrant, almost ethereal palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, star anise and an almost salty note alongside taut, polished tannins and racy acidity. Drink 2021–2026.
Name: G D Vajra 2014 Albe  (Barolo)

Description: Menthol, eucalyptus and rose aromas take shape in the glass. On the elegantly structured, linear palate, taut fine-grained tannins and bright acidity frame sour cherry, cranberry and a hint of baking spice. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2013 Rocchettevino  (Barolo)

Description: This elegantly structured red offers aromas of red berry, dried rose petal and a balsamic whiff of menthol. It's taut and linear, evoking Marasca cherry, pomegranate and star anise set against fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Fratelli Alessandria 2014 Gramolere  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing scents of rose, blue flower, vanilla and berry escape the glass. On the palate, firm fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity frame cherry, strawberry and a hint of clove. Drink after 2023.
Name: Garesio 2013 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, new leather, tobacco and a whiff of mint mingle together on this full-bodied wine. The savory palate delivers black cherry, licorice and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Livia Fontana 2012 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, forest floor and leather form the nose while the fresh savory palate offers red-skinned berry, clove and cinnamon. Tightly-knight refined tannins provide support. Drink 2023–2028.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, wild herb and cooking spice all take shape in the glass. The chewy savory palate offers dried black cherry, clove and cranberry alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2033.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2013 Roggeri  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, clove and wild berry aromas align with a whiff of camphor. On the elegant medium-bodied palate, refined tannins and bright acidity provide support for Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and licorice. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Francesco Rinaldi 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: This fragrant red offers delicate, enticing scents of wild berry, blue flower and a whiff of camphor. On the vibrant, focused palate, refined tannins and bright acidity frame juicy red cherry, raspberry and white pepper. It's elegant—almost ethereal—and already approachable. Drink through now–2024.
Name: Massolino 2014  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting forest floor, leather and dark-skinned berry. The savory balanced palate delivers juicy black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside youthfully austere but elegant tannins. Drink 2023–2029.
Name: San Biagio 2014 Sorano  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of rose petal, cooking spice and a whiff of underbrush. The savory palate offers raspberry compote, cherry, clove and licorice alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: San Biagio 2014 Bricco San Biagio  (Barolo)

Description: Red-berry, mint and cooking spice aromas lead the nose. The juicy, balanced palate delivers cherry, raspberry jam and cinnamon alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Rocca Giovanni 2014  Barolo

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling offers rounded strawberry, hibiscus and plum notes set against red spices of sumac and cinnamon. There's a rusty earth component to the sip, where dried strawberry and rose petals play with dill. It is lightly bodied but firmly textured.
Name: Bella Luna 2015 Glenrose Vineyard Nebbiolo (Adelaida District)

Description: Wild berry, underbrush, French oak and balsamic whiffs of camphor meld together in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the firm linear palate evokes sour cherry, cranberry, coconut and oak-driven spice set against close-grained tannins. Drink after 2024.
Name: Cordero di Montezemolo 2014 Enrico VI  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of raspberry compote, coconut and a whiff of oak-driven spice lead the nose. On the firm, linear palate, assertive fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity support cherry, pomegranate and clove. It's still youthfully austere and needs a few more years to fully come around. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Pio Cesare 2014  Barolo

Description: This offers aromas of underbrush, crushed herb and woodland berry. It's tightly wound, offering flavors of black cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and a suggestion of tobacco alongside firm, refined tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Anna Maria Abbona 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, underbrush and a hint of violet emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers raspberry jam, red cherry and star anise alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2014 Monrobiolo di Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with rose, aromatic herb and red-berry aromas. The savory palate delivers raspberry compote, clove and tobacco alongside youthfully austere tannins that need time to develop. Drink 2023–2029.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2014 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of new leather, tobacco and dark-skinned berry. The savory palate delivers dried black cherry, licorice and clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2013 Bussia Vigna Campo dei Buoi  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of red berry, tobacco and mint while the savory palate offers raspberry jam, clove and licorice. Austere, fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Giacosa Fratelli 2014 Scarrone Vigna Mandorlo  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of forest floor, new leather and woodland berry. The juicy palate offers red cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Manzone Fratelli 2014 Bricco San Pietro  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of violet, woodland berry and black tea take shape in the glass. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2030.
Name: Marziano Abbona 2013 Pressenda  (Barolo)

Description: Dried rose petal, exotic spice and chopped herb aromas come together on this. The juicy palate delivers crushed raspberry, red cherry and star anise alongside youthfully firm tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Mauro Sebaste 2014 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: Aromatic herb, red-berry and forest floor aromas lift out of the glass. The firmly structured palate delivers raspberry jam, star anise and sage alongside tightly wound but refined tannins. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Negretti 2014 Mirau  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of star anise, leather and rose petal lead the way on the nose of this wine, while the savory, medium-bodied palate boasts youthfully firm tannins that frame black cherry, licorice and white pepper flavors. Drink 2022–2030.
Designation: Essenze del Comune di Monforte d'Alba
Name: Vite Colte 2013 Essenze del Comune di Monforte d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of rose petal, red berry and a hint of eucalyptus. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, cranberry and clove set against a backdrop of austere tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2023–2028.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2014 Coste di Rose  (Barolo)

Description: Pressed rose, red berry, wild herb and a whiff of new leather lead the way. The taut vibrant palate presents pomegranate, cranberry, white pepper and star anise set against a firm backbone of racy acidity and assertive, tightly knit tannins. Drink after 2024.
Name: Francesco Rinaldi 2014  Barolo

Description: Iris, rose petal and menthol aromas take shape in the glass. On the taut elegant palate, polished tannins support sour cherry, cranberry and star anise. It's balanced and almost racy, with vibrant acidity. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Fratelli Alessandria 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of rose petal, nutmeg and white pepper lead the way while the juicy palate doles out raspberry jam, star anise and tobacco. Tightly wound but refined tannins and fresh acidity provide the framework. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Garesio 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of crushed herb, pressed violet, and camphor lead the way while the palate evokes sour cherry, coffee and vanilla. Taut fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity offer the tight framework. Drink after 2023.
Name: Grimaldi Bruna 2014 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)

Description: Dark berry, baking spice and a hint of leather lead the nose. On the juicy palate, firm tannins and vibrant acidity provide the framework for Marasca cherry, clove and white pepper. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Paolo Manzone 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, leather and tobacco emerge from the glass. The solid palate offers raspberry compote, dried black cherry and licorice alongside tightly wound tannins. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Le Ginestre 2014 Sottocastello di Novello  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red berry, leather and pipe tobacco lead the nose. The savory palate delivers red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and a touch of white pepper alongside austere but refined tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2014 Tre Utin  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, dark berry and cedar emerge from the glass. The chewy palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside taut tannins. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Mauro Sebaste 2014 Tresurì  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, leather and underbrush aromas lift out of the glass. The straightforward palate evokes black raspberry, star anise and white pepper alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Serradenari 2014 La Vetta  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of rose petal, baking spice and mocha lead the nose. The chewy palate offers sour cherry, espresso and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Simone Scaletta 2014  Barolo

Description: Dark-skinned berry, underbrush and leather aromas come to the forefront. The firm palate delivers dried blackberry, clove and licorice alongside tight, close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with resin, leather and vanilla aromas. The savory medium-bodied palate offers juicy black cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Cascina Bongiovanni 2014  Barolo

Description: Delicate aromas of cedar, rose petal and tobacco leaf unfold in the glass. The firm palate delivers red berry, clove and white pepper alongside fresh acidity while clenching tannins grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2014 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, chopped mint and vanilla slowly appear in the glass. The austere palate shows cranberry, star anise and clove alongside tightly wound tannins. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Paolo Manzone 2014 Meriame  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, woodland berry and a whiff of camphor emerge from the glass. The austere palate offers tart red cherry, clove and a hint of star anise alongside taut tannins and fresh acidity. Give it a few more years to come together. Drink after 2022.
Name: Marziano Abbona 2013 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of tobacco, dark berry and leather. The linear no-frills palate offers black cherry, star anise and a touch of sage alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Pecchenino 2014 San Giuseppe  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, menthol and a hint of cooking spice while the savory palate delivers Marasca cherry, clove and baking spice. Firm tannins provide support. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Stroppiana 2012 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, leather and cooking spice aromas come together on this. The chewy palate offers red cherry, clove and a hint of licorice alongside solid tannins that leave a firm finish. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Stroppiana 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking leather, forest floor and a whiff of dried rose. The somewhat straightforward palate offers juicy dark-skinned berry and tobacco alongside velvety but evolved tannins that leave a rather abrupt finish.
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2012 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Dark berry, baking spice and tilled soil aromas waft out of the glass. The firm linear palate offers raspberry, clove and coffee bean alongside tight tannins that grip the finish. Drink 2023–2030.
Designation: Essenze del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba
Name: Vite Colte 2013 Essenze del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting dark-skinned berry, cooking spice and forest floor. The linear, taut palate offers cranberry jam, star anise and clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2023.
Designation: del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba Leon
Name: Cascina Luisin 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba Leon  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of red berry, baking spice and a whiff of exotic spice meld together on this. The firm palate delivers red cherry, mocha and licorice alongside assertive tannins that leave a rather astringent finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Cavalier Bartolomeo 2013 San Lorenzo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas mature black-skinned fruit, scorched soil and baking spice emerge from the glass. The mature palate delivers prune, clove and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2011 Bussia Luigi Arnulfo  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with tobacco, cedar and dark berry aromas. The dense tannic palate offers toasted oak, prune, espresso and licorice alongside tightly knit, close-grained tannins that need to unwind. Drink after 2023.
Name: Domenico Clerico 2013 Aeroplanservaj  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of resin, dark-skinned fruit, tobacco and mocha lead the nose while the firm palate offers black plum, clove and licorice. Clenching tannins grip the finish. Drink 2022–2027.
Name: Gianfranco Alessandria 2014  Barolo

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of mocha, cedar, fresh mint and a whiff of dark berry. The firm linear palate offers raspberry jam, white pepper, clove and dried sage set against close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Icardi 2014 Parej  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, tilled soil and a whiff of new leather. The solid palate delivers Marasca cherry, clove and a hint of star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2014 Fossati  (Barolo)
