Description: Red berry, leather and a whiff of cooking spice take shape on this medium-bodied red. The bright linear palate shows red cherry, clove and tobacco while austere tannins leave a firm finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Cavalier Bartolomeo 2014 San Lorenzo  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas suggesting violet, leather and a whiff star anise take shape on this. The firm palate delivers sour cherry, licorice and a hint of clove alongside assertive tannins.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2012 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of iris, mint and red berry waft out of the glass. The smooth, straightforward palate offers red cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink 2020–2026.
Name: San Biagio 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of underbrush, forest floor and red berry emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers red cherry, clove and sage alongside rather aggressive tannins that need time to unwind. Drink after 2022.
Name: Livia Fontana 2013 Villero  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, pipe tobacco and dark-skinned berry emerge from the glass. The solid, savory palate delivers black plum, star anise and a hint of white pepper alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Lo Zoccolaio 2012 Ravera Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of truffle, sage and red berry lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried cherry, licorice and clove alongside tightly packed tannins. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Negretti 2014 Rive  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with dark-skinned berry, leather and eucalyptus aromas. It's firmly structured, offering black cherry, star anise and a hint of white pepper alongside close-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Pecchenino 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Delicate aromas of dark berry, underbrush and leather emerge from the glass. The linear palate offers black cherry, clove and star anise offset by firm but polished tannins. Drink after 2021–2027.
Name: Boasso 2014 Gabutti  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, baking spice and leather aromas lift out of the glass while the firm palate offers morello cherry, star anise and clove. Solid austere tannins provide the backbone. Drink after 2023.
Name: Cantina Terre del Barolo 2013 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of tobacco, dark berry and nutmeg come together on this. The concentrated palate offers Marasca cherry, clove and a star anise note offset by assertive tannins that need to unwind. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2014 Baudana  (Barolo)

Description: Dark berry, underbrush and eucalyptus aromas take shape on this solid red. The savory palate offers red plum, licorice and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2022–2028.
Name: Josetta Saffirio 2014  Barolo

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting tobacco, underbrush and a whiff of rose petal slowly emerge from the glass. The firm palate presents Marasca cherry, raspberry and star anise alongside tightly wound tannins. Drink after 2022–2027.
Name: Livia Fontana 2014 Fontanin  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking dark-skinned berry, baking spice and a whiff of menthol. The big chewy palate delivers dried Marasca cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside polished tannins. You can also detect the heat of the alcohol on the close. Drink through 2026.
Name: Luigi Drocco 2010 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, underbrush and a whiff of porcini mushroom form the nose. The straightforward palate delivers cranberry, red cherry and clove alongside polished tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Seghesio 2014  Barolo

Description: Initially shy, this eventually reveals subtle aromas suggesting cedar, mocha and dark-skinned berry. The assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, black cherry jam and black pepper alongside rather grainy tannins. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Seghesio 2014 La Villa  (Barolo)

Description: Leather, dark berry and cooking spice aromas form the nose. The savory palate doles out cranberry jam, dried black cherry and clove while firm tannins provide a solid backbone. Drink 2021–2026.
Name: Stroppiana 2014 San Giacomo  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of red berry, underbrush and a whiff of eucalyptus. The firm palate displays red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside bracing tannins and bright acidity. Drink after 2023.
Name: Tenuta L'Illuminata 2014 Sant'Anna  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of rose petal, leather and underbrush emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers raspberry, red cherry and star anise alongside austere tannins that need time to unfold. Drink after 2023.
Name: Cavalier Bartolomeo 2014 Altenasso  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of leather, baking spice and dark berry lead the nose. The linear palate offers raw sour cherry, clove and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Ceste 2014  Barolo

Description: Subtle aromas of mocha, espresso, cedar and a hint of blue flowers waft out of the glass. The dense palate evokes dried black cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins that give it a rather astringent finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Elio Filippino 2013 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: Cedar, underbrush and black-skinned berry aromas eventually come to the forefront. The firm palate offers mature black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Podere Ruggeri Corsini 2014 Bussia Corsini  (Barolo)

Description: Delicate scents of dark berry, tilled soil and mocha slowly come to the forefront. The taut palate offers tart cranberry, espresso and star anise alongside close-grained, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Ricossa 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas evoking wild berry, leather and underbrush lift out of the glass. On the linear, rather straightforward palate, taut tannins offset raspberry, star anise and a hint of white pepper. Drink after 2023.
Name: Cantina Povero 2014 Priore  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cocoa, dark-skinned fruit and incense meld together on this. The linear palate is already rather approachable, offering morello cherry, coconut and vanilla alongside polished tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Claudio Alario 2014 Riva Rocca  (Barolo)

Description: This brawny wine opens with aromas of ripe dark fruit, exotic spice and a whiff of cocoa. The dense, rather evolved palate offers prune, mocha and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink after 2020.
Name: Crissante Alessandria 2012 Galina  (Barolo)

Description: Dark berry, baking spice and sage aromas come to the forefront. It's rather straightforward, with dried black cherry, clove and nutmeg flavors offset by assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Giacosa Fratelli 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Toasted oak, mocha and pipe tobacco aromas lead the nose. The somewhat lean palate offers black cherry marinated in spirits, star anise and nutmeg while austere tannins provide bracing support. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Josetta Saffirio 2014 Persiera  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of red berry, cake spice and a whiff of underbrush. On the straightforward palate, solid tannins support red cherry, white pepper and star anise. Drink after 2021.
Name: Boasso 2014 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas evoking camphor, dried rose and tilled soil lift out of the glass. The linear, already approachable palate offers licorice, clove and black cherry alongside chewy tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Luigi Drocco 2014  Barolo

Description: This has aromas of forest floor, tobacco leaf and dark-skinned berry. The tightly wound palate offers sour cherry, ground pepper and clove alongside clenching tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Pecchenino 2013 Le Coste di Monforte  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of baking spice, underbrush and a hint of violet take shape in the glass. The straightforward palate shows licorice, black cherry and a hint of sage while bracing tannins squeeze the finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Raineri Gianmatteo 2014  Barolo

Description: Cedar, dark berry and underbrush aromas take shape in the glass while the linear palate delivers sour cherry, mocha and tobacco. Assertive tannins provide the taut framework. Drink after 2022.
Name: Rocca Giovanni 2014 Ravera di Monforte  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, mocha and black-plum aromas take shape on this. The medium-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and a dollop of vanilla alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Virna Borgogno 2014 del Comune di Barolo  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, underbrush and a hint of nutmeg lead the nose. The fresh linear palate offers cranberry, red cherry and a note of white pepper alongside solid tannins that need a few more years to unwind. Drink after 2021.
Name: Cantina Terre del Barolo 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of leather, cedar and a whiff of rose petal emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper and mocha alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Cascina del Monastero 2012 Bricco Rocca Riund  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, white-pepper and dried herb aromas come together on this. The linear palate offers sour cherry, clove and espresso alongside rather grainy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Costa Catterina 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of underbrush, truffle and dark berry emerge from the glass. The taut linear palate offers clove, sour cherry and chopped sage alongside tight tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of mocha, toasted oak and dark berry emerge from the glass. The firm palate delivers black cherry, licorice and vanilla alongside taut close-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2026.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2014 Boiolo  (Barolo)

Description: This has aromas suggesting dark berry, mocha and cooking spice while the solid palate offers blackberry jam, clove and white pepper. Close-grained tannins provide support. Drink after 2022.
Name: Cascina Ballarin 2014 Tre Ciabot  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, French oak and a balsamic note emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers vanilla, roasted coffee bean, dried black cherry and oak-driven spice alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Mauro Sebaste 2012 Ghè Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Blue flower, red berry and a whiff of cedar lead the nose. The firm palate offers cranberry, dried sour cherry and a hint of white pepper alongside fresh acidity and taut tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Olivero 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of vanilla, sawdust and underbrush come together on this. The ripe dense palate offers licorice, tobacco and mocha alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Paolo Manzone 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Toasted oak, espresso, and dark fruit aromas lead the nose. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, roasted coffee bean and clove alongside clenching tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Virna Borgogno 2014 Cannubi Boschis  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas suggesting cedar, vanilla and dark-skinned fruit take shape on this. The firm palate shows black cherry, mocha and licorice alongside tight closed-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Eraldo Viberti 2014 Roncaglie  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of underbrush, leather, dark berry and a whiff of game. The solid palate delivers black cherry, cinnamon and tobacco alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Aurelio Settimo 2014 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals cedar, red berry and a balsamic whiff of camphor. The dense palate offers licorice, tobacco and dried black cherry alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Enrico Serafino 2014  Barolo

Description: Subtle aromas of leather, cedar and a hint of red berry lift out of the glass. The bracing palate offers mocha, clove and raspberry jam alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2014 Arione  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, coconut and a hint of rose petal lead the nose. The dense palate delivers black cherry, mocha and licorice alongside clenching tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Eraldo Viberti 2014 Rocchettevino  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, underbrush and sage come together on this. It's full bodied and straightforward, offering black cherry, clove and a hint of licorice alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Rizieri 2014  Barolo

Description: This has aromas evoking espresso, red plum and vanilla while the tightly wound palate suggests cedar, clove and dark berry. Bracing tannins give it an astringent finish.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2014 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas of vanilla, baking spice and a hint of red berry. The no-frills palate offers tart red cherry, orange peel and clove alongside assertive, astringent tannins.
Name: Natale Verga 2013  Barolo

Description: Subdued aromas of underbrush, leather and dark spice escape the glass. The tight palate evokes raw sour cherry and star anise alongside assertive tannins that leave a lean, abrupt finish.
Name: Negretti 2014  Barolo

Description: Subdued aromas of cooking spice, eucalyptus and mocha lift out of the glass. The linear palate offers dried black cherry steeped in spirits, espresso and baking spice alongside taut, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Simone Scaletta 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, baking spice and leather. The linear palate offers black cherry compote and a hint of clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Canti 2014  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee bean and a whiff of dark-skinned fruit. The taut palate offers sour cherry, vanilla and mocha alongside grippy tannins.
Name: Conterno Fantino 2014 Sorì Ginestra  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, tobacco and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The assertive palate offers espresso, clove and a touch of nutmeg alongside bracing tannins that leave a firm, rather astringent finish.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2014 Fossati  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, red plum, mocha and vanilla form the nose. The tight linear palate offers sour cherry, clove and a touch of dried sage alongside taut tannins that leave a somewhat astringent finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Gianfranco Alessandria 2014 San Giovanni  (Barolo)

Description: Mocha, licorice and toasted oak aromas come together and carry over to the assertive palate along with dried cherry. Tightly wound tannins leave a bracing, astringent finish.
Name: Josetta Saffirio 2012 Millenovecento48  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of cedar, mocha and a whiff of red berry appear in the glass. The tight palate suggests tart cranberry, espresso and clove, while close-grained tannins give it a rather astringent finish. Give it a few years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit. Drink after 2021.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2014 Castello  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of camphor, pine and mocha emerge from the glass. The linear, lean palate offers roasted coffee bean, toasted oak and dried black cherry alongside assertive tannins that leave an astringent finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Cascina del Monastero 2014 Bricco Luciani  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of stewed prune, mocha and vanilla. The rather evolved palate offers dried black cherry steeped in spirits, espresso and baking spice alongside assertive, drying tannins.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This has aromas reminiscent of tilled soil, menthol and cooking spice while the rather lean palate offers oak, espresso and a hint of dark fruit. It has chewy tannins but not a lot of fruit richness.
Name: Paolo Manzone 2014 Ruvej  (Barolo)

Description: Roasted coffee bean, tobacco and sage aromas lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and licorice set against grainy tannins that give it a somewhat astringent finish.
Name: La Fusina 2014  Barolo

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals suggestions of mocha, toasted oak and underbrush. The assertive palate shows dark-skinned cherry alongside hints of star anise and clove. Grainy tannins clench the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Le Cecche 2014 Sorano  (Barolo)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals mocha, underbrush and leather aromas. The tightly wound palate shows sour cherry, vanilla and cocoa alongside aggressive, grainy tannins that leave a rather rough, drying finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Negretti 2014 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)

Description: This has aromas of espresso and prune that carry over to the firm palate together with a note of baking spice and star anise. Assertive tannins give it a clenching finish. Despite the tannins, drink sooner rather later before the remaining fruit dries up.
Name: Ricossa 2009 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This has aromas suggesting tilled soil, dark-skinned fruit and cooking spice. The soft, rather approachable palate offers baked plum and vanilla alongside round tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Sarotto 2014  Barolo

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals aromas of toasted oak, vanilla and black plum. The firm palate presents prune, clove and mocha alongside clenching, astringent tannins. Give the tannins a few years to relax, then drink to capture the remaining fruit. Drink after 2022.
Name: Virna Borgogno 2014 Sarmassa  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of cedar, cooking spice and dark berry emerge from the glass. The linear lean palate offers tart sour cherry, tobacco and cocoa alongside taut tannins that leave an astringent finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2014 Pittatore  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, leather and baking spice emerge from the glass. The solid palate offers sour cherry, clove and orange zest alongside chewy tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Collina San Ponzio 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of cedar, espresso and a balsamic note come to the forefront. The solid palate delivers cherry jam, toast and licorice alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Conterno Fantino 2014 Castelletto Vigna Pressenda  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with roasted coffee bean, cedar and red-plum aromas. The taut palate offers tart sour cherry, clove and licorice alongside tight grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Cavalier Bartolomeo 2013 Altenasso  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of stewed prune, vanilla and toasted hazelnut carry over to the forward palate along with smooth tannins. It's already surprisingly approachable. Drink through 2023.
Name: Sarotto 2013 Briccobergera  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, underbrush and cooking spice carry over to the straightforward palate, together with black cherry. Buffed tannins provide support. Drink after 2020.
Name: Torlasco 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of French oak, mocha and tobacco appear in the glass. The somewhat lean, tightly-wound palate offers dried Marasca cherry, star anise and clove alongside taut, rather grainy tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2014 Case Nere  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of game, scorched earth and a whiff of dark fruit emerge from the glass. The solid monolithic palate offers mocha, dark-skinned berry and licorice alongside clenching tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Le Cecche 2014  Barolo

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, mocha and a whiff of dark-skinned fruit emerge from the glass. On the tightly wound palate, assertive tannins offset espresso, cedar and a touch of black plum. Drink after 2022.
Name: Claudio Alario 2014 Sorano  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of baking spice, cedar and dark berry. The dense palate shows clove, blackberry jam and vanilla set against grippy, astringent tannins.
Name: Fratelli Ponte 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of resin, vanilla and a hint of dark-skinned fruit come together on this. It has a straightforward palate, offering dried black cherry and tobacco alongside evolved tannins.
Name: Lo Zoccolaio 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, mocha and baking spice lead the nose. The dense monolithic palate offers dried black cherry, espresso and a touch of cocoa alongside assertive, tightly wound tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Raineri Gianmatteo 2014 Monserra  (Barolo)

Description: Toasted oak, roasted coffee bean and a whiff of dark berry lead the nose. The taut palate offers toast, espresso and sour cherry alongside firm grainy tannins that leave an astringent, mouth drying close.
Name: Rocca Giovanni 2014 Mosconi  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of cedar, star anise and a whiff of dark-skinned fruit lead the nose. The firm linear palate offers cocoa, clove and sour cherry while bracing, astringent tannins clench the finish.
Name: Broccardo 2014 Bricco San Pietro  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, espresso and dried sage form the nose. The tightly wound palate evokes black cherry jam, coconut, mocha and licorice while astringent tannins dry out the finish.
Name: Conterno Fantino 2014 Mosconi Vigna Ped  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with restrained aromas that suggest baking spice, tilled soil and a whiff of dark berry. The brawny, monolithic palate presents espresso, licorice, French oak and a hint of dried cherry while assertive tannins leave an astringent finish.
Name: Marco Bonfante 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals subdued aromas suggesting tilled soil, leather and mocha. The assertive palate offers prune, nutmeg and espresso alongside clenching tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.
Name: Stroppiana 2014 Leonardo  (Barolo)

Description: This has subdued aromas of baking spice and a slight blue-flower note. The lean simple palate offers sour cherry and a hint of clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: CarlindePaolo 2014  Barolo

Description: Subdued aromas of cedar, coconut and mocha lead the nose while the raw palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and oak extract. Assertive close-grained tannins create an abrupt finish.
Name: Conterno Fantino 2014 Ginestra Vigna del Gris  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, smoke and coconut lead the nose. On the dense palate, close-grained astringent tannins underscore toasted oak, roasted coffee bean, prune and vanilla. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the wood-driven sensations.
Name: Cascina Bongiovanni 2014 Pernanno  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with underbrush, sage and tobacco aromas. The lean tannic palate evokes mocha and cherry marinated in spirits alongside clenching astringent tannins.
Name: Tenuta Montemagno 2012 Soranus  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, mocha and toasted oak emerge from the glass. The taut palate offers tobacco, blackberry jam and licorice alongside raspy astringent tannins.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2014 Torriglione  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, weedy underbrush and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The lean palate delivers raw sour cherry, mocha and a hint of star anise alongside raspy tannins that dry out the finish.
Name: Riva Leone 2013  Barolo

Description: This has aromas that recall leafy underbrush, sawdust and baking spice. The lean oak-driven palate shows licorice, espresso and toast alongside raspy tannins. It ends abruptly on a green note of powdered sage.
Name: Cantina della Torre 2013  Barolo

Description: The nose of this wine comes off slightly medicinal, with notes of walnuts, red earth and smoked bacon. The tannins are parching and dry out most of the fruit tones.
Name: Horton 2014 Nebbiolo (Virginia)

Description: Made entirely with Nebbiolo, this opens with aromas of tobacco, dark berry and tilled soil. The firm palate offers red-skinned berry, cooking spice and a touch of licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Castello di Cicognola 2012 Per Papà Nebbiolo (Provincia di Pavia)

Description: Aromas of honey, bread crust and yellow orchard fruit follow over to the palate along with notes suggesting peach, orange zest, crushed herb and graphite. It has an elegant perlage and bright acidity while a walnut note marks the close.
Name: Travaglini 2013 Metodo Classico Nebolè Extra Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Examples of this variety are rare in the state. Pale in color, this one offers anise, cherry, rose hip, tar, pencil eraser and spice aromas. The palate is highly structured, with tart acidity and firm tannins.
Name: Cana's Feast 2013 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Nebbiolo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Leather and barnyard aromas add complexity without taking over this rich, earthy, smooth-textured and full-bodied wine. Complex flavors like tobacco, rhubarb, black pepper and wild blackberry fill the palate and moderate tannins provide some needed grip. It's on the wild side, for adventurous drinkers.
Name: Cabana Wines 2011 Nebbiolo (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This rare example of Nebbiolo in the state. is quite pale in color, with cherry, citrus, smoke and wet earth aromas. It's light in both flavor and concentration.
Name: Cerulean 2012 Nebbiolo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of new leather, dark spice, wild berry and blue flower combine with an intriguing whiff of smoke on this compelling wine. Delicious and structured, the elegant full-bodied palate delivers mature Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and pipe tobacco framed in taut fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity will keep this going for years if not decades. It's already extremely tempting but hold onto it for even more complexity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Pietro Rinaldi 2013 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of wild red berry, forest floor, rose and new leather fill the glass. The taut full-bodied palate delivers crushed Morello cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and a hint of tobacco framed in firm refined tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. It's already delicious but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Elvio Cogno 2012 Bricco Pernice  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, perfumed berry and exotic spice aromas take center stage on this fragrant elegant red. The structured virile palate delivers strawberry compote, red cherry, licorice and crushed herb framed in firm fine-grained tannins. It's well balanced, with vibrant acidity. Hold for even more complexity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Oddero 2013 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, ripe red-skinned berry and a balsamic note emerge from the glass. The juicy elegant palate delivers crushed raspberry, fleshy black cherry, licorice and tobacco balanced by velvety tannins and surprising freshness for the hot vintage. Drink through 2027.
Name: Cagliero 2009 Ravera Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Alluring aromas of red berry, new leather and underbrush slowly unfold in the glass. The full-bodied, balanced palate doles out mature black cherry, licorice, tobacco and a touch of nutmeg alongside firm polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Ca'Romè 2011 Cerretta Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with enticing aromas of menthol, new leather, forest berry and star anise. Reflecting the nose, the elegantly structured palate delivers flavors of raspberry compote, Marasca cherry, licorice and tobacco framed by fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting tilled soil, violet and a hint of game. The chewy earthy palate evokes black cherry, raspberry, clove and a touch of nutmeg alongside bracing tannins. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2013 Fossati  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas suggesting stewed prune, baking spice, new leather and underbrush lift out of the glass. The structured savory palate is fresher, delivering ripe red cherry, cranberry, crushed mint, tobacco and star anise framed in flexed fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Alessandro Rivetto 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This offers aromas of rose petal, black-skinned berry and a whiff of underbrush. The concentrated palate delivers dried black cherry, star anise, tobacco and a touch of white pepper alongside bracing but fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Cascina del Monastero 2013 Perno  (Barolo)

Description: Violet, ripe berry, new leather and balsamic aromas of menthol and eucalyptus mingle together. The rounded full-bodied palate offers cherry steeped in spirits, licorice and tobacco framed in fine-grained, chewy tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Dosio 2011 Fossati Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Intriguing aromas of underbrush, mature dark-skinned fruit, dark culinary spice, new leather and balsamic notes slowly unfold in the glass. The chewy full-bodied palate delivers fleshy Morello cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco. Velvety tannins provide firm polished support. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Livia Fontana 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Violet, forest berry, exotic spice and balsamic aromas take center stage. Taut and structured, the elegant savory palate shows raspberry compote, ripe cranberry, star anise and white pepper while tightly drawn, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Revello Fratelli 2013 Giachini  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of rose petal, red cherry, leather and a hint of truffle. The bright juicy palate doles out crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco alongside austere but polished tannins and fresh acidity. It's already tempting but will be even better after more aging. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Cagliero 2013 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Mature black-skinned berry, new leather, pressed rose and camphor aromas are in the foreground. It's full-bodied, with dried black cherry, mature cranberry, licorice and dried herb set against flexed, fine-gained tannins. Drink 2020–2032.
Name: Ca' Viola 2012 Sottocastello di Novello  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, baked plum, leather, aromatic herb and pipe tobacco aromas lift out of the glass. On the robust palate, velvety, enveloping tannins support fleshy Marasca cherry, star anise, dried mint and an earthy hint of salted game. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Gigi Rosso 2011 Arione dell'Ulivo Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, underbrush, tobacco leaf and a whiff of porcini mushroom. The savory balanced palate delivers juicy black cherry, white pepper and licorice, while firm but fine-grained tannins provide structure. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Serradenari 2013 Serradenari  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, new leather and a whiff of cake spice. The structured balanced palate doles out black cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2013  Barolo

Description: Spicy aromas of star anise, ground clove and underbrush align with a whiff of menthol. It's ripe and full bodied, offering Marasca cherry, juicy cranberry, licorice and tobacco framed in densely woven, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Alessandro Rivetto 2013 Lazzarito  (Barolo)

Description: Dried rose petal, scorched soil, camphor, star anise and a whiff of grilled herb lead the way. The firmly structured palate evokes spirits-soaked cherry, licorice, dried sage, leather and roasted coffee bean set against bracing grippy tannins that clench the finish. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Oddero 2011 Vigna Mondoca Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of iris, red-skinned berry, new leather and a balsamic note lift out of the glass. The full-bodied elegant palate offers juicy raspberry, black cherry, licorice and white pepper alongside firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Pietro Rinaldi 2013  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, underbrush, tobacco leaf and a whiff of porcini mushroom. The savory balanced palate delivers juicy black cherry, white pepper and licorice, while firm but fine-grained tannins provide structure. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Serradenari 2013 Serradenari  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, new leather and a whiff of cake spice. The structured balanced palate doles out black cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2013  Barolo

Description: Violet, red berry, dark spice and a whiff of camphor come together on this vibrant red. The elegant savory palate doles out juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry, baking spice and truffle while lithe tannins provide elegant support. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Already approachable, it also offers good midterm aging. Drink through 2023.
Name: Ascheri 2013  Barolo

Description: Dark berry, underbrush and a whisper of violet emerge from the glass. The structured palate delivers black cherry, licorice, clove and white pepper alongside dusty but polished tannins. Drink through 2027.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2012 1961  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, red berry and a whiff of aromatic herb lead the nose. The vibrant balanced palate offers juicy red cherry, raspberry jam, tobacco and star anise alongside firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2013 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of woodland berry, rose petal, tobacco and a whiff of tilled earth slowly unfold on this wine. Taut and vibrant, the palate offers Marasca cherry, raspberry compote and star anise set against tightly drawn refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink after 2023.
Name: Livia Fontana 2013 Fontanin  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of truffle, new leather, dark-skinned berry and dried herb lead the nose. It's savory and full bodied, doling out crushed raspberry, juicy black cherry, ground clove and tobacco alongside solid, refined tannins. Drink through 2027.
Name: Marziano Abbona 2012 Pressenda  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, cake spice, fragrant iris and a whiff of new leather are just some of the aromas you'll find on this perfumed full-bodied red. The enveloping palate delivers raspberry compote, coconut, licorice and well integrated French oak while fine-grained tannins offer polished support. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol but the juicy fruit richness keeps it in check. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Revello Fratelli 2013 Conca  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas suggesting scorched earth, truffle, leather and grilled herb take shape in the glass. The forward full-bodied palate delivers dried black cherry, steeped prune, licorice and tobacco framed in tightly knit, velvety tannins. Drink through 2026.
Name: Franco Conterno 2011 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This offers inviting aromas of woodland berry, underbrush, rose, culinary spice and incense. Mirroring the nose, the youthfully austere full-bodied palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry preserve, licorice and Asian spice set against a backbone of firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Diego Pressenda La Torricella 2013 Barbadelchi  (Barolo)

Description: Bright red-skinned berry, rose and baking spice aromas unfold in the glass. The polished palate offers crushed raspberry, juicy red cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2028.
Name: Giulia Negri 2012 Serradenari  (Barolo)

Description: This has inviting aromas of black-skinned berry, leather, tilled soil and a hint of truffle. The structured palate offers raspberry jam, dried black cherry, star anise and a hint of cocoa alongside fine-grained, elegant tannins. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Tenuta Cucco 2010 Cerrati Vigna Cucco Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of baking spice, leather and dark berry. The solid, concentrated palate offers ripe black cherry, mocha and vanilla alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Azelia 2013 San Rocco  (Barolo)

Description: Truffle, new leather, scorched earth and tobacco aromas are front and center. The solid, structured palate offers cranberry, dried cherry and licorice framed in taut, fine-gained tannins. Drink from 2020 through 2026.
Name: Barale Fratelli 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Textbook Nebbiolo aromas of rose petal, red berry, new leather and dark spice emerge on this fragrant red. Vibrant and poised, the elegant medium-bodied palate delivers strawberry, tart cherry, white pepper and star anise framed in taut polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2019–2028.
Name: Fontanafredda 2013 Vigneti Propri  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing scents suggesting red-skinned berry, rose petal and pipe tobacco emerge in the glass. The savory palate delivers ripe black cherry, clove and a touch of nutmeg alongside firm tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Paolo Manzone 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Rose, underbrush, cake spice and ripe black-skinned berry aromas lift out of the glass. The smooth savory palate offers crushed Marasca cherry, cranberry and licorice alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. It's already delicious but also promises lots of enjoyment over the next few years. Drink through 2020.
Name: Borgogno 2012 No Name  (Barolo)

Description: Exotic spice, underbrush, pressed rose, new leather and steeped prune are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant red. The round, accessible palate offers fleshy raspberry, dried black cherry and baking spice set against velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Elio Filippino 2012 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of violet, leather and a balsamic note lift out of the glass. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and nutmeg alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Marziano Abbona 2011 Cerviano  (Barolo)

Description: Blackberry, underbrush and star anise aromas mingle in the glass. The firm palate offers raw red cherry, sage and white pepper alongside tight tannins that need time to evolve. Drink after 2023.
Name: Amalia 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Balsamic whiffs suggesting menthol and camphor underscore ripe black-skinned berry and scorched earth aromas. The ripe full-bodied palate gives raspberry preserve, steeped prune and licorice alongside firm, refined tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Borgogno 2012 Fossati  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, red-skinned berry and leather aromas take center stage on this young Barolo. The juicy palate offers Morello cherry, clove and white pepper alongside taut fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Réva 2013  Barolo

Description: Wild berry, rose petal, cake spice and a whiff of chopped herb aromas form an enticing bouquet on this savory red. The youthful but already approachable palate give Morello cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper. Refined tannins and bright acidity provide balance and support. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Alessandro Rivetto 2013  Barolo

Description: Dark berry, forest floor and a balsamic note come together on this. The concentrated savory palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and star anise alongside tightly knight tannins that need to unwind. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2013 Baudana  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and underbrush lead the way. The structured palate offers red plum, raspberry jam, licorice and white pepper alongside firm refined tannins. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Silvio Grasso 2013 Turnè  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, underbrush, scorched soil and leather all come together in the glass. On the structured palate, firm polished tannins support mature black cherry, licorice and tobacco. Drink 2019–2027.
Name: Tenuta Cucco 2012 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of tilled soil, dark berry, vanilla and nutmeg. The chewy palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and cinnamon alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. Drink after 2021.
Name: Amalia 2013 Le Coste di Monforte  (Barolo)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of Morello cherry, cake spice and aromatic herb. The polished palate offers crushed raspberry, blackberry jam, nutmeg and white pepper alongside firm fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Brandini 2013 Resa 56  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red plum, baking spice and a hint of pipe tobacco slowly take shape. The ripe savory palate offers black-cherry jam, star anise and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2027.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2011 Coste di Rose Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this firm red opens with aromas of red cherry, baking spice and cedar. The tight palate shows raw raspberry, clove and a touch of mocha alongside fresh acidity. Austere tannins provide the framework and need a few more years to soften. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Brandini 2013 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, baking spice and cedar emerge from the glass. The firmly structured palate offers black cherry, star anise and whiff of cocoa alongside taut tannins. Drink 2023–2030.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2013 Pittatore  (Barolo)

Description: Red-skinned berry, forest floor, pipe tobacco and a hint of leather come together in the glass. The chewy palate offers fleshy raspberry, clove and star anise accompanied by firm tannins. Drink after 2019.
Name: Giulia Negri 2012 La Tartufaia  (Barolo)

Description: Red-skinned berry, underbrush and leather scents come together in the glass. The linear palate offers cranberry, cinnamon and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink from 2018 through 2028.
Name: Serradenari 2013 La Vetta  (Barolo)

Description: Nutmeg, violet and alpine herb aromas lead the nose. The concentrated savory palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2024.
Name: Simone Scaletta 2013 Bricco San Pietro  (Barolo)

Description: Alluring aromas of iris, red-skinned berry and underbrush lead the way. The full-bodied palate offers crushed raspberry, red cherry, clove and sage alongside firm tannins. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Réva 2013 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of red plum, tobacco and leather. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, espresso and dark spice alongside assertive tannins that still need a few years to unwind. Best to drink after 2021.
Name: Silvio Grasso 2013  Barolo

Description: Dark berry, leather and cedar aromas lead the nose. The solid palate offers mature black cherry, licorice and sage alongside tightly wound tannins that need to unwind. Drink after 2023.
Name: Podere Ruggeri Corsini 2013 Bussia Corsini  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, vanilla and star anise. The firm linear palate delivers dried black cherry, clove and a hint of mocha framed in fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Cascina Ballarin 2013 Bricco Rocca  (Barolo)

Description: Alluring aromas of iris, dark berry and mint emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers black cherry, clove and star anise alongside firm, polished tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Cascina Ballarin 2013 Tre Ciabot  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of vanilla, mature black plum and a whiff of cocoa. The ripe, already accessible palate delivers blackberry jam, licorice and star anise alongside velvety tannins. You'll also feel the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2023.
Name: Cascina del Monastero 2011 Bricco Rocca Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Violet, aromatic herb, fragrant spice and a whiff of new leather come together in the glass. On the vibrant elegant palate, fine-grained tannins and racy acidity frame raspberry, tart red cherry and star anise. It's still a little austere and needs a few more years to unwind. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Dosio 2013 Serradenari  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, forest floor and a whiff of crushed mint lead the way. The structured palate offers fleshy Morello cherry, licorice and clove alongside firm but polished tannins. Drink 2023–2032.
Name: Ellena 2013 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)

Description: Black-skinned berry, scorched earth and leather aromas come together in the glass. The ripe palate delivers black cherry, cinnamon, white pepper and star anise alongside firm tannins. Give this a few more years to fully open up. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Gianfranco Alessandria 2013  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting red-skinned berry, underbrush, leather and a whiff of green peppercorn. The juicy palate offers black cherry, crushed raspberry, white pepper and a licorice note alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2013 Tre Utin  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, tilled soil and a balsamic note. The firm palate evokes Marasca cherry, star anise and nutmeg alongside fresh acidity and bracing tannins. Give it time to unwind. Drink after 2023.
Name: Tenuta L'Illuminata 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of dried rose, espresso, star anise and a touch of oak lead the way. The austere, medium-bodied palate offers dried red cherry, licorice and tobacco set against taut, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. It's elegantly austere and still has years ahead of it. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Vite Colte 2008 Essenze Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Pipe tobacco, wild berry, violet and balsamic aromas mingle together on this structured red. The tight solid palate offers crushed cherry, vanilla, star anise and a hint of oak alongside taut close-grained tannins.
Name: Tenuta Montanello 2013  Barolo

Description: Violets, red-skinned berry and mint aromas come together on this. The savory palate delivers crushed raspberry, red cherry and cinnamon alongside young fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Veglio 2012  Barolo

Description: Dark berry, leather and cooking-spice aromas lead the nose. The bold palate delivers black cherry, dark chocolate and licorice alongside close-grained tannins that need time to unwind.
Name: Amalia 2013  Barolo

Description: Inviting aromas of dark berry, underbrush and baking spice unfold in the glass. The savory palate offers red cherry, licorice and white pepper alongside firm refined tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Azelia 2013  Barolo

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark berry, tobacco and cedar. The firm palate offers dried cherry, licorice and clove framed in close-grained tannins. Give it another year or two to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit. Drink after 2019.
Name: Ca'Romè 2011 Rapet Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with inviting aromas of dark berry, cedar and a whiff of mocha. The tight palate offers raspberry jam, clove, espresso and licorice alongside austere, somewhat astringent tannins that leave a firm finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Ca'Romè 2013 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: This offers aromas of iris, cedar and underbrush. The dense firm palate evokes ripe blackberry, licorice and tobacco alongside young tightly wound tannins. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2013 Boiolo  (Barolo)

Description: The nose is still rather closed but eventually reveals culinary-spice, red-skinned berry and tobacco aromas. The tightly wound palate offers sour cherry, white pepper and sage alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Le Ginestre 2013 Sottocastello di Novello  (Barolo)

Description: Delicate aromas suggesting star anise, leather and a whiff of iris slowly emerge in the glass. The medium-bodied elegant palate shows sour cherry, clove and white pepper notes alongside bright acidity and youthful, lithe tannins. Drink 2021–2027.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of rose petal, mocha and a whiff of sage. The vibrant, youthfully austere palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside taut fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink after 2023.
Name: Poderi Luigi Einaudi 2013 Terlo Vigna Costa Grimaldi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, sage and a hint of orange peel lead the nose. The savory palate offers ripe blackberry, vanilla and a touch of cocoa alongside firm but ripe tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Rocche Costamagna 2013 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, leather and scorched earth aromas come together on this. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise alongside velvety tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2013 Undicicomuni  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, tobacco and a whiff of camphor. The concentrated palate offers black cherry, clove and a menthol note alongside assertive tannins. Drink 2024–2032.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2013 Fossati  (Barolo)

Description: Dried herb, mocha and dark berry aromas lead the way while the full-bodied palate offers raspberry jam, roasted coffee bean and vanilla. Close-grained tannins leave a somewhat astringent finish.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2013 Ravera  (Barolo)

Description: Dark berry, cedar and dried sage aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of espresso. The firm palate evokes blackberry jam, clove and coffee bean, while assertive tannins lead to a tight close.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2013 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Scents of woodland berry, star anise and rose unite with a whiff of camphor on this fragrant red. The racy palate is a bit on the lean side, offering sour cherry, cranberry and licorice alongside taut tannins and vibrant acidity. What it doesn't have in terms of body it makes up for with finesse. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Dosio 2013  Barolo

Description: This has subdued aromas of cedar, roasted coffee bean and ripe black-skinned berry. The firmly structured, dense palate offers licorice, coconut and ripe blackberry alongside clenching tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2013 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of violet, cedar, mocha and a balsamic note are at the forefront. The firmly structured palate delivers juicy red cherry, toast, espresso and licorice alongside assertive tannins that give the finish grip.
Name: Giovanni Manzone 2013 Bricat  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of baking spice, graphite and black-skinned fruit guide the nose. The robust palate delivers sour cherry, star anise and clove while austere tannins offer bracing support.
Name: Gomba Boschetti 2013 Boschetti  (Barolo)

Description: Leather, mocha and a balsamic note lead the nose. The compacted palate shows tart cranberry, espresso and dark spice alongside close-grained tannins that squeeze the firm finish.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2013 Castello  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, underbrush and a hint of violet. The tight austere palate offers raw Marasca cherry, star anise and mocha alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Boroli 2013  Barolo

Description: Initially shy, this eventually reveals subtle aromas of toast, espresso and dark-skinned berry. The assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, black cherry jam and black pepper alongside taut, close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Boroli 2013 Cerequio  (Barolo)

Description: Toast, mocha and dark-skinned-fruit aromas emerge from the glass. The tightly knit palate offers black cherry jam, cedar and dried sage alongside assertive tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Ca'Romè 2013 Rapet  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark berry, tilled soil and leather. The firm palate suggests dried black cherry, clove and a hint of star anise alongside tightly wound, close-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2025.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Cedar, mocha and dark-skinned berry aromas lead the nose. The firm palate offers espresso, star anise and blackberry jam alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2020.
Name: Cascina del Monastero 2013 Bricco Luciani  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, tilled soil and hint of green peppercorn lead the way. The firm no-frills palate delivers ripe black plum, licorice and star anise alongside taut tannins.
Name: Rattalino 2011 Trentasette37 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Subdued aromas of dark berry, underbrush, leather and a whiff of white pepper emerge in the glass. The solid straightforward palate offers black cherry, clove and a touch of licorice framed in assertive tannins that give the finish grip. Drink after 2023.
Name: Tenimenti Famiglia Cavallero 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of cedar, mocha and dark-skinned fruit lead the nose. The dense palate offers black-cherry jam, vanilla and cocoa alongside a backbone of close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Azelia 2013 Bricco Fiasco  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of vanilla, cedar and black-skinned berry come together on this. The ripe, rather evolved palate offers black-cherry extract, licorice and mocha alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Paolo Manzone 2009 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry and a whiff of culinary spice emerge in the glass. The taut linear palate offers raspberry, licorice and clove alongside close-grained tannins that provide a grippy finish. Drink after 2021.
Name: Salvano 2013  Barolo

Description: Fig, underbrush and toast aromas emerge in the glass along with a whiff of mint. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, espresso, clove and cedar alongside assertive tannins that need to unwind. Drink 2019–2024.
Name: Tenuta Cucco 2012 Cerrati  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, mocha and tobacco lead the nose. The forward palate is already almost accessible, offering dried black cherry, vanilla and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Voerzio Martini 2012 La Serra  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, underbrush and cedar aromas emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers raw strawberry, licorice and tobacco set against close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink up to enjoy the remaining fruit. Drink after 2021.
Name: Arnaldo Rivera 2013 Boiolo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas suggesting leather, tobacco leaf, berry and balsamic notes mingle with a whiff of underbrush. The firm no-frills palate delivers crushed raspberry, cranberry and baking spice framed in bright acidity and solid tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2013 Preda  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with restrained aromas suggesting dark-skinned fruit, forest floor and baking spice. The dense palate delivers Marasca cherry, tobacco and clove alongside taut tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Crissante Alessandria 2012 Roggeri  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, leather and dried herb aromas lead the nose. The firmly structured palate offers dried black cherry, sage and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Podere Ruggeri Corsini 2013 Bricco San Pietro  (Barolo)

Description: This presents aromas of tilled soil, truffle and a hint of black-skinned berry. The rather evolved palate delivers blackberry jam, cedar and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Rocche Costamagna 2011 Rocche dell'Annunziata Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of mocha, dark berry and cedar emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers espresso, prune and licorice alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Tenuta Rocca 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark berry, baking spice and leather lead the nose. The savory straightforward palate offers black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2027.
Name: Villa Penna 2012  Barolo

Description: Espresso, cedar and a hint of dark spice aromas slowly take shape on this. The austere palate delivers prune, mocha and clove alongside bracing tannins that leave an astringent, drying finish.
Name: Boroli 2013 Brunella  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, leather and clove aromas come together on this. The chewy palate offers raspberry, black cherry and star anise alongside assertive tannins that leave a firm finish. Drink after 2020.
Name: Cabutto 2013 Tenuta La Volta  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of camphor, tilled soil and a whiff of woodland berry. The solid palate delivers tobacco, vanilla and dried cherry alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Ellena 2013 Ascheri  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, black-skinned fruit and mocha. The assertive palate offers toasted oak, licorice and black cherry jam alongside tightly packed, aggressive tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Paolo Manzone 2013 Meriame  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with light aromas of baking spice, underbrush and a whiff of iris. The straightforward palate evokes blackberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins.
Name: Abrigo 2013 Ravera Tambuss  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of espresso, cedar, dried sage and a hint of blue flower lift out of the glass. The dense palate offers dried black cherry, coconut, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside grainy tannins that generate a rather astringent finish.
Name: Eraldo Viberti 2013 Roncaglie  (Barolo)

Description: This has aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, cinnamon and a whiff of used leather. The structured palate shows black cherry jam, anisette and ground pepper alongside aggressive tannins. Drink 2018–2030.
Name: Gomba Boschetti 2010 Boschetti Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of black plum, vanilla and cedar. The chewy palate offers dried Marasca cherry, mocha and star anise alongside assertive grainy tannins that give it a rather astringent finish.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2010 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, cedar and a whiff of smoke. The firm palate offers mature blackberry, clove and a touch of bitter almond alongside close-grained tannins that give the finish grip.
Name: Villa Penna 2010 La Serra  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, black-skinned berry and a hint of coconut. The tightly knit palate offers dried cherry, espresso and toast alongside bracing, rather astringent tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Silvio Grasso 2013 Bricco Manzoni  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of baking spice, rose petal and leather. The firm straightforward palate offers sour cherry, clove and green peppercorn alongside assertive tannins.
Name: Sylla Sebaste 2013  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas sawdust, tobacco and a whiff of dark berry. The firm palate delivers star anise, ripe black cherry, clove and star anise alongside close-grained rather astringent tannins.
Name: Aldo Clerico 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of toast, espresso and powdered sage carry over to the firm palate together with clove and blackberry jam. Grainy tannins provide the framework and give it a rather astringent finish.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2013 Case Nere  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, mocha, underbrush and a hint of game emerge from the glass. The solid palate evokes dried black cherry, licorice and clove alongside firm close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Bricco Maiolica 2013 Contadin  (Barolo)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting dark berry, baking spice and a whiff of balsam. The medium-bodied, straightforward palate offers clove, Marasca cherry and a hint of star anise alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2020.
Name: Fortemasso 2013 Castelletto  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of red plum, toast, coffee and vanilla. The taut palate offers clove, powdered sage and raw sour cherry alongside close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent finish. Drink after 2021.
Name: Gianfranco Alessandria 2013 San Giovanni  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of black plum, roasted coffee bean and baking spice mingle in the glass. The tightly wound palate delivers black cherry, espresso and licorice alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2021.
Name: Monti 2013 del Comune di Monforte d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, exotic spice and pressed rose. The tightly wound palate offers sour cherry, espresso and sage alongside assertive tannins that leave a rather astringent finish.
Name: Olivero 2013 Bricco Rocca  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdues aromas of dark-skinned fruit, culinary spice and a hint of espresso. The taut palate offers raspberry jam, clove and mocha alongside tight close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2013 Monrobiolo di Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas suggesting toasted oak, dark-skinned fruit and espresso come together in the glass. The tight palate shows baked plum, mocha and clove alongside bracing, grainy tannins that leave a grippy, mouthpuckering finish.
Name: Cascina Ballarin 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Subtle aromas of tobacco leaf, mocha and mature dark berry unfold in the glass. The bracing palate offers licorice, espresso, clove and black-currant jam alongside assertive, mouth-drying tannins.
Name: Enzo Boglietti 2013 Arione  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark berry, cedar and mocha lead the way. The compacted palate shows prune, vanilla and tobacco alongside close-grained, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Silvio Grasso 2013 Annunziata Vigna Plicotti  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas suggesting scorched earth, game and a hint of black plum. The ripe palate offers prune, clove and mocha alongside clenching tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2010 Luigi Arnulfo  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of vanilla, baking spice and a hint of rose petal. The linear no-frills palate shows red cherry, clove and a touch of orange peel alongside polished tannins.
Name: Natale Verga 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of black plum, toast and powdered sage lift out of the glass. The firm palate offers black currant jam, licorice and star anise alongside tightly knit assertive tannins that give it a grippy finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Silvio Grasso 2013 Bricco Luciani  (Barolo)

Description: This has earthy aromas of tobacco leaf, forest floor and dark-skinned berry. The austere palate offers tart sour cherry, tangerine peel, clove and licorice alongside close-grained, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2013  Barolo

Description: This opens with aromas of cedar, vanilla and cocoa while the linear palate offers clove, tobacco and a hint of dark berry. Assertive tannins leave a rather astringent finish.
Name: Raineri Gianmatteo 2013  Barolo

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of game, leather and baked plum. The straightforward palate offers black-cherry jam, cinnamon and a note of orange peel alongside evolved tannins. It's rather forward for such a young Barolo so drink sooner rather than later.
Name: San Silvestro 2013 Patres  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of black plum, cocoa and vanilla. The dense palate delivers chocolate, blackberry jam and mocha alongside assertive tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink.
Name: Torlasco 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of cedar, vanilla and red plum emerge. The tightly packed palate offers mocha, licorice and black-cherry jam alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Giovanni Manzone 2011 Gramolere Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas suggesting toasted oak, red plum and mocha. The dense palate shows clove, espresso, cedar and toasted oak along with a touch of dried black cherry. Astringent tannins leave a mouth-drying finish.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2013 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of cherry marinated in spirits, coffee and vanilla that carry over to the tightly wound palate along with powdered sage and licorice. Bracing tannins give it an astringent finish.
Name: Mario Gagliasso 2013 Torriglione  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with light aromas suggesting cedar, mocha and vanilla. The assertive palate shows black-cherry jam, espresso and licorice alongside taut rather astringent tannins.
Name: Eraldo Viberti 2013 Rocchettevino  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of baking spice and red plum. The straightforward palate delivers vanilla, espresso, licorice and a hint of dried cherry alongside assertive tannins.
Name: Marco Bonfante 2013  Barolo

Description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting dark berry, scorched earth and a whiff of leather. The dense palate offers dried sour cherry, clove and a hint of sage alongside raspy tannins that give it a grainy finish.
Name: San Silvestro 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, baked plum and mocha lead the nose. The dense, evolved palate offers prune, licorice and espresso alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. You'll also detect the heat of evident alcohol that throws it off balance.
Name: Monti 2011 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Restrained aromas suggesting red-skinned berry, clove and licorice carry over to the austere no-frills palate alongside a hint of white pepper. Bracing tannins clench the finish. Drink after 2023.
Name: Tenimenti Famiglia Cavallero 2013 La Fenice  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, baking spice and coconut. The dense palate offers espresso, prune and bitter chocolate alongside bracing tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Raineri Gianmatteo 2013 Monserra  (Barolo)

Description: This hearty no-frills red has earthy aromas of underbrush, used leather, tobacco leaf and subdued berry. The brawny, monolithic palate shows cranberry jam, vanilla and orange peel alongside solid tannins and the warmth of alcohol. It lacks the complexity one expects in Barolo.
Name: Cascina Adelaide 2013 4 Vigne  (Barolo)

Description: This has subdued aromas reminiscent of dark berry, cooking spice and scorched earth. The simple palate offers sour cherry, powdered sage and clove alongside raspy tannins that give it an abrupt, astringent finish.
Name: Marco Bonfante 2011 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: You'll find aromas of ripe berry, exotic spice, scorched earth, violet and balsamic notes on this generous fragrant red. The structured savory palate delivers crushed raspberry, succulent red cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside decisive but refined tannins. It's balanced, with fresh acidity.
Name: Arpepe 2009 Sassella Ultimi Raggi  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Truffle, flint and wild berry aromas mingle with pipe tobacco and a whiff of new leather on this radiant red. On the savory precise palate, licorice and white pepper underscore a juicy core of red cherry and cranberry alongside a flinty mineral vein. Polished tannins and fresh acidity provide impeccable balance. Drink through 2032.
Name: Arpepe 2012 Sassella Stella Retica  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Rose petal, wild berry, graphite and crushed aromatic herb lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the fresh linear palate offers strawberry, sour cherry, white pepper and a savory saline note. Bright acidity and polished tannins provide graceful support. Drink through 2027.
Name: Arpepe 2012 Grumello Rocca De Piro  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Aromas of red berry, dark culinary spice, wild mint and a whiff of new leather are textbook mountain Nebbiolo. The savory racy palate is loaded with finesse, delivering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, star anise and tobacco set against taut ultrafine tannins. A mineral note closes the finish while vibrant acidity gives it energy and balance.
Name: Nera 2010 Sassella Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Wild berry, rose petal, smoke, new leather and alpine-herb aromas make for a delicate bouquet. Focused and savory, the bright, elegant palate delivers cranberry, pomegranate, white pepper and black tea framed in taut refined tannins and bright acidity. A tangy saline note lingers on the close. While some may find this almost too austere, if you love finesse you'll be captivated. Drink through 2027.
Name: Arpepe 2012 Inferno Fiamme Antiche  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This radiant savory mountain Nebbiolo opens with enticing scents of wild berry, flint, smoke and a whiff of alpine herb. It's elegant and focused, delivering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside taut refined tannins and bright acidity. It's already tempting but will develop even more complexity over the next several years or more. Drink 2020–2032.
Name: La Perla Marco Triacca 2012 La Mossa  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Aromas suggesting steeped prune, dark culinary spice, new leather, tobacco and balsamic notes lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the firmly structured palate along with raisin and licorice, while tightly knit fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide the austere framework. A smoky mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Nera 2011  Sforzato di Valtellina

Description: New leather, baked plum, truffle and fruitcake aromas rise up from the glass. It's rounded and full bodied, with velvety tannins that underscore fig, steeped prune, cinnamon, graphite and chewing tobacco. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors. Drink through 2023.
Name: Nino Negri 2013 Sfursat Carlo Negri  (Sforzato di Valtellina)

Description: This offers nuanced aromas of black cherry, red plum, rosewater, crisp red-delicious apple, burnt orange and Christmas spices. These aromas unfold onto the palate where the spices really sing. While this wine is in balance, boasting bright and zippy acidity and ample weight, the woody and spiced tannins stand out and steal the show.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2014 Reserve Nebbiolo (Virginia)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, violet and leather. The savory balanced palate doles out raspberry jam, black cherry, tobacco and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2027.
Name: Mamete Prevostini 2013 Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas of woodland berry, alpine herb, menthol and whiffs of oak-driven spice. The elegant precise palate delivers sour cherry, cranberry, star anise and a hint of salty mineral set against a backbone of fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. It's still youthfully austere and needs time to fully develop. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Plozza 2013 RedEdition  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Aromas of baked plum, underbrush and balsamic notes lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and licorice, with fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Caven 2011 Messere  (Sforzato di Valtellina)

Description: Aromas of fig, chopped mint and tobacco follow over to the structured full-bodied palate along with steeped prune, cranberry and licorice. Tightly woven fine-grained tannins provide the framework while fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Plozza 2013 BlackEdition Sforzato Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas of raspberry, violet and baking spice that carry over to the bright easygoing palate along with a touch of white pepper. Fresh acidity and velvety tannins provide supple support.
Name: Mamete Prevostini 2015 Santa Rita  (Valtellina)

Description: Aromas suggesting fruitcake, blue flower and dark spice lead the nose. It's taut and medium-bodied, offering dried cherry, cranberry, sage and clove set against tight, close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: Nino Negri 2015 Vigneto Fracia  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas suggesting small red berry, pipe tobacco and a whiff of chopped mint. The smooth bright palate delivers crushed strawberry, orange zest, a hint of clove and a smoky mineral note. Buffed tannins and vibrant acidity provide support. Drink over the next few years.
Name: Nera 2010 Grumello Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents of wild berry, star anise and alpine herb float out of the glass. On the polished palate, supple tannins lightly support juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry preserve and clove. A mineral note wraps up the finish.
Name: Arpepe 2015 Rosso  (Valtellina)

Description: Aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and a whiff of alpine herb lift out of the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, tobacco and a touch of white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Caven 2010 Inferno Al Carmine Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Enticingly delicate scents of wild berry, mountain herb, blue flower and a whiff of culinary spice come together on this fragrant Nebbiolo. The elegant vibrant palate offers tart cherry, crushed strawberry and a hint of star anise framed in tight, refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2022.
Name: Nera 2010 Inferno Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: You'll find red berry, rose petal and thyme aromas on this fresh mountain Nebbiolo. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside polished tannins.
Name: Caven 2010 Sassella La Priora Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of red-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of mint. The straightforward palate offers raspberry jam, tobacco and a touch of licorice alongside polished tannins.
Name: Caven 2010 Giupa Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Subtle aromas of vanilla, cedar and steeped prune slowly take shape on this. The dense palate offers dried black cherry, mocha, licorice and star anise alongside close-grained tannins.
Name: Mamete Prevostini 2013 Corte di Cama  (Sforzato di Valtellina)

Description: Crushed aromatic herb, underbrush and balsamic aromas lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside close-grained, austere tannins. Drink after 2022.
Name: Mamete Prevostini 2015 Sassella Sommarovina  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Made with 100% Nebbiolo this has fresh aromas of wild red berry, violet and a whiff of star anise. The racy linear palate delivers pomegranate, sour cherry and dried alpine herb alongside vibrant acidity and taut, polished tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Nera 2013 Inferno Efesto  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Vibrant and linear, this opens with aromas of French oak, exotic spice and a whiff of wild rose. The palate has a nervous tension, offering oak-driven spice, sage and cranberry set against racy acidity and fine-grained tannins.
Name: Nino Negri 2014 Le Tense  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking red-skinned berry, alpine herb and vanilla. The linear palate offers Marasca cherry, tobacco and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Mamete Prevostini 2015 Grumello Garof  (Valtellina Superiore)

Appellation: Terrazze Retiche di Sondrio, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting wild strawberry, rose petal and a whiff of mint take shape in the glass. The lively palate delivers crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry and a hint of cinnamon alongside lithe tannins.
Name: Mamete Prevostini 2016 Botonero Nebbiolo (Terrazze Retiche di Sondrio)

Description: Blue flower, baked plum, vanilla and oak aromas segue over to the bright palate along with black cherry and star anise. Fresh acidity and polished tannins are there to provide support.
Name: Triacca 2012 Sassella Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of toasted oak, baked plum and leather. The concentrated palate delivers vanilla, espresso, black-cherry jam and licorice alongside assertive tannins.
Name: Mamete Prevostini 2013 Albareda  (Sforzato di Valtellina)

Description: This opens with aromas reminiscent of star anise, tobacco, woodland berry and a whiff of oak-driven spice. On the vibrant austere palate, bright acidity and lithe taut tannins provide tense support for cranberry, sour cherry and a hint of clove. Drink after 2020.
Name: Triacca 2013 La Gatta Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Dark baking spice, wild berry and a whiff of pressed rose form a delicate bouquet. The light-bodied easygoing palate offers strawberry, pomegranate and a hint of tobacco alongside vibrant acidity and lithe tannins. Drink through 2019.
Name: Nino Negri 2014 Quadrio  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: Raspberry, violet and new leather aromas lead the nose. The lithe, rather light-bodied palate offers sour cherry, strawberry and a hint of white pepper. It's easygoing, with supple tannins and firm acidity. Enjoy soon.
Name: Nera 2012 Sassella Alisio  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: The delicate nose suggests wild berry and a whiff of culinary spice that carry over to the fresh easygoing palate along with crushed strawberry and white pepper. It's already approachable, with bright acidity and lithe tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Nino Negri 2014  Valtellina Superiore

Description: This has subdued aroma suggesting forest floor, leather and a whiff of menthol. The light-bodied palate offers tart sour cherry, cranberry and a note of dark culinary spice alongside racy acidity.
Name: Triacca 2014 Casa La Gatta  (Valtellina Superiore)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This variety is unheard of in the appellation. Quite pale in color with an orange tinge, the aromas bring notes of macerated cranberry and cherry, along with a vanilla note that gives the impression of confection. The palate brings lighter-styled fruit flavors, with the oak taking over on the back half. The tannins are quite light for the variety. It's intriguing but doesn't seem varietal.
Name: Watermill 2014 Dugger Creek Vineyard Nebbiolo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: This opens with muddled aromas suggesting minestrone soup, prune, celery and coffee that carry over to the full-bodied palate along with mature black cherry, baking spice and crushed black olive. Loose-knit, close-grained tannins try to hold it all together.
Name: Triacca 2012 San Domenico  (Sforzato di Valtellina)

Description: Aromas suggesting underbrush and smoke carry over to the simple palate along with raw cranberry and a hint of clove. It's light bodied, with racy acidity and a lean finish.
Name: Triacca 2014 Sassella  (Valtellina Superiore)

Description: This isn't just a great wine for what was a notoriously cool, wet vintage, it's quite simply a magnificent wine. Perfumed and loaded with finesse, it opens with scents of woodland berry, iris and baking spice while the vibrant, balanced palate doles out Marasca cherry, dark culinary spice, crushed herb and menthol.
