Refined tannins and fresh acidity provide the taut framework while a licorice note wraps around the finish. Gorgeous. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Gaja 2014  Barbaresco

Description: A hallmark expression of Nebbiolo, Produttori del Barbaresco's 2013 Rabajà Riserva offers aromas of wild red berry, menthol, Alpine herb, saddle leather and dark culinary spice. The concentrated palate boasts enviable finesse and is practically weightless in the mouth, showing crushed black cherry, juicy raspberry, orange zest, clove and licorice alongside firm, velvety tannins. Bright acidity provides impeccable balance. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Rabajà Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Intense scents of cherry, star anise and iris float out of the glass. It's firmly structured and loaded with finesse, offering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, cinnamon and star anise framed fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and energy.
Name: Gaja 2014 Costa Russi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Forest berry, chopped mint, clove and new leather aromas take center stage on this elegant, full-bodied red. The savory, smooth palate doles out succulent red cherry, raspberry compote and licorice while vibrant acidity and tightly knit, refined tannins provide balance and support. It has great energy and is loaded with flavor but will be even better with a few more years aging. Drink 2020–2038.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Pajè Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Red berry, blue flower, crushed herb and exotic spice aromas unfold in the glass. Elegant, structured and delicious, the full-bodied palate delivers red cherry and licorice, chopped mint alongside bright acidity and firm, refined tannins. It's impeccably balanced and will age gloriously. Drink 2021 -2043.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2013 Bric del Fiasc  (Barolo)

Description: Still young but already boasting extraordinary pedigree, this fantastic wine opens with hallmark scents of wild berry, new leather, chopped herb, tilled soil and a whiff of violet. The polished, full-bodied palate delivers juicy wild cherry, crushed raspberry, white pepper and licorice while youthfully assertive, noble tannins and bright acidity provide age-worthy structure. A pipe tobacco note lingers on the finish. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Montefico Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant and elegant, this opens with a textbook Nebbiolo bouquet showing scents of tilled soil, rose, wild red berry, Alpine herb and a whiff of new leather. The taut, vibrant palate evokes sour cherry, juicy strawberry, licorice and clove framed in refined tannins and bright acidity. It's balanced and gorgeous but still young, so give it several more years to evolve into the beauty it's destined to become. Drink 2020–2033.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Asili Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: New leather, camphor, forest berry, dried rose and culinary spice are some of the aromas you'll find on this exceptional red. The firmly structured, poised palate doles out juicy cranberry, crushed raspberry, white pepper and star anise framed in tightly-knit, refined tannins while bright acidity provides energy and balance. Drink 2020–2033.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Montestefano Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, toast, menthol, grilled herb and star anise aromas lead the way. Firmly structured but loaded with finesse, the taut palate delivers Morello cherry, raspberry, licorice and a toasted note while assertive, close-grained tannins provide the framework. It's still young and austere so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Gaja 2013 Sperss  (Barolo)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, menthol, new leather, blue flower and baking spice aromas take center stage. On the radiant, full-bodied palate, vibrant acidity lifts red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise, clove and tobacco while youthfully taut, fine-grained tannins provide firm support. Hold on to this for even more complexity once it unwinds and develops. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Attilio Ghisolfi 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Menthol, pressed rose, woodland berry and crushed herb aromas slowly emerge on this elegant, structured red along with a hint of underbrush. The firm, refined palate delivers Marasca cherry, ground clove and licorice framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Gaja 2014 Sorì Tildin  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, camphor, moist earth and violet aromas unfold in the glass. The structured, refined palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, orange slice and white pepper alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. A soothing licorice note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2028.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Ovello Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Star anise, pressed rose petal, aromatic herb and camphor are just some of the aromas you'll find on this taut, polished red. The firmly structured, elegant palate delivers sour cherry, pomegranate, licorice and ground clove set against a backbone of fine-grained tannins. It's young but balanced, with bright acidity. Give it time to reach its full potential. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Gaja 2013 Conteisa  (Barolo)

Description: Forest floor, Porcini mushroom, eucalyptus, dark spice and toasted aromas curl out of the glass. It's youthfully austere, offering cranberry, sour cherry and licorice framed in assertive, close-grained tannins. It still needs time to come around and fully bloom. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Gaja 2014 Sorì San Lorenzo  (Barbaresco)

Description: You'll find aromas of star anise, freshly tilled soil, chopped herb and balsamic notes on this full-bodied red. The smooth, concentrated palate delivers juicy black cherry, raspberry compost, pipe tobacco and licorice accompanied by firm, refined tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Muncagota Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Scents of menthol, new leather, dark culinary spice, cured meat and forest floor lead the nose. The smooth, full-bodied palate shows juicy Morello cherry, pomegranate, licorice and clove balanced by vibrant acidity and tense, refined tannins. An almost salty note closes the finish. This a classic Barbaresco with years ahead of it. Drink 2021–2038.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013 Pora Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: After some time in the glass the 2014 Bric Turot reveals complex aromas of wild berry, dark spice, blue flower and balsamic notes. The elegantly structured, energized palate is even more expressive than the nose, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and star anise. It has terrific tension, thanks to vibrant acidity and firm, polished tannins. Open a few hours ahead of time. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Prunotto 2014 Bric Turot  (Barbaresco)

Description: Made with organically cultivated grapes and fermented with wild yeasts, this boasts alluring scents of rose, perfumed berry, dried herb and dark culinary spice. Youthfully austere but loaded with finesse, the firm palate delivers red cherry, cranberry, pipe tobacco and licorice set against a backbone of vibrant acidity and taut, refined tannins. Give it time to fully blossom. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Barale Fratelli 2013 Castellero  (Barolo)

Description: Inviting aromas of wild berry, pressed rose, new leather, culinary spice and a balsamic note lift out of the glass. On the imposing, full-bodied palate, licorice and pipe tobacco notes accent raspberry compote and steeped cherry framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of alcohol on the close but it's well supported by chewy fruit. Drink 2020–2031.
Name: Brezza 2011 Sarmassa Vigna Bricco Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of red woodland berry, rose, culinary spice, new leather and a whiff of camphor lead the way on this fragrant red. Taut and refined, this is a textbook Barolo, offering red cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise flavors set against a backbone of tightly wound, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Give it time to unwind. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Barale Fratelli 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)

Description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of perfumed red berry, fragrant blue flower, cake spice and a whiff of new leather come together on this. Youthfully tight, the vibrant palate evokes red cherry, cranberry, star anise and pipe tobacco framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance and energy. It's still young and tense so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Ascheri 2013 Coste & Bricco  (Barolo)

Description: Rose petal, new leather, forest floor and balsamic whiffs of menthol take the lead on this youthfully austere red. Linear and vibrant, the full-bodied palate delivers Marasca cherry, orange zest, cinnamon, licorice and an earthy hint of game. Bright acidity and taut tannins provide an age-worthy structure. Fans of classic of Barolo will love this. Drink 2023–2938.
Name: Schiavenza 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

Description: Forest floor, dried herb, pressed rose and dark spice aromas slowly take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate offers black cherry steeped in spirits, licorice and clove set against taut, velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Cascina Chicco 2011 Ginestra Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Alluring scents of fragrant purple flower, perfumed berry, camphor and crushed mint lead the nose. The taut, structured palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry and star anise while assertive, fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Drink 2021–2034.
Name: Ca'Romè 2014 Chiaramanti  (Barbaresco)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of young Nebbiolo include woodland berry, freshly picked violet and a whiff of tilled soil fill the glass. The fresh, elegant palate delivers red cherry, strawberry, star anise and a hint of graphite set against vibrant acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Produttori del Barbaresco 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Earthy aromas of forest floor, grilled herb and a balsamic note come together in the glass. The firm, tightly wound palate shows dried cherry, pomegranate, clove and cinnamon while taut, fine-grained tannins provide support. It's vibrant, with bright acidity. Drink after 2023.
Name: Batasiolo 2013 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of new leather, forest floor, pressed rose and an earthy whiff of truffle segue over to the juicy palate along with ripe Marasca cherry and black raspberry. Firm, velvety tannins provide the backbone while a hint of licorice backs up the finish. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Elio Filippino 2012 del Comune di Castiglione Falletto  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, truffle, iris, baking spice and aromatic herb aromas all come seamlessly together on this alluring wine. The tense, savory palate delivers ripe black cherry, red berry, star anise and ground clove. Tightly knit, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity offer balance and support. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Fontanabianca 2014 Bordini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, crushed mint, leather, a whiff of tar and a hint of toast lead the nose. The palate is accessible but still fresh, offering dried Marasca cherry, black raspberry and baking spice framed in velvety tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Tenuta San Mauro 2004 Canova Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Heady scents of pressed violet, tilled soil, perfumed berry, new leather and a balsamic note of camphor flow out of the glass. Vibrant and linear, the medium-bodied palate evokes juicy Marasca cherry, ripe raspberry, licorice and crushed mint framed in taut, refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2026.
Name: Fontanabianca 2014  Barbaresco

Description: New leather, tobacco and underbrush aromas emerge along with a balsamic whiff of camphor. Firmly structured, the youthfully austere palate evokes tart cherry, red raspberry, star anise and chopped herb framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Roccheviberti 2013 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Truffle, moist soil, ground clove leather and balsamic aromas emerge on this along with an earthy whiff of game. The smooth, ripe palate doles out fleshy black cherry, prune, licorice and cured meat alongside polished, velvety tannins. It's already hitting its ideal drinking window so drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Rattalino 2010 Quarantacinque 45 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Truffle, new leather, pressed blue flower, menthol and a whiff of game lead the way. The aromas carry over to the ripe, full-bodied palate along with fleshy black cherry, steeped prune, cinnamon and star anise. Buffed tannins provide the framework. It's already accessible but will maintain well for the next several years. Drink through 2023.
Name: Curto Marco 2011 Arborina Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of pressed blue flower, perfumed berry, dried herb and exotic spice are in the forefront. The vibrant, linear palate delivers dried black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and a hint of coffee set against taut, fine-grained tannins that leave a firm finish. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Negretti 2013 Mirau  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, tilled soil, new leather, camphor and a whiff of violet take center stage on the nose. Bright and succulent, the vibrant, graceful palate doles out juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry and baking spice. Taut, refined tannins and racy acidity lend balance and tension. Fans of elegance will love its ethereal finesse. Drink 2019–2026.
Name: Prunotto 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Underbrush, new leather, game, pipe tobacco and menthol aromas lift out of the glass. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, licorice, a hint of mint and the same gamy note as the nose alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Elio Filippino 2012 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Dark berry, pipe tobacco, chopped herb and forest floor aromas carry over to the polished palate along with dried cherry, orange peel and ground clove. Firm, refined tannins provide elegant support. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Borgogno 2012 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, culinary spice and a whiff of French oak waft out of the glass. The taut, linear palate offers cranberry, licorice and coffee bean alongside firm, close-grained tannins that give the finish grip. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Broccardo 2013 Paiagallo  (Barolo)

Description: Forest floor, tobacco leaf and charred earth aromas lead the way. It's full-bodied, savory and already accessible, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, ripe cranberry, licorice and graphite offset by firm, velvety tannins. It closes on a salty note. Drink through 2023.
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: A few swirls of the glass release aromas of truffle, scorched earth, menthol and star anise. On the structured palate, assertive, close-grained tannins weave through dried Morello cherry, licorice and clove. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2012 Bussia Vigna dei Buoi  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of exotic spice, underbrush, chopped herb and moist earth lead the nose. The full-bodied palate offers raw sour cherry, star anise, espresso and oak-driven spice alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Give the tannins a few more years to come around then drink to capture its subtle fruit flavors.
Name: Pio Cesare 2013 Ornato  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, dark spice, grilled herb and coconut lift out of the glass. On the firm palate, assertive, close-grained tannins offset black cherry extract and a hint of star anise. Drink 2020–2027.
Name: Bersano 2012 Badarina  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of truffle, underbrush, woodland berry, blue flower and a whiff of game lead the nose. The linear, austere palate is on the lean side, offering tart red cherry, star anise and clove framed in taut, close-grained tannins and racy acidity. Give it time to fully unfold and come together. Drink after 2023.
Name: Francesco Rinaldi 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of fennel, chopped herb and menthol lift out of the glass. The somewhat lean, racy palate offers dried cranberry, coffee bean and clove framed in firm tannins and vibrant acidity. A touch of licorice softens the tight finish.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: La Bioca 2014 Pistin  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with aromas of forest floor, oak, leather, exotic spice, coconut and a whiff of baked plum. The firm, extracted palate offers dried cherry, nutmeg and licorice framed in chewy tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Cascina Bruciata 2014  Barbaresco

Description: New leather, grilled porcini, fig and charred soil aromas meld with balsamic notes. The forward, structured palate offers stewed prune, dried cherry and clove set against fine-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to soften then drink to capture the remaining fruit richness.
Name: Franco Conterno 2011 Pietrin  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, toast, espresso and balsamic notes fill the glass. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, raspberry jam, cinnamon and clove framed in firm, close-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tenuta San Mauro 2012 Canova  (Barbaresco)

Description: You'll find aromas of forest floor, exotic spice, oak, leather and a whiff of game o this concentrated red. The hearty, monolithic palate presents dried cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2022.
Name: Elio Filippino 2007 Serra Capelli 10 Anni Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, crushed mint and star anise carry over to the rather lean palate along with raw cranberry, licorice and espresso. Close-grained tannins and bright acidity provide the framework but it finishes rather quickly.
Name: Rattalino 2014 Quarantadue 42  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, scorched earth and underbrush lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the taut palate shows vanilla, oak-driven spice, licorice and candied red cherry framed in assertive, close-grained tannins. A coffee bean note lingers on the firm, drying finish.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2012 Roggeri  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of espresso, oak, licorice and coconut carry over to the tight knit, medium-bodied palate along with dried black cherry and licorice. Assertive, close-grained tannins clench the finish.
Name: Giacosa Fratelli 2014 Vigna Gianmatè  (Barbaresco)

Description: Forest floor, incense, exotic spice, stewed prune and grilled herb aromas slowly take shape. It's forward, offering dried black cherry, cake spice and raisin flavors alongside buffed, not very persistent tannins and tangy acidity.
Name: Principiano 2010 Boscareto  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of French oak, menthol, dark spice and ripe berry carry over to the firm palate along with prune, toasted nut, licorice and orange zest. Assertive, close-grained tannins clamp down on the finish.
Name: San Biagio 2014 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

Description: Rose, scorched earth, dark spice and balsamic aromas merge together on this. The straightforward, medium-bodied palate shows dried cherry, tart cranberry and a star anise note. It's savory but straightforward for Barolo, with loose knit, rather dusty tannins.
Name: Ricossa 2012  Barolo

Description: Aromas of graphite, toasted hazelnut, oak and exotic spice emerge on this. The firm, linear palate offers sour cherry, orange peel and star anise while austere tannins and brisk acidity offer bracing support. It's a bit lean on fruit richness but the tannins need time to unwind. Drink after 2023.
Name: Gomba Boschetti 2013 del Comune di Barolo  (Barolo)

Description: Scorched earth, underbrush, dark spice and grilled sage aromas are front and center along with a balsamic note. The firm palate reflects the heat of the vintage, showing dried cherry, clove and a hint of licorice alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink to catch the remaining fruit.
Name: Costa di Bussia 2011 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of French oak, scorched earth stewed plum and exotic spice lead the nose along with a whiff of nail varnish. The brawny, evolved palate offers coconut, oak-driven spice and steeped prune alongside the heat of evident alcohol and velvety tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Elio Filippino 2011 Serra Capelli Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals leather, underbrush and a menthol note. The tight, straightforward palate offers dried cherry along with hints of baking spice and star anise. Polished tannins provide the framework. Drink 2019–2024.
Name: Gabriele Scaglione 2012 Passione di Re  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas suggesting grilled sage, French oak, ground clove and a whiff of camphor come together on this. The tightly wound palate evokes raw sour cherry, coffee bean and anisette but not much fruit richness. Assertive, close-grained tannins leave a grippy finish.
Name: Agostino Bosco 2013 Neirane  (Barolo)

Description: Sour cherry, coconut, espresso and menthol aromas lead the nose. The palate is full-bodied but doesn't possess a lot of fruit richness, evoking raw cherry, orange zest, licorice and French oak. Taut, astringent tannins grip the finish.
Name: Agostino Bosco 2013 La Serra  (Barolo)

Description: French oak, coconut and toasted aromas carry over to the tight, taut palate along with vanilla, dried sour cherry, a green note of powdered sage and a hint of roasted coffee bean. Grainy, astringent tannins give it a raspy finish.
Name: Ca'Romè 2013 Maria di Brun  (Barbaresco)

Description: Oak, coconut and underbrush aromas mingle with espresso on this tightly tannic red. The grainy palate offers licorice, oak-driven spice and a hint of dried cherry but not much fruit richness. Raspy tannins leave an astringent, drying finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink to catch the remaining fruit.
Name: Ca'Romè 2014 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of ripe red berry, violet and new leather come together in the glass. The fleeting palate is rather easygoing for Barolo, offering Morello cherry and baking spice alongside fresh acidity and grainy but not very persistent tannins that leave a dusty finish.
Name: Piazzo Armando 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, toast and balsamic notes set the tone. The tight palate offers dried cherry, prune and clove framed in astringent, grainy tannins that leave a raspy finish.
Name: Tenuta San Mauro 2013  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of coconut, French oak, toast and a whiff of menthol carry over to the linear palate along with vanilla, licorice and dried sour cherry. Assertive, grainy tannins leave and astringent, almost raspy finish.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: La Bioca 2014 Ronchi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas of French oak, exotic spice, menthol and steeped prune come together. The monolithic palate is evolved, offering vanilla, espresso, dried black cherry and oak driven spice alongside seasoned, not very persistent tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Mauro Sebaste 2011 Ghè Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting new leather, moist underbrush, blue flower and chopped herb. The straightforward, rather diluted palate offers sour cherry and a hint of star anise framed in loose knit, somewhat fleeting tannins.
Name: Bersano 2014 Mantico  (Barbaresco)

Description: This offers aromas of leafy underbrush, berry, vanilla and a whiff of espresso while the straightforward palate shows black cherry extract, coffee and clove. Grainy tannins give it a rather abrupt, firm finish.
Name: Natale Verga 2013  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of toast, oak, cured meats and grilled herb follow over to the austere, astringent palate along with a hint of coconut and oak-driven spice. Lacking fruit richness, it can't stand up to the dominant oak sensations and grainy tannins.
Name: Parusso 2013 Mosconi  (Barolo)

Description: This offers subdued aromas evoking red berry and crushed mint that carry over to the somewhat dilute, simple palate along with a hint of star anise. It has firm acidity while dusty, rather fleeting tannins dry out the finish.
Name: San Silvestro 2014 Magno  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with fleeting aromas reminiscent of leather, dried herb and a whiff of dark spice. The no-frills palate offers hints of sour cherry and star anise alongside dusty, transient tannins.
Name: Collina San Ponzio 2013 Fossati  (Barolo)

Description: Tight and lean, this has restrained aromas of moist forest floor, leather, espresso and balsamic notes. The firm palate offers dried cherry, steeped prune and oak-driven spice alongside raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Araldica 2013 Corsini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, tobacco and stewed prune aromas lead the nose. It's hard and lean in terms of fruit richness, offering raw sour cherry and clove alongside an acidic backbone and bracing, grainy tannins.
Name: Ceste 2013  Barolo

Description: This has a subdued, fleeting nose showing cellar floor, weedy underbrush and used leather. The evolved palate offers mature cherry coffee and a hint of spice around loose, short-lived tannins.
Name: Gabriele Scaglione 2013  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas reminiscent of weedy underbrush, overripe berry, roasted herb and a whiff of salted game lead the nose. The gamy note follows over to the evolved, rustic palate along with dried cherry, grilled sage, and clove alongside while close-grained fleeting tannins give it a loose framework. A salty note marks the close.
Name: Principiano 2010  Barolo

Description: Subdued aromas of underbrush, celery, truffle and a whiff of used leather set the tone. The aromas carry over to the dense, evolved palate along with dried blackberry, prune and evident alcohol. Raspy, fleeting tannins dry out the finish.
Name: Rattalino 2014 Quarantatre 43  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting underbrush, camphor, oak and a whiff of cured meat. The palate is a bit muddled and rather diluted, offering hints of sour cherry, salt and espresso alongside dusty, somewhat fleeting tannins that leave a mouth-drying finish.
Name: San Matteo 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Aromas of underbrush, prune, toast, used leather and a whiff of blue flower emerge in the glass. The short, simple palate offers black cherry and vanilla alongside dusty, somewhat fleeting tannins that leave a drying finish.
Name: Torlasco 2013  Barbaresco

Description: After a few swirls of the glass, you'll detect aromas of fleshy black cherry, leather and culinary spice. On the lean, linear palate, you'll find sour cherry, orange zest and chopped sage set against brisk acidity and bracing, grainy tannins.
Name: Collina San Ponzio 2013  Barolo

Description: Funky aromas of scorched soil, withered rose, used leather, stewed prune and a hint of barnyard follow over to the overripe palate along with licorice and a gamy note. Dusty, evolved tannins offset the earthy flavors.
Name: Batasiolo 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Here's another stunning offering from this fantastic estate. Elegant, structured and restrained, it opens with enticing Nebbiolo scents of blue flower, perfumed berry, dark spice and a light balsamic note of eucalyptus. The luminous palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry, licorice and cinnamon while vibrant acidity and firm, polished tannins provide seamless support. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Brovia 2013 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of mature iris, blackberry, tobacco, crushed mint and baking spice lift out of the glass on this gorgeous Barolo. Despite the scorching heat, the Scavino made a supremely elegant wine, boasting black cherry, crushed black raspberry, menthol, star anise and ground clove framed in fine-grained, velvety tannins and fresh acidity. A gorgeous wine. Drink 2020–2031.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2011 Rocche dell'Annunziata Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Dedicated to the current owner's late grandfather who founded the estate, this elegant red opens with alluring aromas of blue flower, dark spice, herbs and new leather. The savory palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, clove and licorice framed by polished tannins. It's already approachable, but will offer fantastic imbibing for another decade. Drink through 2027.
Name: La Spinona 2012 Bergera  (Barolo)

Description: What a fabulous vintage for this fragrant, radiant wine. Opening with alluring scents of iris, rose, culinary spice and perfumed berry, the focused palate delivers crushed strawberry, red cherry, cinnamon and star anise. It's loaded with finesse, thanks to firm ultrarefined tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2033.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2013 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)

Description: Fragrant blue flower, woodland berry, dark spice and pine forest aromas lead the way. It's racy, focused and loaded with chiseled finesse, delivering juicy red cherry, crushed cranberry, cinnamon and star anise. Tightly knit, refined tannins and firm acidity provide the backbone. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Manzone Fratelli 2013 Fraschin Bricco San Pietro  (Barolo)

Description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of wild berry, rose petal, baking spice and an earthy whiff of truffle emerge in the glass. The elegant vibrant palate mirrors the nose, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, pipe tobacco and cinnamon alongside firm, refined tannins and fresh acidity. It's a textbook Barolo that will benefit from a few more years in the cellar. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Sobrero 2013 Ciabot Tanasio  (Barolo)

Description: Gorgeous and smooth, this elegant, 10-year-old red boasts aromas of new leather, tilled soil and pipe tobacco. The polished and structured palate delivers creamy black cherry, star anise and clove framed in refined tannins. It's a remarkable performance for what was an extremely hot vintage. Best through 2023.
Name: Mirafiore 2007 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Alluring aromas of fragrant blue flower, woodland berry, forest floor and pipe tobacco slowly take shape in this compelling wine. Gorgeous and full-bodied, the palate delivers ripe morello cherry while licorice, cinnamon and crushed herb add depth. Polished tannins provide the elegant framework. Drink through 2026.
Name: La Spinona 2011 Sorì Gepin  (Barolo)

Description: Menthol, new leather, white pepper, fig and forest floor are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fantastic wine. Smooth and structured, the full-bodied palate evokes dried cherry, licorice, baking spice, raspberry compote and a salty mineral note. Firm polished tannins provide smooth seamless support. Drink through 2031.
Name: Rivetto 2011 Leon Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Forest floor, grilled herb, dark spice, eucalyptus and wild berry aromas fill the glass. The structured palate delivers dried black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice, sage and pipe tobacco while taut noble tannins provide impressive support. It's savory and full bodied but also boasts an irresistible, almost weightless elegance. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Elvio Cogno 2011 Ravera Vigna Elena Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing scents of iris, violet, menthol and exotic spice emerge in the glass. Elegant and fresh, the polished, delicious palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and a potpourri of baking spices. It's beautifully balanced, with bright acidity and silky smooth tannins. While it's already accessible, it will also age for years. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Paolo Scavino 2013  Barolo

Description: Iris, pressed rose, pine forest, woodland berry and a balsamic note are just some of the inviting aromas you'll find on this delicious wine. The smooth concentrated palate doles out layers of raspberry compote, juicy Marasca cherry, cinnamon and clove framed in velvety tannins. A salty mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2027.
Name: Ciabot Berton 2012 Rocchettevino  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy aromas of truffle, tilled soil, leather and forest berry merge with pressed rose petal and a whiff of game. Smooth, structured and savory, the poised palate delivers crushed strawberry, juicy Marasca cherry, clove and licorice. Firm polished tannins and fresh acidity provide support. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Batasiolo 2013 Bussia Vigneto Bofani  (Barolo)

Description: This wine is intense in aromas of violet, rose, underbrush, dark-skinned berry and spice. Tightly wound and vibrant, the taut, elegantly structured palate delivers Marasca cherry, black raspberry, cinnamon and clove framed in firm fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. It's still youthfully austere, so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2013–2035.
Name: Attilio Ghisolfi 2013 Bricco Visette  (Barolo)

Description: Intensely floral scents of fragrant blue flower and rose mingle with red berry and a whiff of dark spice. On the elegant, structured palate, star anise and cinnamon accent juicy Marasca cherry and crushed raspberry. Firm refined tannins and bright acidity provide seamless support. It's savory and loaded with finesse. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Revello Fratelli 2013 Gattera  (Barolo)

Description: Leather, licorice and balsamic aromas slowly take shape in the glass. Full bodied and taut, this delivers dried black cherry, mature raspberry, star anise and clove set against fresh acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Sordo 2013 Perno  (Barolo)

Description: Intense aromas of menthol, pressed rose, dark spice, new leather and wild berry take shape on this fragrant full-bodied red. Concentrated and structured, the dense palate delivers Marasca cherry marinated in spirits, licorice and a hint of exotic spice framed in firm refined tannins.
Name: Grimaldi Bruna 2011 Badarina Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Truffle, underbrush, new leather and chopped herb aromas slowly emerge in the glass. The bright, elegantly structured palate delivers tart cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside vibrant acidity and tightly wound noble tannins. It's still youthfully austere so give it time to develop. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Poderi Colla 2013 Bussia Dardi Le Rose  (Barolo)

Description: Iris, crushed herb, red berry, exotic spice and balsamic aromas lift out of the glass while the polished palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, cinnamon and a sprinkling of clove. Fine-grained tannins offer elegant support. Drink 2019–2027.
Name: Borgogno 2012 Liste  (Barolo)

Description: Toast, moist underbrush, grilled herb and balsamic aromas lead the nose. On the full-bodied austere palate, fine-grained tannins support tart cherry, cranberry, vanilla and star anise. Give this several more years to unwind and develop. Drink 2013–2033.
Name: Poderi Luigi Einaudi 2013 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: Showing great restraint and structure, this wine is complex, savory and brings a welcome change from the usual fruity soft California wine. It smells lightly spicy, beefy and earthy, tastes mild but deep, with fascinating flavors like smoked meat, tea, raspberry and cola.
Name: Prima Materia 2014 Estate Bottled Nebbiolo

Description: Rose, underbrush, dried berry and balsamic notes lead the nose. The taut structured palate evokes juicy strawberry, crushed cherry, star anise and cake spice framed in tightly woven fine-grained tannins. It's elegant and well balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Azelia 2013 Margheria  (Barolo)

Description: Menthol, licorice and woodland berry aromas follow over to the luminous, elegant palate, along with white pepper and wild cherry. Bright acidity and firm, refined tannins lend both balance and finesse. Drink 2020–2033.
Name: Fontanafredda 2013 Vigna La Rosa  (Barolo)

Description: Red berry, violet and baking spice are some of the aromas you'll find on this elegant, balanced red. Savory and smooth, the silky palate doles out red cherry, strawberry compote, cinnamon and star anise, all framed by polished tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Rocca Giovanni 2013  Barolo

Description: Alluring scents of crushed aromatic herb, dark spice and a whiff of wild rose lead the nose. It's firmly structured and linear, offering sour cherry, blood orange, sage, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside firm, rather drying tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2013 Tradizione  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, grilled herb, exotic spice, raspberry jam and balsamic aromas lift out of the glass. Round and ripe, the warm and forward palate presents dried black cherry, licorice, pipe tobacco and white pepper framed in firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2018–2026.
Name: Bersano 2011 Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Licorice, menthol, red berry and clove aromas carry over to the taut palate along with a tobacco note. Tightly wound fine-grained tannins provide firm support. Drink 2019–2027.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2012 Tradizione  (Barolo)

Description: Underbrush, scorched earth, leather and camphor aromas lead the way along with an earthy whiff of game. On the ripe chewy palate, notes of crushed mint, clove, licorice and grilled porcini accent a juicy black-cherry core. Firm close-grained tannins offer taut support.
Name: Seghesio 2012 Ginestra  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing scents of violet, rose and woodland berry escape the glass. Full bodied and polished, the palate delivers black cherry, cranberry, licorice and crushed herb while austere fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide an age-worthy framework. It's still young and taut and needs several more years to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Revello Fratelli 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of fig, tilled earth, exotic spice and a balsamic note mingle together on this tight racy red. Bright and linear, the austere palate is still primary but offers sour cherry, clove and an earthy hint of game framed in firm acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Bava 2013 Scarrone  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of exotic spice, forest floor and a balsamic note emerge in the glass while the full-bodied palate doles out ripe red cherry, cranberry, licorice and clove. Assertive, rather grainy tannins and bright acidity provide support. It's still rather austere so give the tannins a few more years to unwind. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: Negretti 2013 Rive  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of mature berry, fig, pressed rose and crushed herb lead the way. The no-frills palate offers juicy red cherry, dark culinary spice and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink after 2023.
Name: Pelassa 2013  Barolo

Description: Rose, red berry, underbrush and dark spice are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant, youthfully austere red. It's lean, tight and ethereal, with raw strawberry, licorice and white pepper flavors set against vibrant acidity and taut close-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
Name: Boroli 2013 Villero  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of wild rose, chopped mint and an earthy whiff of grilled Porcini mushroom slowly emerge. The taut, austere palate shows cranberry, raw sour cherry, star anise and clove framed in firm acidity and tightly wound, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. This needs time to unfurl and fully develop. Drink after 2023.
Name: Poderi Luigi Einaudi 2013 Terlo  (Barolo)

Description: Aromas of dark culinary spice, iris, berry and a whiff of oak lead the nose. The linear, tightly wound palate shows raw cranberry, clove and star anise framed in racy acidity. Taut close-grained tannins leave a firm finish. Give this a few more years to unwind then drink.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2014 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)

Description: Earthy aromas of wild berry, underbrush, leather and a whiff of game follow over to the youthfully austere palate along pomegranate, star anise and clove. Taut tannins and vibrant acidity provide the backbone. Racy, focused and a bit on the lean side, this needs time to unwind and fully open. Drink after 2023.
Name: Ascheri 2013 Sorano  (Barolo)

Description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas suggesting French oak, raspberry jam coconut and exotic spice. The densely concentrated assertive palate offers licorice, dried cherry, tart cranberry and powdered sage while astringent grainy tannins provide an austere framework. You'll also detect the heat of evident alcohol.
Name: Revello Fratelli 2013 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting oak, toast, camphor and underbrush. The robust palate doesn't have a lot of fruit richness, but offers licorice, clove and a hint of dried cherry alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol.
Name: Negretti 2013 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting dark berry, a whiff of exotic spice and a slight balsamic note. It's rather light bodied and quite simple for Barolo, offering red cherry and a hint of star anise alongside bright acidity and palate-drying, somewhat fleeting, tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: CarlindePaolo 2013  Barolo

Description: Aromas of chopped herb, exotic spice, menthol and a whiff of toast lead the nose. Compacted and austere, the lean bracing palate shows raw cranberry, pomegranate and licorice while firm acidity and grainy, astringent tannins provide the taut framework.
Name: Col dei Venti 2013 Debutto  (Barolo)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals suggestions of berry, aromatic herb and oak-driven spice. The assertive palate offers licorice, coffee and raw cherry alongside grainy tannins that clench the lean finish. You'll also notice a green note of powdered sage.
Name: Negretti 2013  Barolo

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a sturdy, dry wine that has a brownish color on the rim, roasted fruit aromas, subdued earthy meaty flavors and very full body.
Name: Domenico 2012 Nebbiolo (Amador County)

Description: This stunning wine opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of new leather, rose, wild berry, crushed herb, dark spice and menthol. The palate is chiseled and loaded with finesse, doling out juicy red cherry, ripe strawberry, licorice and cinnamon flavors. It's structured with polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Brovia 2013 Garblèt Suè  (Barolo)

Description: This textbook Barolo's new leather, cake spice and menthol aromas jump out of the glass. On the firmly structured palate, cinnamon and licorice notes underscore red cherry, cranberry and orange zest flavors. Tight, noble tannins and bright acidity provide the framework, suggesting it will age beautifully for decades. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Brovia 2013 Brea Vigna Cà Mia  (Barolo)

Description: Enticing aromas of balsamic, leather, menthol, crushed herb, blue flower and dark culinary spice unfold on the nose. The focused palate boasts wonderful, nervy energy, showing red cherry, cranberry, white pepper, cinnamon and clove flavors framed by firm, elegant tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Rizzi 2014 Nervo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Truffle, forest floor, new leather, purple flower and crushed herb aromas take center stage in this Barbaresco. The firmly structured, elegant palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and clove flavors in a matrix of tightly wound, polished tannins and bright acidity. A hint of star anise signals the close.
Name: Cascina Alberta 2014 Giacone  (Barbaresco)

Description: Enticing violet, berry, new leather and cake spice aromas lead the nose of this wine. Its precise, structured palate offers Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and star anise flavors set against youthfully exuberant but refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2024–2034.
Name: Nada Giuseppe 2014 Marcarini  (Barbaresco)

Description: Enticing new leather, dark baking spice and violet aromas emerge in this taut red. Succulent and savory, it delivers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, flinty mineral and star anise flavors while firm, refined tannins and fresh acidity offer support. Drink 2020–2029.
Name: Rizzi 2014 Pajorè  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's classic Nebbiolo scents of fragrant blue flower, new leather, aromatic herb and red berry waft out of the glass. The firmly structured palate offers Marasca cherry, sage, truffle and ground clove flavors framed by tightly woven but refined tannins and vibrant acidity. A licorice note rounds out the finish.
Name: Castello di Neive 2014 Albesani Santo Stefano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Chopped herb, fragrant blue flower, woodland berry and menthol aromas take center stage in this vibrant red. On the palate, clove and star anise notes underpin red cherry, cranberry and tobacco flavors. A hint of orange zest marks the finish while refined tannins and bright acidity provide the framework.
Name: Rizzi 2014  Barbaresco

Description: This wine's iris, perfumed berry, truffle and baking spice aromas emerge in the glass as it opens, along with a whiff of crushed herb. The structured, elegant palate shows ripe Marasca cherry, vanilla and mocha flavors alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2019–2029.
Name: Sottimano 2014 Cottà  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's inviting blue flower, dark berry and cake spice aromas emerge in the glass. The vibrant palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise flavors while firm, refined tannins and fresh acidity provide support.
Name: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2014 Sanadaive  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's truffle, underbrush, dark berry and baking spice aromas take center stage. Still young and primary, it shows unripe red berry, sage, ground clove, truffle and star anise flavors on the palate, structured with bracing tannins and vibrant acidity. Give it time to fully come together. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Sottimano 2014 Currà  (Barbaresco)

Description: Alluring Nebbiolo aromas of dark berry, purple flower, baking spice, truffle and herb slowly unfold in this wine. The savory, succulent palate doles out Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and licorice flavors against a backdrop of firm, refined tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Cascina Luisin 2014 Asili  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's inviting aromas of tar, menthol and rose take shape in the glass. The elegant palate doles out red cherry, cranberry and dried herb flavors set against a backdrop of refined tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Bric Cenciurio 2013 Coste di Rose  (Barolo)

Description: Intense scents of violet and iris lead the nose of this wine, along with a whiff of woodland berry. The fresh, linear palate offers Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and chopped herb flavors framed by youthfully assertive, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Cigliuti 2013 Serraboella  (Barbaresco)

Description: This leads with blue flower, camphor, crushed herb and red berry aromas. Firmly structured and linear, the palate delivers succulent red cherry, crushed strawberry, cinnamon and star anise flavors supported by a backbone of vibrant acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Negro Giuseppe 2014 Pian Cavallo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Classic scents of dark-skinned berry, chopped herb, dark spice and new leather take the lead in this wine. On the firm elegant palate, youthfully assertive, noble tannins support dried Marasca cherry, licorice and clove flavors while bright acidity lends balance.
Name: La Spinona 2013 Bricco Faset  (Barbaresco)

Description: Woodland berry, fragrant blue flower, camphor and exotic spice aromas take center stage in this wine. The linear, vibrant palate still shows its youth, offering juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry, white pepper and crushed herb flavors alongside fine-grained tannins that leave a firm finish. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink after 2024.
Name: Ugo Lequio 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: You'll find earthy aromas of truffle, new leather, game and pressed violet and whiffs of menthol and toast in this firmly structured red. The taut palate shows red cherry, crushed cranberry, cinnamon and ground clove flavors set against fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink after 2023.
Name: Piero Busso 2013 Albesani Vigna Borgese  (Barbaresco)

Description: This expresses pretty Nebbiolo aromas of violet, saddle leather, truffle and red berry. The vibrant palate offers crushed raspberry, Morello cherry, cinnamon and tobacco hints while assertive tannins and bright acidity provide support. Drink 2021–2029.
Name: Cascina Saria 2014 Colle del Gelso  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's woodland berry, rose petal, dark spice, chopped herb and espresso aromas fill the glass. Elegantly structured, the palate offers Marasca cherry, clove and star anise flavors framed by fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity.
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Balsamic notes of menthol and crushed mint mingle with dark culinary spice, coffee bean and stewed fruit aromas in this wine. The forward palate shows sweet and sour notes of mature, fleshy black cherry, prune, licorice and clove alongside seasoned tannins. A toasted hazelnut note closes the finish Drink soon to catch the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Castello di Neive 2012 Albesani Santo Stefano Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's new leather, exotic spice, truffle and chopped herb aromas lift out of the glass while the full-bodied palate delivers dried berry, orange zest, exotic spice and espresso hints. Fine-grained tannins provide firmness.
Name: Nada Giuseppe 2012 Casot Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This leads with menthol, new leather, exotic spice and balsamic notes. The concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and star anise flavors set against firm, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Luigi Voghera 2014  Barbaresco

Description: New leather, underbrush, menthol, dark spice and chopped dill aromas lead the way in this structured red. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, raspberry jam and licorice flavors alongside taut, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. It's youthfully austere and needs a few years to unwind. Drink 2022–2029.
Name: Ca' del Baio 2014 Vallegrande  (Barbaresco)

Description: Blue flower, dark-skinned berry, star anise, menthol and espresso show on the nose. The aromas carry to the palate, along with dried black cherry, licorice, toast and a hint of sage. Firm, close-grained tannins provide support. Drink 2012–2033.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2013 Albesani  (Barbaresco)

Description: Balsamic aromas of menthol, saddle leather, crushed herb and exotic spice mingle together in this Barbaresco. The solid palate shows crushed raspberry, Morello cherry, cinnamon and espresso flavors alongside firm, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Negro Giuseppe 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant purple flower, red berry, exotic spice, crushed herb and new leather scents set the tone in this wine. The firm palate shows cranberry, star anise and clove flavors framed by fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2028.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2013 Ovello  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas suggesting underbrush, exotic spice, vanilla, menthol and toast. On the structured palate, bright acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins support ripe Marasca cherry, clove and star anise flavors. Drink 2021–2031.
Name: Piero Busso 2013 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's assertive game, toast, leather, underbrush and balsamic aromas carry over to the tight, linear palate, along with cranberry, red cherry and white pepper notes. Close-grained tannins and racy acidity provide the framework.
Name: Ressia 2014 Canova  (Barbaresco)

Description: Underbrush, camphor and new leather aromas unfold in this taut red. The linear palate shows red cherry, pomegranate, espresso and star anise flavors alongside a crushed sage note. Assertive tannins and racy acidity lend grip to the finish. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2014 Basarin  (Barbaresco)

Description: Iris, menthol, perfumed berry and chopped mint aromas come together in this. The savory, approachable palate delivers crushed raspberry, juicy red cherry, star anise and cinnamon notes framed by velvety tannins. Drink 2018–2023.
Name: Brangero 2013 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

Description: Chopped mint, menthol, blue flower and red berry aromas take the lead in this wine. The taut palate offers Marasca cherry, raspberry, star anise and ground clove flavors alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2014 Froi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor, toasted oak and oak-driven spice take center stage in this wine. On the tightly wound palate, taut tannins enwrap Marasca cherry, cranberry, white pepper and clove flavors. It's balanced with bright acidity.
Name: Orlando Abrigo 2014 Meruzzano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Dill, crushed herb, oak, toast and balsamic aromas emerge in the glass as this wine opens. Its firm palate offers dried cherry, licorice and espresso flavors framed by close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. It has structure but lacks fruit richness.
Name: La Spinetta 2014 Valeirano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Menthol, violet, exotic spice and tobacco aromas take center stage in this wine. The firm palate shows red cherry, licorice and crushed herb flavors set against a backdrop of close-grained, grippy tannins.
Name: Pio Cesare 2013  Barbaresco

Description: Menthol, camphor, pressed violet, crushed herb and toast aromas come together in this wine. The solid, chewy palate delivers crushed raspberry, red cherry, espresso, star anise and toast flavors alongside firm tannins.
Name: Cascina Luisin 2014 Rabajà  (Barbaresco)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This longtime winemaking family uses an old-style label on this bottling of the classic Italian grape, which spent 24 months on American oak. Rusty bloody aromas of cranberry, peppercorn and carnation lead into a palate framed by stiff tannins and strong acidity. Red-fruit flavors mix with woody spice, and the finish is sticky, showing that this wine is still very young.
Name: Bargetto 2014 Regan Vineyards Nebbiolo (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: This wine's exotic spice, leather, toast and vanilla aromas unfold in the glass. The taut, linear palate offers dried black cherry and pomegranate flavors, with a sprinkling of cinnamon, assertive, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Cigliuti 2013 Vie Erte  (Barbaresco)

Description: This leads with aromas suggesting freshly picked violet, toast, espresso, menthol and crushed herb. The vibrant palate delivers Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, coffee bean and licorice flavors in a frame of youthfully assertive tannins.
Name: Collina Serragrilli 2014 Starderi  (Barbaresco)

Description: This leads with truffle, underbrush, pressed violet and camphor scents. The taut, linear palate offers sour cherry, cranberry, licorice, sage and orange peel notes alongside bracing tannins and vibrant acidity. Give it a few more years for the tannins to unwind then drink.
Name: Scarpa 2013 Tettineive  (Barbaresco)

Description: Balsamic aromas of menthol, eucalyptus and new leather lead the nose of this wine, along with a whiff of oak-driven spice. On the firm, linear palate, espresso and mocha notes accent raw red berry fruit while assertive, close-grained tannins grip the finish.
Name: Sottimano 2014 Fausoni  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's balsamic notes of camphor, oak, toast and crushed mint emerge in the glass while the linear palate offers licorice, sour cherry, cranberry, thyme and tobacco flavors. Close-grained, somewhat astringent tannins lend grip to the finish.
Name: Nada Giuseppe 2014 Casot  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's prune, menthol, tobacco and grilled herb aromas carry over to its bracing palate, along with dried black cherry and licorice hints. Assertive, tight-knit tannins grip the finish. Drink after 2020.
Name: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2012 Basarin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's underbrush, truffle, leather and herb aromas unfold in the glass. The firmly structured palate offers dried black cherry, licorice, espresso, oak-driven spice and toast flavors framed by close-grained tannins. Roasted coffee bean and powdered sage notes mark the finish.
Name: Dante Rivetti 2014 Bric' Micca  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's chopped herb, dark culinary spice, eucalyptus and oak aromas unfold in the glass. The firm palate offers raw cherry, ground clove, star anise and tobacco set against close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2013 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: Star anise, camphor and toast aromas lead the nose of this wine. The firm palate shows red cherry, crushed strawberry and chopped mint flavors alongside fine-grained tannins.
Name: Sassi San Cristoforo 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Dark spice, camphor, menthol and crushed herb aromas take center stage in this wine. The palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and licorice flavors alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. A hint of candied orange zest signals the close.
Name: Ca' del Baio 2014 Autinbej  (Barbaresco)

Description: You'll find blue flower, exotic spice, truffle and camphor aromas in this firm, medium-bodied red. The linear palate shows sour cherry, cranberry, licorice and espresso notes held tight with fine-grained tannins.
Name: Cantina del Pino 2013  Barbaresco

Description: This opens with oak, coconut, toast and camphor aromas while the tightly wound palate offers Marasca cherry, espresso, mocha and star anise flavors. It's still oak-dominated, with raspy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2021.
Name: Pio Cesare 2013 Il Bricco  (Barbaresco)

Description: Truffle, stewed prune, pressed violet and camphor aromas lead the way in this wine. The palate is somewhat evolved, showing cooked fruit, licorice and baking spice hints alongside firm but rather fleeting tannins. Drink sooner than later.
Name: La Spinona 2009 Bricco Faset Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This leads with aromatic herb, wild berry and oak-driven spice notes. The tight, taut palate offers licorice, clove, baking spice, crushed sage and dried black cherry flavors but lacks fruit richness. It's framed by firm, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity.
Name: Molino 2014 Teoramo  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with French oak, vanilla, toast and coconut aromas. The oak-derived qualities carry over to palate, along with sour cherry, raspberry compote and espresso flavors while tight, close-grained tannins grip the finish.
Name: Ceretto 2014 Bernardot  (Barbaresco)

Description: Blue flower, crushed mint, dark spice and new leather aromas take center stage in this wine, along with a whiff of hazelnut. The palate doesn't quite live up to the nose, offering dried black cherry, licorice and powdered sage notes and bracing tannins.
Name: La Spinona 2012 Bricco Faset Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This offers oak, toast, espresso, eucalyptus and earthy game aromas. The tight, no-frills palate offers Marasca cherry, mocha, orange peel and roasted coffee bean flavors. Close-grained tannins leave a firm finish.
Name: Collina Serragrilli 2014 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with licorice, chopped herb, eucalyptus and dark spice aromas. The assertive palate offers dried black cherry, coffee bean and sagenotes framed by close-grained tannins.
Name: Nada Fiorenzo 2013 Manzola  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has earthy aromas suggesting underbrush, new leather, menthol and truffle, along with a whiff of medicinal herb. The palate is tightly wound and still rather closed, offering hints of espresso, anise and raw berry framed by drying, close-grained tannins.
Name: Nada Fiorenzo 2013 Montaribaldi  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's underbrush, menthol, dried herb and game aromas follow through to the firm, linear palate, along with sour cherry, pomegranate, espresso and clove flavors. Tightly woven tannins provide grip while a star anise note marks the close.
Name: Piero Busso 2013 San Stunet  (Barbaresco)

Description: French oak, coconut, exotic spice and camphor aromas meld with whiffs of marinated prune in this wine. The solid palate shows cranberry, mint and oak-driven spice framed by assertive close-grained tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Icardi 2014 Montubert  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas suggesting dark berry, exotic spice and toasted oak come together in this. The tight palate is more subdued than the nose, recalling sour berry and powdered herbs alongside astringent tannins.
Name: Prinsi 2014 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas recalling new leather, menthol, toast and raspberry jam meld with a whiff of mocha in this wine. On the taut, assertive palate, tightly wound, bracing tannins and bright acidity hold up sour cherry, cranberry and espresso flavors. A hint of sage underscores the lean, clenching finish.
Name: Battaglio 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Toasted nut and balsamic notes and a whiff of cellar floor dominate the nose of this wine. Although shy in terms of fruit richness, it shows assertive and brooding licorice, espresso, fig and dried cherry notes on the palate. The tannins are close grained.
Name: Pasquale Pelissero 2014 Cascina Crosa  (Barbaresco)

Description: Oak-driven spice, camphor and coconut aromas lead the nose of this wine. Tight, bracing and lacking fruit richness, it shows instead roasted coffee bean, toasted oak, dried cherry and vanilla notes. Astringent, grainy tannins leave a raspy finish.
Name: Sassi San Cristoforo 2012 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This leads with mocha, herb and leather aromas. The palate is still tight and closed but offers red berry, clove and sage hints with some air. Clenched tannins grip the close.
Name: Francesco Rinaldi 2014  Barbaresco

Description: This wine's herb, clove, coconut, leather and camphor aromas slowly take shape. The palate is rather raw, offering unripe sour cherry, cranberry, vanilla, espresso and star anise flavors framed by tight, grainy tannins that leave a raspy finish.
Name: Oddero 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with French oak, exotic spice, coconut and toast aromas. They follow through to the palate, which offers coffee bean and sage notes in place of fruit richness. Grainy tannins leave a raspy finish.
Name: Socré 2013 Roncaglie  (Barbaresco)

Description: Blue flower, menthol, red berry, dried herb and woodshop scents lead the nose of this wine. The linear palate offers cranberry, star anise, espresso and clove flavors, with a backbone of vibrant acidity. Tightly wound tannins grip the finish.
Name: Nada Fiorenzo 2013 Rombone  (Barbaresco)

Description: Prune, leather, oak and balsamic aromas lead the nose of this wine. The palate shows oak, vanilla, coconut and fig flavors alongside close-grained tannins. The fruit is already starting to dry out so drink soon.
Name: Poderi Elia 2012 Serracapelli  (Barbaresco)

Description: Woodshop, camphor and oak-driven spice aromas lead the nose of this wine. The oak sensations carry over to the bracing palate, along with raw cherry, licorice and confectionary notes. Astringent tannins and firm acidity provide an assertive framework, leaving little room for fruit richness.
Name: Prinsi 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's menthol, new leather, toast, eucalyptus and exotic spice aromas lift from the glass. The firm palate shows dried cherry, pomegranate, chopped sage and roasted coffee bean flavors while grainy tannins lend a raspy finish.
Name: Rivetti Massimo 2013 Serraboella  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromas suggesting cellar floor, camphor and paraffin lead the nose of this wine. The camphor note follows through to the lean palate, along with red berry, ground clove and powdered sage flavors. Bracing tannins leave an astringent, drying finish.
Name: Castello di Neive 2014  Barbaresco

Description: Underbrush, grilled herb, camphor and toasted notes lead the nose of this wine. The palate is raw, showing unripe cherry, orange peel and clove flavors alongside bracing tannins.
Name: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2013 Meruzzano  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's oak, toasted nut and menthol aromas carry over to its evolved palate, along with a coffee note and bracing tannins. It's shy on fruit richness and intensity.
Name: Dante Rivetti 2012 Bricco di Neive Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with camphor, medicinal herb and cellar floor aromas. The lean, racy palate shows oak-driven spice and powdered sage flavors framed by raspy tannins.
Name: Molino 2013 Ausario  (Barbaresco)

Description: Oak, underbrush and eucalyptus aromas lead the nose of this wine while its mature-seeming palate offers dried cherry, prune orange zest and clove flavors. Raspy tannins clench the abrupt finish.
Name: Orlando Abrigo 2012 Rongalio  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's camphor and toast aromas follow through to the bracing palate, along with raw sour cherry and espresso notes. Raspy tannins leave an astringent finish.
Name: Paitin 2014 Serraboella  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with moist underbrush, dried herb and light cellar-floor aromas. The lean, racy palate shows Marasca cherry and a rather green note of powdered sage. Bracing tannins clench the abrupt finish.
Name: Paitin 2014 Sorì Paitin  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's oak, weedy underbrush, celery and vegetable broth aromas carry over to the lean palate, along with a roasted coffee bean note. Raspy tannins clench the finish.
Name: La Spinetta 2013 Vigneto Bordini  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with prune, menthol, nail varnish and plastic aromas. The palate is tired and evolved, showing dried black cherry and fig flavors, with a hint of orange peel and worn tannins. It finishes short.
Name: Punset 2012 Basarin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's nose suggests game, forest floor, truffle and leather. It's tight and raw, offering roasted coffee bean, powdered sage, licorice and unripe cherry notes set against a backdrop of raspy tannins and firm acidity.
Name: Pietro Rinaldi 2013 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has dill, minestrone soup, toast and chopped celery aromas. The lean, assertive palate shows oak, raw red fruit and a green note of powdered sage. Grainy tannins leave an astringent finish.
Name: La Spinetta 2014 Starderi  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with camphor and coconut aromas and a whiff of exotic spice. The assertive palate shows dried cherry and clove flavors alongside grainy, drying tannins.
Name: Ada Nada 2012 Cichin Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with French oak and toasted hazelnut aromas. The lean, assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean and licorice flavors alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Pasquale Pelissero 2014 San Giuliano  (Barbaresco)

Description: Grilled vegetable, celery and camphor aromas lead the nose of this wine. The palate is raw, tight and tense, showing oak, roasted coffee bean and bitter sage flavors alongside raspy tannins.
Name: La Spinetta 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's menthol, oak-driven spice, toasted oak and dried herb aromas slowly take shape. The lean palate offers sour cherry and roasted coffee flavors alongside grainy, astringent tannins that leave a tongue-drying finish.
Name: Ca' del Baio 2012 Asili Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Oak, toasted nut and menthol aromas lead the nose of this wine. The tired palate is evolved and dried out, showing coffee bean and green powdered sage notes and raspy, fleeting tannins.
Name: Dezzani 2011 Cancello del Barone Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with toasted oak, eucalyptus and violet aromas. The palate is tight and compressed, showing toasted oak and black spice flavors alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent, mouth-drying finish.
Name: Ricossa 2013  Barbaresco

Description: This wine's toast, oak, scorched earth, burnt rubber and nail varnish aromas carry over to its tired, evolved palate, along with a hint of menthol. Raspy tannins clench the lean finish.
Name: Poderi Elia 2007 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This opens with raw oak and toasted hazelnut aromas. The closed, bracing palate lacks fruit richness, offering instead oak-driven spice notes bolstered with astringent tannins.
Name: Cascina Saria 2013 Colle del Gelso  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's fragrance evokes underbrush, toast, chopped celery and prune. The tight, angular palate offers dried cherry, star anise, espresso and sage notes alongside bracing tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Cantina Terre del Barolo 2012 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Charred earth, toast and menthol aromas come together in this evolved wine. The palate is dried out, showing licorice and powdered sage notes alongside worn tannins.
Name: Salvano 2007 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's grilled herb, celery, dark spice and camphor aromas follow through to its bracing palate. The fruit is completely dried out, leaving toasted notes framed by aggressive, astringent tannins.
Name: Taliano 2010 Tera Mia Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has an unusual mix of aromas, from Asian spice and menthol to weedy underbrush and celery. The muddled palate is slightly fizzy, suggesting sweet and sour sauce, oak-driven spice and dried fruit. Bracing tannins leave a lean, raspy finish.
Name: Punset 2012 San Cristoforo Campo Quadro  (Barbaresco)

Description: This lean and bracing wine offers raw cherry and powdered sage notes. Astringent, raspy tannins leave a dry finish.
Name: Dezzani 2013 Stardè  (Barbaresco)

Description: This has vegetal aromas reminiscent of minestrone soup and chopped celery that carry over to its muddled, fizzy palate.
Name: Taliano 2014 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's damp cellar floor and weedy underbrush aromas carry over to its lean palate. It completely lacks fruit richness and has tannins that are evolved and fleeting.
Name: Battaglio 2012 Serragrilli Riserva  (Barbaresco)

Description: Polished and well structured, this vibrant, savory red hits all the high notes. It opens with enticing red cherry, pressed rose, ground clove and balsamic scents that follow through to the chiseled palate, along with crushed cranberry and licorice notes. Firm but refined tannins and fresh acidity lend impeccable balance and finesse. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Germano Ettore 2013 Prapò  (Barolo)

Description: This gorgeous wine's nose offers a potpourri of fragrant blue flowers, exotic spices, crushed herbs and wild berries. The palate delivers tart red cherry, raspberry compote, orange zest and cinnamon flavors framed by firm, refined tannins and bright acidity. A licorice note caps off the lingering finish. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Albino Rocca 2014 Ronchi  (Barbaresco)

Description: Fragrant blue flower, dark spice, crushed herb and wild berry aromas are front and center on this impressive, structured red. The lively, energetic palate offers cranberry, red cherry, licorice and ground clove flavors set against youthful, noble tannins and firm acidity. A tobacco note lingers on the finish. It's still young and tightly wound but will blossom into a beauty over the next decade. Drink 2023–2045.
Name: Brezza 2013 Sarmassa  (Barolo)

Description: Earthy, enticing violet, pressed rose, new leather crushed mint and game aromas follow through to succulent, savory palate, along with Marasca cherry and cranberry notes. Star anise, white pepper and clove accents add depth while youthfully assertive, refined tannins and vibrant acidity provide an ageworthy framework. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Albino Rocca 2014 Angelo  (Barbaresco)

Description: New leather, red berry, tobacco and menthol are some of the aromas you'll find in this powerfully structured but elegant wine. The firm palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and cinnamon flavors framed by noble, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2025–2045.
Name: Germano Ettore 2013 Cerretta  (Barolo)

Description: This Barolo's violet, rose, menthol and wild berry aromas waft from the glass. It's young and assertive but already shows great class and breeding, delivering succulent red cherry, crushed strawberry, star anise and clove flavors framed by firm, tightly-wound but extremely refined tannins. Fresh acidity balances it all out. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Francesco Rinaldi 2013 Brunate  (Barolo)

Description: Focused, fragrant and refined, this opens with camphor, new leather, crushed herb, dark spice and balsamic aromas. The palate impresses with succulent wild red berry, star anise, tobacco and orange zest alongside firm acidity and tightly wound but refined tannins. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Albino Rocca 2014 Ovello Vigna Loreto  (Barbaresco)

Description: Forest floor, new leather, eucalyptus and dried herb aromas lead the nose while the structured, polished palate offers crushed Marasca cherry, pomegranate, white pepper and licorice flavors. Firm, refined tannins provide elegant support. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Prunotto 2011 Bussia Vigna Colonnello Riserva  (Barolo)

Description: Leather, truffle, grilled herb, purple flower and perfumed berry aromas take shape in this fragrant red. The vibrant palate is loaded with finesse, delivering red cherry, cranberry, cinnamon and clove flavors while nervous acidity and youthfully assertive, refined tannins provide support and balance. A star anise note wraps up the finish. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Cascina delle Rose 2014 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

Description: Wild berry, aromatic herb, crushed blue flower and exotic spice aromas lead the way in this full-bodied wine. It delivers ripe but elegant Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and vanilla hints framed by taut, fine-grained tannins that lend structure and finesse. Drink 2021–2033.
Name: Cordero di Montezemolo 2013 Monfalletto  (Barolo)

Description: Balsam, leather, perfumed berry, pressed blue flower and dark spice aromas lead the way in this elegant, vibrant red. The savory, focused palate offers red cherry, tobacco, licorice and ground clove flavors set against a backdrop of bright acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 2022–2034.
Name: Giuseppe Cortese 2014 Rabajà  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's grilled herb, dill, tobacco and violet aromas unfold in the glass. The palate has nice length and balance, offering juicy red cherry, raspberry, smoke, star anise and game notes, with firm, noble tannins and fresh acidity.
Name: Musso 2014 Pora  (Barbaresco)

Description: This elegant, fragrant red boasts wild berry, baking spice, menthol and aromatic herb aromas. Balanced and focused, the palate delivers crushed raspberry, red cherry, cinnamon and of vanilla flavors framed by firm, polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2013 Arborina  (Barolo)

Description: This wine's enticing rose, blue flower, menthol and herb scents come together in the glass. On the taut, precise palate, tightly knit, refined tannins enwrap crunchy red cherry and juicy cranberry flavors. White pepper and clove notes add depth, while bright acidity lends balance. Drink 2023–2035.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2013 Castelletto  (Barolo)

Description: This savory, firmly structured, full-bodied red opens with subtle dark berry, rose petal, pipe tobacco and crushed herb aromas. It delivers layers of juicy Marasca cherry, black raspberry, cinnamon and clove flavors, buttressed by youthfully assertive but refined tannins and nicely balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Ascheri 2013 Ascheri  (Barolo)

Description: New leather, pressed rose, violet, baking spice and crushed herb are just some of the aromas you'll find in this textbook Barolo. Firm yet loaded with finesse, the palate offers red cherry, strawberry compote, cinnamon and clove notes set against a backdrop of youthfully austere tannins and bright acidity. A licorice note lingers on the finish. Give it time to fully bloom. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Francesco Rinaldi 2013 Cannubi  (Barolo)

Description: This wine's new leather forest floor, menthol, pressed rose and exotic spice scents emerge in the glass. Full-bodied and focused, the palate delivers layers of cherry, pomegranate, crushed herb, licorice and cinnamon flavors. Bright acidity and youthful tannins provide balance and an ageworthy structure. Drink 2023–2038.
Name: Curto Marco 2013 La Foia  (Barolo)

Description: New leather, dark berry, fragrant blue flower, rose and baking spice aromas take shape in the glass. The smooth, delicious palate doles out juicy raspberry, crushed black cherry, star anise and cinnamon flavors, with polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Mirafiore 2013 Paiagallo  (Barolo)

Description: Dark-skinned berry, exotic spice, blue flower and wild herb aromas take center stage in this Barolo. Full-bodied and loaded with finesse, the taut, precise palate offers juicy red cherry, cranberry, star anise and clove flavors framed by firm, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Mauro Veglio 2013 Gattera  (Barolo)

Description: Violet, iris, perfumed berry, pine forest and baking spice aromas mingle in this fragrant, precise wine. The linear, focused palate offers cranberry, pomegranate, licorice and white pepper flavors alongside a backbone of vibrant acidity and youthfully austere tannins. Give it time to fully come together. Drink 2023–2043.
Name: Brezza 2013 Castellero  (Barolo)

Description: This enticing and alluring wine opens with lovely crushed mint, new leather, iris and culinary spice aromas. The savory palate shows juicy Marasca cherry, ripe raspberry, cinnamon and pink peppercorn flavors while firm, refined tannins and fresh acidity provide balance and structure. A licorice note accents the finish.
Name: Boffa 2014 Ovello  (Barbaresco)

Description: Aromatic herb, woodland berry, violet, citrus zest and tilled soil scents take shape in the glass. The succulent, linear palate doles out cranberry, red cherry white pepper and star anise flavors, bolstered by a backbone of firm, refined tannins and bright acidity.
Name: La Ca' Nova 2014 Montestefano  (Barbaresco)

Description: This wine's incense, French oak, woodland berry and iris aromas slowly take shape in the glass. On the firmly structured, focused palate, vanilla, menthol and espresso notes accent its red cherry and pomegranate core. Close-grained tannins leave a firm, tight finish, needing time to unwind. Drink 2023–2033.
Name: Cordero di Montezemolo 2013 Enrico VI  (Barolo)

Description: This wine's rose petal, herb, dark spice and woodland berry aromas slowly take shape, along with a whiff of new leather. The full-bodied, energetic palate delivers juicy red cherry, cranberry, clove, cinnamon and orange peel flavors while youthfully austere tannins and vibrant acidity provide the framework. Drink 2023–2033.
